title: Marketing Data Scientist
description:
Description
Do you dream of data predictions and increasing KPIs? Do you want to be part of the foundation of a scientific group at the core of Marketing?
Scopely's Barcelona office is searching for a Data Scientist with talent and analytics experience to join our Marketing Analytics team. You‚Äôll be the one who embraces the machine learning power to help the engineers and analysts to improve their projects, and add some data intelligence to the marketing decisions.
What You Will Do:
Work inside Marketing Analytics and partner with Marketing teams to discover and deliver projects to improve our understanding of User Acquisition (UA) and Non-UA activities on the performance of games marketing.Work with marketing data engineers and analysts to plan, develop and implement best models to answer deep business questions.Work together with other data scientists to develop and promote best practices in analytics and experimentation inside Marketing Analytics.Preferred experience in applying marketing modeling techniques e.g. media mix modeling, time series forecasting, segmentation / clustering.
What You Will Need:
Intellectual curiosity, analytical rigor, hard-working and a good business intuition are a must! 2 or more years of experience as a Data Scientist preferable at a top-tier institution or firm. Previous experience in marketing analytics or user acquisition strongly preferred (Familiarity with CPI, ROAS, ARPU, Retention and LTV is a plus)B.S. (Masters degree a plus) from a top institution in a quantitative or scientific field (Math/Stats, Economics, CS, Engineering, Physics, Psychology or similar)Professional experience applying data science, analytics, machine learning and computational techniques. Preferred experience in applying marketing modeling techniques e.g. media mix modeling, time series forecasting, segmentation / clustering.Professional experience programming using R, SQL, python or similar in large datasets and implementing models in production.Excellent communication skills to understand business needs of cross-functional stakeholders, deliver findings and recommendations, as well as to drive collaboration.
About Scopely
Scopely is a leading mobile games company home to many top-grossing, award-winning franchises including Monopoly‚Ñ¢ GO!, Stumble Guys, Star Trek‚Ñ¢ Fleet Command, Looney Tunes‚Ñ¢ World of Mayhem, WWE Champions 2019, The Walking Dead: Road To Survival‚Ñ¢, YAHTZEE¬Æ With Buddies and Wheel of Fortune¬Æ: Free Play, among others. Scopely creates rewarding, immersive games that empower a directed-by-consumer experience. Founded in 2011, Scopely is fueled by a world-class team and a proprietary technology platform that personalizes gameplay at scale across one of the most diversified portfolios in the west. Recognized in Fast Company‚Äôs ‚ÄòWorld‚Äôs Most Innovative Companies‚Äô and #2 on Deloitte‚Äôs ‚ÄòTechnology Fast 500‚Äô as one of the fastest-growing companies in North America, Scopely has achieved more than $1 billion in lifetime revenue by creating game experiences that are an important part of people‚Äôs lives. With global operations in Los Angeles, Barcelona and Dublin (DIGIT Games Studios), and additional studios in seven countries across four continents, Scopely has raised more than $250 million in financing from global entertainment and technology investors.
Scopely is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, family or parental status, gender identity, veteran, or disability status, or other protected status.

title: Data Business Analyst
description:
Data Business Analyst ‚Äì Focus Data Cataloguing, Master Data Management (MDM) and Reference Data Management (RDM)
Do you have a passion for Data? Are you an experienced Business Analyst with a data focus? Would you like to be part of driving a change in how AstraZeneca Operations works with data management?
About AstraZeneca
AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven Biopharmaceutical business that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialization of prescription medicines for some of the world‚Äôs most serious disease. We‚Äôre more than one of the world‚Äôs leading pharmaceutical companies.
At AstraZeneca, we put our patients first and we‚Äôre dedicated to being a Great Place to Work, where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There‚Äôs no better place to make a difference in medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development.
About Our Team
We lead AstraZeneca‚Äôs transformation in Operations IT, fusing our digital and data capabilities in strong partnership with our business to make it happen. Accelerating our business as we empower the core functions to work better and faster. By partnering across the business, we‚Äôre leveraging our leading technologies and exploring data to make data driven decisions and enabling the business to reach the right outcomes, quicker.
We challenge, innovate and break away from the norm to find bold new ways of simplifying and automating our business processes. Always passionate about leading the way for sustainable digital healthcare. This cannot be done in isolation. Empowerment and working together as one, giving our diverse team of specialists the freedom to explore and express their ideas and views. A place to realize the true impact and difference data and digital can make.
What You‚Äôll Do
As a Data Business Analyst ‚Äì Focus Data Cataloguing, Data Quality technology, Master Data Management (MDM) and Reference Data Management (RDM) you will be part of our Global Data Team in Operations IT and be our thought leader for these technologies in close collaboration with our enterprise platform teams and solution architects as well as our business owners ‚Äì Operations Data Office.
In the role you will:
Collaborate with our Sr Data BA‚Äôs and Solutions Architects to define the future technology strategy and roadmap for MDM, RDM, Data Quality and data Cataloging.Collaborate and partner with our Data Office when agreeing the future approach in Data Quality, MDM, RDM and Data CataloguingYou will help drive the implementation and roll out of the technologies within Operations in collaboration with PMs, BA‚Äôs and business users.Where technology is in use, you will lead the improvement work in collaboration with the business users towards the enterprise platform teams.Define ways of working and RACIs, aligning with the enterprise definitions, and specify what this means for Operations. Once these are in place you will be active in driving continuous improvements and simplificationsReaching the right results through business analysis on a variety of different system landscapes, interpreting what will be the right future solutions, collaborating and influencing with both different user groups as well as global IT to solution and implement in line with our standards.In this role, you will be part of setting standards for processes and capturing demand/requirements for the Global IT functions that support Data across Operations.Ensuring that the methodology, quality and compliance standards contribute to internal processes and standards for business analysis and design.
Essential Skills
To be successful in this role you will demonstrate good communication and presentation skills as well as a high customer focus.As a person, you dare to challenge, influence and negotiate.Evidence experience in leading and facilitating changeEvidence experience of Data Cataloguing, Data Quality technology, MDM and RDMBe confident in business analysis and process design in a complex business situation.A solid foundation of general technical knowledgeStrong Collaboration skillsFluent in English both verbal and writtenGood written documentation skills and Experience of working in a regulated environment.Exposure to working with Information Flows and Data ArchitectureStrong engagement, communication and partner leadership skillsExperience in virtual collaboration to lead, shape and develop innovative solutions.A passion for data processes and their importance in driving business performance
Desirable Skills
Degree in a relevant subject area or formal certification in business analysis practice.Design thinking and facilitation skills.Lean training.Experience of working in a global organization with a complex/geographical context.SAP Experience (SAP MDM; SAP MDG; SAP ECC)Collibra or other Data Catalogue technologyMDM technology such as ReltioDQ Tooling
WHY JOIN US?
We‚Äôre a network of entrepreneurial self-starters who contribute to something far bigger. There‚Äôs a diversity of expertise in our Technology group that‚Äôs unique to AstraZeneca ‚Äì it allows us to dive deep into exploring new leading-edge technology. We enable AstraZeneca to perform at its peak by delivering world-class technology and data solutions. Our work unlocks the potential of science. We optimise and evolutionise AstraZeneca by maximising efficiencies and finding new ways to drive productivity. From automation to data simplification. We‚Äôre not afraid to take ownership and run with it. Empowered with unrivalled freedom. A place to be open and transparent ‚Äì we speak up, think creatively and share ideas. Our diverse contributions help us to make better decisions. But we have a constant drive to innovate, and an appreciation for high standards. It takes challenging the status quo to add value in our ever-evolving environment. We love it here because put simply, we make a meaningful impact.
Technology at AstraZeneca is a home for purposeful disruptors!
SO, WHAT‚ÄôS NEXT? 
Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

title: Data Management Officer
description:
Hola Consultores, S.L somos una empresa especializada en la provisi√≥n de Servicios TIC e Ingenier√≠a para la gesti√≥n empresarial. Trabajamos dise√±ando soluciones a medida de las necesidades de nuestros clientes.
Somos una empresa 2.0 innovadora donde las personas son muy importantes para nosotros. La √©tica, transparencia, imparcialidad e independencia forman parte de nuestra filosof√≠a.
üì£BARCELONA,Estamos en la b√∫squeda de perfiles Data Management Officer, para el sector ‚úàÔ∏è.
Role:The Data Management Officer is responsible for overview and carrying out data management tasks of projects.The data management officer plays a crucial role in determining the organization‚Äôs data needs and developing strategies to meet those needs. This includes working with other departments to understand their data requirements and developing a data governance framework to ensure that data is properly managed and used. The data management officer is also responsible for developing and implementing data architecture, which is a blueprint for how data is organized and stored within the organization.

title: Data Analyst
description:
What Is Exoticca?
Do you like traveling? Do you enjoy the exotic? Do you like strong challenges? If the answer is YES, welcome to Exoticca!
Exoticca is a company that started in 2013 by professionals specialized in the creation and online distribution of voyages. Our mission is to offer our clients the possibility to visit the most beautiful and stimulating places on our planet, through the best holiday packages, at unbelievable prices. For more comfort, our customers can find out more about our trips and book them instantly in a matter of minutes through our website, avoiding the usual long exchanges of email, meetings, or calls required by more traditional travel agencies.
At Exoticca we are looking for people who want to offer their best to create unforgettable experiences for our customers. We are a young, dynamic, multicultural team of 300+ people, in rapid international growth, seeking new partners to help us create the best and most forward-thinking travel company of our generation.
We are a highly ambitious and well-funded start-up, backed by top national and international investors that have also participated in the growth of other success stories, such as SinDelantal.com, or Idealista, among others.
What is our proporsal?
The Data Analyst will be responsible for the development of a strong analytical foundation of the newly created Revenue Management team, in the Product department. He will be part of a quickly developing team, helping in the implementation of a new top-quality Revenue model in the industry.
What Wil You Do
Perform complex analysis related to precise business questions and deliver actionable insights. Liaise with the company Data team, and collaborate with Data engineers and Data scientists in the companyBe the point of reference for any matter related to data and analysis within the Revenue teamCollecting and interpreting data from different sources in our Data LakeProvide business with meaningful dashboards or other toolsDesign, develop and maintain automated processes that help business improve manual workflow
Requirements
Quantitative degree (IT, Mathematics, Physics,Statistics). Strong knowledge of SQLAt least 2 years of experience with programming languages such as R and especially Python for data analysis and modellingExperience building dashboards with Data visualisation tools (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI,..)Passion for building things from scratchHigh level of English
Benefits
Competitive compensation package in line with job responsibilities and experienceAdditionally, we propose the use of flexible compensation management for diet, transportation, and private health insurance with CobeeHybrid work model: Offices in the heart of Barcelona (right next to Pla√ßa Catalunya)Permanent contract from the startTravel packages at reduced prices as perk for employees!Unlimited coffee, language lessons, quarterly teamwork activities, global biannual partiesAnd last but not least, becoming part of a fun and motivated multicultural team at an agile and rapid growing organization!
Exoticca is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusiveness are our core. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under European, country, or local law.

title: Data Analyst Intern
description:
What You'll Do:
 Client insights: you will analyse complex data from multiple sources to understand the performance of our advertisers campaigns and generate innovative and impactful insights Business strategy: you will partner with the commercial team to help drive client strategy and direction Reporting tools and metrics: you will develop and scale reports and metrics that will present actionable insights to teams across the business and strategic leadership teams Testing: you will design, monitor and analyse A/B tests to understand better how our products work for our clients Collaborative projects: you will work on ad hoc projects with different teams to automate analyses globally, improve our internal processes and our way of working and scale knowledge across the company Strategic Big Data Synergies: this doesn‚Äôt actually mean anything, but we‚Äôre happy you read this description until here. If you‚Äôre open to play Among Us with us, we‚Äôll be happy to have you!

Who You Are:
 You are a logical thinker and are interested in analytics You have previous experience in problem solving You are business-minded and want to drive business strategy using data You are a strong team player and feel comfortable in a highly collaborative environment Some experience in SQL, Python, Tableau would be a plus. If not, a willingness to learn it! You are fluent in English and are able to communicate about complex subjects to non-technical stakeholders Must be eligible to work in Spain full-time with no restriction. (you‚Äôre a data wizard Harry)!

Why you'll love us
 Competitive compensation Career advancement and global mobility opportunities Medical and dental insurance to maintain your client-facing smile Generous vacation policy Video and sports games area when you need a break Daily lunch vouchers to keep you going

How you‚Äôll be working
 Office: open space Flexible teleworking/work-from-home policy (0-5 days per week) Nearly exclusively on-screen work (laptop) Special ergonomic device possible Semi flexible-working hours: 7am-10am to 4pm-7pm If you need special working hour flexibility, we‚Äôre open to discussing it

We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform. At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We work together to achieve our goals, push boundaries, and share successes. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We will set you up for success and empower you to have a meaningful impact in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary.

title: Data Analyst Intern
description:
Description

Wallbox is a global company, dedicated to changing the way the world uses energy. We do this by creating smart charging systems that combine innovative technology with outstanding design and manage the communication between vehicle, grid, building, and charger.

Founded in 2015, with headquarters in Barcelona and selling already in over 80+ countries, our mission is to facilitate the adoption of electric vehicles today to make more sustainable use of energy tomorrow. Our talent has no borders - we welcome over 1K Wallboxers from over 45 nationalities in Europe, Asia, and the Americas!

We‚Äôre the first Spanish unicorn listed on the NYSE and have been recently named among LinkedIn‚Äôs top 3 Spanish startups.

At Wallbox you come first, so we offer a tailored career plan that aligns with your professional goals.

Our journey is not plain sailing - it requires proactive, flexible, and top-performing individuals who are committed to the world of sustainable mobility. But one thing is for sure - it's going to be a fun ride!

The question is: are you ready to change the world with us?

You will:
Engage with internal stakeholders to gain an understanding of the problems that need to be solved and gather requirements for analytical tasks Model and evaluate user and device behaviour in order to identify potential value of planned projectsEnable data-driven product and business development through analysis of device, in-app, and external dataExtract, load, and reconcile large data sets from multiple system platforms and sources.

Benefits
Internship agreement of six months with the opportunity extend based on performance.Flexible working hoursHybrid workFriday¬¥s afternoons off!Unlimited coffee to fuel your mornings.Monthly ‚ÄúAll Hands‚Äù & other team events.International environment: Over 45 different nationalities.No suits! Unless it‚Äôs Carnival or Halloween.

Please submit your CV in English

title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
description:
Job description:

We are looking for a talented and motivated colleague to join our team in the Global Commercial Excellence department of ZF Aftermarket near district 22 in Barcelona (Districte de la innovaci√≥).

 

In this role, you will be responsible for developing and implementing strategies to drive revenue growth, improve market share, and enhance customer satisfaction. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to develop and execute go-to-market plans, identify new business opportunities, and optimize pricing and product offerings.

The aftermarket environment is undergoing a massive shift in electrified, connected, intelligent, and shared mobility. At ZF, we are looking for talented professionals who are passionate about data-driven innovation and eager to help shape the future of the automotive industry. If you are a driven, curious, and dedicated professional looking to join a dynamic and innovative team. Join ZF and be part of a team that is at the forefront of automotive innovation!

 

Your tasks:

 Prototype advanced analytics data products (models for business recommendations, segmentations, optimizations & statistical forecasts) across marketing, sales, pricing & logistics. In order to create the relevant algorithms which can improve how the business operates ‚Äì the data scientists follow a series of steps. This cycle represents the data scientist responsibilities:  Business Understanding - acquire understanding of the business problem with the help of business analyst, by asking the right questions. Data Understanding ‚Äì Lead the exploration of the data. In order to acquire knowledge which will contribute to the success of the models. Modelling ‚Äì Create hypothesis of which models could fit the data, test the different hypothesis, find optimal parameters. Results ‚Äì data scientist will share prototype results and get feedback to have its model improved. Cycle will be repeated until the maturity is enough to be accepted for business use.    

Your profile:

 Strong background in Computing and Statistics (academical and/or from experience). min. 2 years of professional experience with unsupervised and supervised models including tree-based models and linear models in Python, R & Pyspark. Experience with (Deep) Neural Networks and Bayesian modelling - desirable. Knowledge of databases (ex. Oracle, AWS S3). Knowledge of Big Data platforms (ex. Databricks, GCP, Cloudera). Willingness to work in a team, dealing with uncertainty and ambiguity, business acumen, communication (mostly data storytelling).  

The position is part of the ZF Global Employee Referral Program.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Position Snapshot 

Location: Nestl√© Global Hub in Barcelona, Spain‚ÄØ 

Stream:‚ÄØIT Analytics, Data and Integration

Permanent Contract‚ÄØ

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree‚ÄØin Math, Statistics, Physics, Operations Research, Econometrics or Data Science (or equivalent)

Fluent English 

About You

Are you an expert in applying advanced analytics to solve marketing and sales business problems? Do you have a passion for optimizing marketing spend and trade investments to drive business growth? If so, we want you to join our team as a Senior Data Scientist!

A day in the life of a Senior Data Scientist 

As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be responsible for using advanced analytics to provide robust measurements of marketing and trade investment across different business models, product categories, and varied geographies. You will work closely with stakeholders in European zone to provide guidance on how to best optimize and allocate marketing and trade investments to support the delivery of our commercial strategy.

What you'll do:
Share your experience and knowledge and build Nestl√©'s internal modelling capability. Sartner with marketing and commercial stakeholders to build and deliver a portfolio of advanced analytics initiatives. Work cross-functionally to identify and answer business problems/ and questions using appropriate modeling techniques on available data. Evangelize and provide advisory services around data science capabilities and knowledge within Nestl√© and work with large, complex data sets and solve non-standard problems.‚ÄØ 

We offer you

We offer more than just a job. We put people first and inspire you to become the best version of yourself.‚ÄØ
Great benefits‚ÄØincluding competitive salary and a comprehensive social benefits package. We have one of the most advantageous pension plans on the market, as well as flexible remuneration with tax advantages: health insurance, restaurant card, mobility plan, etc.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ Personal and professional growth‚ÄØthrough ongoing training and constant career opportunities reflecting our conviction that people are our most important asset.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ Hybrid working environment with flexible working scheme. Our state-of-the-art campus is dog friendly and equipped with a medical center, canteen, and areas to co-create network and chill!‚ÄØ‚ÄØ Recreation activities‚ÄØsuch as yoga, Zumba, etc. and a wide range of volunteering activities.

Minimum qualifications:
You are educated to BSc or MSc level (or equivalent) in Math, Statistics, Physics, Operations Research, Econometrics, or Data Science.You have proven experience of handling large datasets and reporting automation and be able to demonstrate an excellent understanding of marketing mix modelling and price & promotion analyticsYou should have the ability to network and influence at senior levels both internally and externally and be able to interpret data and explain business performance in an easy-to-understand way that tells a story to key stakeholders.You have proven experience of working in a matrix environment, achieving results through effective influencing and collaboration.You have advanced MS Excel, SQL, R, Python (or similar) experience. 

Bonus Points If You:
You have experience with dynamic linear models/state space models is of particular interest.

About The IT Hub

At Nestl√© IT, we are a diverse, global team of IT professionals in the biggest health, nutrition and wellness company of the world. We strive to create an environment where people are valued for who they are. We innovate every day through future ready technologies to create opportunities for Nestl√© to delight consumers, customers and employees alike. We collaborate with partners around the world to deliver tangible value at global scale. We continuously work to develop our people to be future ready.

About Nestl√©

We are Nestl√©, the largest food and beverage company in the world, with a presence in more than 185 countries. With net sales of CHF 94.4 billion in 2022, the company has over 291,000 employees and 418 factories in 85 countries. Our values are based on respect: respect for ourselves, respect for others, respect for diversity, and respect for our future. Nestl√© is dedicated to offering high-quality food and beverage products and services that contribute to the nutrition, health, and well-being of people, pets, and the planet. Additionally, it is committed to being a leading company in sustainability and achieving net zero greenhouse gas emissions by 2050. Want to learn more? Visit us at: www.nestle.com

We encourage the diversity of applicants across gender, age, ethnicity, nationality, sexual orientation, social background, religion or belief and disability.

Step outside your comfort zone; share your ideas, way of thinking and working to make a difference to the world, every single day. You own a piece of the action ‚Äì make it count.

About Analytics Service Line In Nestl√©

We are a diverse, international team of Analytical professionals applying advanced analytics solutions in the world‚Äôs biggest health, nutrition and wellness company.

As an internal consultancy, we collaborate with our colleagues in sales & marketing around the world to deliver value in the areas of marketing effectiveness, and price & promotion effectiveness.

Join our IT Hub at Nestl√© #beaforceforgood 

How we will proceed:

You send us your CV ‚Üí We contact relevant applicants ‚Üí Interviews ‚Üí Feedback ‚Üí Job Offer communication to the Finalist ‚Üí First working day

title: Head of Data Analytics
description:
We are currently seeking a Head of Data Analytics to join our team at Kiwi.com. Our mission is to build a world-class analytics function that delivers impactful insights, drives business value, and enables informed decision-making across our organization.

In this role, you will lead our Analytics teams, focusing on developing and implementing advanced analytics solutions to address business challenges in a customer-centric environment. At Kiwi, we believe that the training and development of data analysts and analytic teams is crucial to ensuring personal growth, consistency, and high standards.

You will have the opportunity to shape and recruit our Analytics team, establishing best practices and modern software development techniques that enable us to learn, build, and scale our solutions. We are committed to innovation at scale and speed, and we believe that data analytics is a key element of our culture of learning, adaptation, and experimentation.

Working closely with business leaders and analytical team leads, you will serve as the lead analytics expert on a range of use cases, from ad-hoc advanced analytics solutions to small-scale bespoke dashboards to multivariate experimentation in a production environment. By leveraging data to provide insights, you will help drive business value and enable informed decision-making across the organization.

Responsibilities 

Building and leading an analytics community: You will develop and lead a distributed community of Data Analysts across the organization, promoting collaboration and knowledge sharing to ensure consistency in analytics practices and excellence in analytical output.Providing training and development opportunities: You will create and implement training and development programs to enhance the skills and expertise of our analytics community, ensuring that they have access to the tools, technologies, and training needed to deliver high-quality insights and solutions.Creating consistency and excellence: You will establish and enforce standards for analytics practices, ensuring that all analyses are conducted using best practices and that insights are communicated in a clear and actionable way.Providing career development and guidance: You will provide career development opportunities and guidance to members of the analytics community, helping them to identify career paths that align with their interests and skills, and supporting their growth and development within the organization.Developing and implementing advanced analytics solutions: You will lead the development and implementation of advanced analytics solutions to address complex business problems, leveraging cutting-edge technologies and methodologies to provide insights and drive business value.Partnering with business leaders: You will partner with business leaders across the organization to identify opportunities for analytics to drive value, provide insights, and inform decision-making, helping to shape the direction of the business and drive growth.

Technical Requirements 

Experience in computer science, mathematics, statistics, or a related field.Strong SQL skills for data querying and manipulation.Proficiency in dashboard and report development tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or Looker.Knowledge of data modeling concepts and database design.Experience with ETL processes and data integration.Strong analytical skills and ability to evaluate data quality, identify data issues, and recommend solutions.Experience with experimentation, A/B testing, and statistical hypothesis testing.Ability to communicate complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.

What you will need? 

Experience in data analytics, with experience in a leadership role.Strong leadership skills with experience in managing and leading teams of data analysts.Ability to build and foster a collaborative culture and create communities of practice to share best practices and promote knowledge sharing.Experience in developing and implementing data analytics strategies and roadmaps aligned with business goals and objectives.Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and stakeholders in a fast-paced environment.Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively communicate insights and recommendations to technical and non-technical stakeholders.Ability to evaluate and recommend emerging data analytics technologies, tools, and methodologies to improve performance and drive innovation.Understanding of data governance, data quality, and data privacy regulations.Ability to identify and develop talent, mentor and coach team members, and provide opportunities for career growth and development.Strong business acumen with the ability to understand business processes and translate business requirements into data analytics solutions.

What We Offer You 

The opportunity to join our Phantom Stock scheme.We give our employees a freedom to choose between the environment of work from home and our modern office located in the centric neighborhood (Passeig de Gr√†cia) in Cloudworks coworking space where you can enjoy Kiwi.com‚Äôs private office space, two common terraces with great views, common coworking activities (yoga, games, etc.), free refreshments and shower.We also enjoy benefits, such as flexible working hours, 30 paid vacation days, sick days, private medical insurance, Employee Assistance Program, GymForLess membership, the annual subscription for El Bicing. Flight vouchers to celebrate your kiwi anniversaries.The latest version of Hardware from Apple or Microsoft based on your preferences.We offer unlimited contracts within a forward-thinking and ambitious company.Relocation package (including visa transfer support).Dogs and parties are welcome in our offices.
Interested? Join us and hack the traditional ways of travel!

Kiwi.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, uniformed services, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

Throughout the recruitment process and for some time after it‚Äôs finished, we‚Äôre going to process your Personal Data. You can find all the necessary information in our Privacy Policy available at: https://jobs.kiwi.com/recruitment-privacy-policy/ .

title: Data Analyst
description:
Coniq is a dynamic, high growth UK-based SaaS company that provides total customer engagement and loyalty services to many of the world‚Äôs leading property developers, shopping centers and retailers. Coniq powers well over ¬£1 billion of sales annually for its clients, with more than 20 million consumers shopping at 1,800 brands in 24 countries worldwide, and has offices in Europe, the US and the Middle East.
Coniq is looking for a Data Analst to join our brilliant team in Barcelona. We have a robust data infrastructure and we need someone to help us develop our industry-leading product offerings and capabilities to the next level. If you‚Äôre looking for a position which will offer variety, complexity, responsibility and challenges, this could be the role for you and we‚Äôd love to start a conversation!
Responsibilities
Develop the roadmap for our client facing reporting and dashboardsInteract with the internal client success teamCommunicate with clients to understand complex requirementsInterpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reportsAcquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systemsIdentify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data setsFilter and ‚Äúclean‚Äù data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problemsWork with management to prioritize business and information needs
Requirements
You should be comfortable working in a multi-disciplinary, agile team. You are used to designing reports, analysing data, developing insights, implementing best practice and participating in group design sessions. You have experience of designing and implementing reporting dashboards and are able to pick up on key discussion points for communication with stakeholders. You can operate as a data and reporting expert with internal and external stakeholders.
These are the skills you will be able to bring to the Coniq team:
2-5 years‚Äô experience as a data analystAt least 2 years experience with SQL and relational databases (MySQL knowledge a bonus)Experience with a data visualisation tool a mustComfortable working with data across a range of sources, shapes and sizes, and you are confident turning this into quality informationInterest in engaging with colleagues to define reporting requirements from clients and interallyInterest in proactively looking at data to pull out insights which can be fed back to clients or internallyAbility to stay on top of current business and industry trends around data prep and visualisation technologiesEffectively use Tableau and related technologies to deliver quality analytics and data insight to our clientsStrong communicator, with the ability to work across the different business teams to understand requirements and deliver Python knowledge a bonusExperience with Tableau a bonusExperience with Sisense a bonusInterest in growing into a team management roleRelevant university degree a bonus
Benefits
We offer a generous package, including:
Competitive salaryCompany stock options25 days holiday plus statutory holidaysA day off to celebrate your birthdayA day off for your wellbeingShorter working hours on FridaysA strong company values framework, including paid leave for volunteering with approved charitiesRegular team building activitiesTraining & development allowanceNew employee referral scheme
This is a unique opportunity to join a VC-funded high growth SaaS business where we all share a passion to work together to build a great product and a great company. We are proud of our company culture and invest a great deal into making sure that we promote Diversity in the workplace. Together we come from over 20 nationalities and as a tech business, we are very proud of 50/50 gender split.

title: Data Engineer
description:
What is Exoticca?Do you like traveling? Do you enjoy the exotic? Do you like strong challenges? If the answer is YES, welcome to Exoticca!
Exoticca is a company that started in 2013 by professionals specialized in the creation and online distribution of voyages. Our mission is to offer our clients the possibility to visit the most beautiful and stimulating places in our planet, though the best holiday packages, at unbelievable prices. For more comfort, our customers can find out more about our trips and book them instantly in a matter of minutes through our website, avoiding the usual long exchanges of email, meetings, or calls required by more traditional travel agencies.
At Exoticca we are looking for people who want to offer their best to create unforgettable experiences for our customers. We are a young, dynamic, multicultural team of 140+ people, in rapid international growth, seeking for new partners to help us create the best and most forward-thinking travel company of our generation. 
We are a highly ambitious and well-funded start-up, backed by top national and international investors that have also participated in the growth of other success stories, such as Glovo, SinDelantal.com, or Idealista, among others.

What about the Data team?At Exoticca, the Data team is the main responsible of making data essential in key decision making across the whole organization. We capture vasts amount of data from multiple customer touch points, spanning from consideration and booking, to pre-travel, travel, and post-travel. Combined with our customer-centric approach, we believe that our data-driven culture is the key to deliver unparalleled product & services, that wow our customers and create unforgettable experiences to be remembered for a lifetime.
Join us as a Data Engineer in order to achieve such ambitious goals, our Data team works together with other departments, such as Marketing, Flight Product, Travel Product, Sales or Customer Experience, to uncover the most valuable insights our data can deliver and convert them into actual company initiatives, business decisions, or product features. There are a myriad of opportunities for using data to learn more about our customers, to grow sales, increase customer satisfaction, optimize & automate processes, and much more. We can‚Äôt wait to have you on board!
Which will be your main responsibilities?Be part of a team that takes end-to-end responsibility for designing, building, and maintaining batch & real-time data pipelines and data solutions.Create solutions to enable diagnostic and predictive analytics capabilities.Research, evaluate, and propose different data solutions in an agnostic way.Select, setup and manage tools & technologies to build and support a robust data infrastructure.Propose and help decide on the data modeling and schema design of our data stores.

Which are the job requirements?2+ years of work experience in a similar role as a Data Engineer.Experience working with Python.Experience with relational databases , data warehouses, data lakes and data marts.Familiarity with cloud-based, distributed systems and orchestrated ETL processes (AWS is preferred).Experience in data management, integrating and transforming data from multiple sources, including internal DBs and APIs.Fluency in English.
Benefits:Competitive compensation package in line with job responsibilities and experience.Additionally, we propose the use of flexible compensation management for diet, transportation, private health insurance, and personal training purposes.Hybrid work model/full remote: you can work from home or the office at your convenience. Offices in the heart of Barcelona (right next to Pla√ßa Catalunya).Permanent contract from the start.Travel packages at reduced prices!.Referral bonus, if you bring people as talented as you.Unlimited coffee, team lunches, English lessons.And last but not least, becoming part of a fun and motivated multicultural team at an agile and rapid growing organization!.
Exoticca is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusiveness are our core. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under European, country, or local law.

title: Senior Data Analyst - Growth (They/She/He)
description:
About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, you‚Äôll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives‚Ä¶ all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Your Work-life Opportunity

We are looking for a world-class Sr Growth Analyst to become part of our Regional team. Are you able to translate data into actionable insights? Are you looking for a challenging experience in the fast and rapidly changing environment helping to build a product that will disrupt the On-demand market? If your answer is YES we are looking forward to meeting you.

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Understand business needs and create insightful analysis helping your team to make the right decisionsDrive projects end-to-end translating business challenges into insights and actionsIdentify growth opportunities to increase our user base, step change retention rates and maximize profitabilityTake ownership of the reporting of KPIs by creating customized tools and using the available onesEnsure these tools are scalable and up-to-dateAssist your colleagues in gaining access to the right data
You Have
3-4 years of work experience on analytical roles leading analysis and turning insights into actionsNinja expertise with Excel / Google Sheets is a mustSQL proficiency is mandatory / Python is a plusKnowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker or Qlikview is a plusMust have strong business acumen and passion for end-to-end project management (from ideation and analysis into implementation).Hands-on attitude is a must. You‚Äôll have to roll up your sleeves!Proficiency in English is a must
Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing equity plan (if applicable)Private health insuranceMonthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products and zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders!Discounted gym membershipsFlexible time off (take the time you need) and hybrid working model (own your time)Online therapy and wellbeing benefit
What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quicklyGood Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openlyStay Humble: Self-aware and open to learningCare: Uplift people and the planetGlownership: Act as proud ownersHigh Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

La posici√≥n es presencial en Barcelona, la empresa proporciona transporte p√∫blico desde Barcelona y el Vall√®s hasta las oficinas del cliente.

 Grado en Ciencias de Datos, Inform√°tica, Matem√°ticas, Estad√≠stica u otros campos cuantitativosExperiencia desarrollando modelos matem√°ticos y algoritmos predictivos (modelos supervisados y no supervisados, clustering, redes neuronales...)Experiencia desarrollando soluciones de machine learning a nivel de producci√≥n en un entorno cloud con computaci√≥n distribuida.Se valorar√° la experiencia en aprendizaje profundoExperiencia trabajando en un entorno de nube (por ejemplo, AWS, Google Cloud, Azure)Capacidad para poseer la entrega de un proyecto, incluyendo la comunicaci√≥n con las partes interesadas del negocio y para realizar presentaciones a nivel de la junta directivaAl menos 2 a√±os de experiencia en programaci√≥n, deseable Python.Experiencia en la implementaci√≥n de ETL, deseable plataforma BigData.

title: Pricing Data Scientist
location: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
description:
HP is seeking a highly motivated and talented Data Scientist to join our Pricing Analytics Team within the Advanced Analytics GTM organization.

In this role, your key responsibilities will include developing and optimizing pricing strategies to drive business growth and profitability. You will build models to understand the impact of pricing on sales, analyze different business strategies to provide valuable insights and recommendations, explore new data sources to improve our models, and investigate advanced analytics solutions to enhance our capabilities. Your expertise will contribute to informed decision-making and the continuous improvement of our pricing strategies.

Our Pricing Analytics Team is an international and diverse group of professionals, including data scientists, economists, engineers, and physicists. We are deeply committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment at HP and believe that diverse teams lead to better ideas, more innovative solutions, and greater overall success. We strongly encourage women, as well as candidates from all backgrounds and identities, to apply for this position.

Responsibilities
Develop forecasting models to evaluate the influence of pricing on sales performance.Conduct analysis of various business strategies and offer meaningful insights and recommendations.Identify and explore new data sources to improve the accuracy of our models.Write well-organized, efficient, and maintainable code, adhering to best practices and company coding standards.Construct efficient and scalable data pipelines in Databricks to support the implementation of models.Design interactive dashboards in Databricks to visualize and effectively communicate key findings and metrics.Investigate advanced models and methodologies to advance our analytics solutions.Communicate progress and challenges clearly and effectively with the project team and stakeholders.
Required Skills
Proficient programming skills in Python, including a strong grasp of Python libraries such as NumPy, pandas, and scikit-learn.Familiarity with R programming is preferred. Knowledge of R packages such as dplyr, ggplot2, and lmer is considered an advantage.Experience working with version control systems, particularly Git.Demonstrated problem-solving abilities and a knack for quickly acquiring knowledge of new technologies.Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with exceptional attention to detail.
Preferred Skills
Proficiency in pricing algorithms and demand forecasting models.Previous experience in operationalizing machine learning models with data.Familiarity with SQL, enabling efficient data manipulation and analysis.Knowledge of unit testing frameworks for Python, such as pytest or unittest.Prior experience working with Databricks.
Education & Experience
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Mathematics, Economics, Physics, Computer Science, or equivalent.Typically 2-4 years‚Äô experience including graduate or postgraduate research.
About HP

You‚Äôre out to reimagine and reinvent what‚Äôs possible‚Äîin your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what‚Äôs next. We‚Äôre in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.

Our history: HP‚Äôs commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion ‚Äì it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you‚Äôre more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

title: Senior Manager, Data Analytics
location: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
description:
Job Description
ABOUT THE ROLE AND OUR TEAM:
TKWW is looking for an Associate Director, Data Analytics who can be the strategic partner and point of contact for all things data for our Product Marketplace & Ads zones. The manager will be responsible for partnering with leaders across these two zones to drive strategy, as well as partnering with cross-functional stakeholders on our operations and marketing teams. They will manage a team of analysts with an emphasis on identifying opportunities and delivering value.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Manage, grow, and mentor a team of analystsThink holistically about stakeholder needs across data science & analytics, business intelligence, machine learning, and data engineeringWork with data science and product partners to identify opportunities for data products and predictive models using NLP, recommender systems, forecasting, and other advanced statistical and ML techniquesUse analytics anddescriptive statistical modelsto explore data & identify opportunitiesBuild a reporting stack tailored to the needs of the Marketplace & Ads teams, including high-level executive reports and domain-specific operational reportsDevelop methodologies for measuring performance across different parts of the product and customer journeysOversee analyses of large datasets to uncover opportunities and guide decision makingDesign and conduct A/B testing experiments and advocate for an iterative learning cultureDevelop tools and data products that automate manual work, increase operational efficiency, and empower users via self-service
SUCCESSFUL DATA ANALYST MANAGER CANDIDATES HAVE:
Excellent communicator with ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical audiencesStrong SQL and Python programming skillsStrong knowledge of applied statisticsHands on experience with A/B testing experiment design and analysisExperience working at a two-sided marketplace or eCommerce companyHigh-level understanding of data architecture, data pipelines, and database designKnowledge of visualization and proficiency in at least one visualization tool3+ years of data analytics leadership and management experienceStrong track record of influencing the organization and driving tangible business impact
BENEFITS & PERKS:

We have a gift for you!

WHAT WE LOVE ABOUT YOU:
 You Dream Big. You iterate and experiment to drive innovation.  You Love Our Users. You keep our global community at the center of everything you do.  You Do the Right Thing. You strengthen your team through respect, fairness, and inclusion.  You Hustle Every Day. You favor urgency and own your outcomes.  You Win Together. People are at the heart of our success and you play as a team. 
WHAT YOU LOVE ABOUT US:
We believe in a wide range of holistic offerings to support our employees so that they can live our values day in and day out. From mental wellbeing, physical health and financial planning, to engaging perks and discounts, we are in the business of celebrating and supporting the Moments that Matter both in and out of the ‚Äúoffice‚Äù. We offer flexible vacation, generous parental leave and prioritize initiatives that support the growth, development, and happiness of our people.
TKWW‚Äôs approach to the future of work : We embrace a remote culture and empower our employees to work wherever they feel most productive. To facilitate in-person collaboration, we have office spaces in Austin, TX; Barcelona, Spain; Delhi, India; Galway, Ireland; Guangzhou, China; London, England; New York, NY; Norwalk, CT; Omaha, NE; Portland, OR; and Washington, D.C.

Here at The Knot Worldwide, we believe in doing work that matters. title: Data Analyst, Vendor Analytics - Digital Markets
description:
About Gartner Digital Markets: 
Gartner Digital Markets is a business unit within Gartner. Our mission is to help small businesses make the right technology choices and find the tools they need to grow, optimize, and become more effective at what they do. The business is comprised of three top brands‚ÄîCapterra, Software Advice, and GetApp. For candidates interested in taking their next career step in the technology space, Gartner Digital Markets offers the fast pace and excitement of working for a startup, the stability and resources of a large, established organization, and the opportunity to be on the front lines of innovation in an industry that is always growing and transforming.
What we‚Äôre looking for: 
As a member of the Central Analytics Organization, you will have the opportunity to help support the Vendor and Review Analytics Team at Gartner Digital Markets (GDM). You will collaborate cross-functionally with the Sales, Reviews, Vendor Products and Experience, and Vendor Marketing Teams to help drive those groups towards accomplishing their goals. You will build strong relationships with your stakeholders across the organization. You will identify new areas to apply analytics to increase software vendor engagement with GDM. You will develop a deep understanding of our auction model and the economics of supply and demand for software leads to help drive software lead prices. You will analyze vendor behavior and identify opportunities to increase vendor satisfaction and retention. You will help improve the volume and quality of leads for software & services vendors. You will support the business development and customer success teams through improved prioritization of vendor outreach and improved access to critical data.
Why you‚Äôll want to come to work:
Use analytics to support Gartner Digital Market‚Äôs mission to be the leading resource for software & services buyers and sellers. Design, develop, execute and manage analytics projects, recurring reports and dashboards for key internal customers across GDM‚Äôs sales, client service, vendor marketing and reviews teams. Synthesize qualitative and quantitative data from multiple sources to support analytics goals and business partner objectives. Produce ad hoc and project-based analysis to support key business initiatives. Quantify the impact of major business initiatives and communicate findings to key stakeholders. Support the planning and forecasting process as needed to accurately predict the performance of key metrics. Provide data-driven recommendations and guidance to drive business performance. 
What you‚Äôll bring to the team:
Degree (preferably from a top-tier university) in business, economics, statistics, mathematics or another quantitative field preferred. Minimum of 3+ years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, data science or similar role. Experience working with cloud-based or traditional relational database management systems. Experience with business intelligence and data visualization systems (Tableau, Power BI). Experience in high data volume environments (preferably in internet, software or technology industries). Proficient with SQL or similar database scripting languages (Snowflake preferred). Proficient with Google (Sheets, Docs, Slides) and Microsoft suite of business applications (Excel, Word, Powerpoint, etc.)Experience working with web analytics tools a plus (Google Analytics, Omniture). 
Who you are:
Data driven and analytical by nature with demonstrable passion for data and analytics. Self-sufficient and driven to acquire the skills necessary to accomplish complex tasks. Strong interpersonal skills with ability to build relationships and effectively collaborate with partners. Excellent organizational and time management skills with ability to juggle multiple priorities. Comfortable working independently to achieve successful results with minimal guidance. Strong verbal and written communication skills with ability to clearly present complicated analysis. Resourceful and resilient with the ability to take a creative approach to problem solving. 
Check out our video to learn about who we are, and what we do:
youtube.com/watch?v=oSO_h5VZ9a0
What you‚Äôll find:
Limitless growth and learning opportunities. A collaborative and positive culture - join a diverse team of professionals that are as smart and driven as you. A chance to make an impact - your work will contribute directly to our strategy. Frequent social activities such as movie night, laser tag, bowling, escape room, summer beach party, hiking & bbq, and more!Hybrid environment with flexibility, remote work, Friday afternoons free, and more. New offices close to Gl√≤ries and the beach in the fantastic, ‚Äúinnovation and tech‚Äù 22@ district of sunny Barcelona. Fresh fruit, snacks, selection of teas, fair trade organic coffee and a fridge full of beer for our Thursday Beer O‚ÄôClock. 
What you‚Äôll receive:
Competitive compensation packages. 23 days annual holiday, and additional days off for your birthday, 24th & 31st of December. Private Medical and Dental Care. Life and Disability Insurance. Public Transport Subsidy. Ticket Restaurant Card. Childcare Vouchers (Ticket Guarderia). IncentiFit - annual reimbursement for health-and-wellness-related activities. Spanish lessons. Pension Scheme. Tuition Reimbursement. Employee Stock Purchase Plan. Employee Assistance Program. Gartner Gives Charity Match. Relocation Assistance - a specialist to help you with all the appointments and paperwork. 
What are we:
Action Oriented - Deliver fast, get great results. We embrace the vision, roadmap to success and the action it takes to make it happen. Intellectually Curious - Seek to learn, love to teach. We‚Äôre humble and embrace respectful, radical candor with a mindset of ongoing professional and personal development. Collaborative - One team, shared mission. We welcome feedback and understand the value of working together to accomplish more than what is possible individually. 
Web:gartner.com/en/digital-markets
Careers:jobs.gartner.com/teams/digital-markets
PLEASE NOTE:
 Applications must be submitted in English.  A valid EU visa/passport is required for this position. 
#digitalmarkets
Who are we?
Gartner delivers actionable, objective insight to executives and their teams. Our expert guidance and tools enable faster, smarter decisions and stronger performance on an organization‚Äôs mission-critical priorities. We‚Äôve grown exponentially since our founding in 1979 and we're proud to have over 19,500 associates globally that support over 15,000 client enterprises in more than 100 countries.
What makes Gartner a great place to work?
Our teams are composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations. We believe that a diversity of experiences makes us stronger‚Äîas individuals, as communities and as an organization. That‚Äôs why we're recognized worldwide as a great place to work year after year. We've been recognized by Fortune as one of the World‚Äôs Most Admired Companies, named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index and a Best Place to Work for Disability Inclusion by the Disability Equality Index. Looking for a place to turn your big ideas into reality? Join #LifeAtGartner
What we offer:
Our people are our most valuable asset, so we invest in them from Day 1. When you join our team, you‚Äôll have access to a vast array of benefits to help you live your life well. These resources are designed to support your physical, financial and emotional well-being. We encourage continued personal and professional growth through ongoing learning and development opportunities. Our employee resource groups, charity match and volunteer programs keep you connected to your internal Gartner community and causes that matter to you.
The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company‚Äôs career webpage as a result of your disability. title: Online Data Analyst
description:
TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com
We are hiring freelance English and Spanish speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.
This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.
RequirementsFull Professional Proficiency in English and SpanishYou must be living in Spain for the last 2 consecutive yearsAbility to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website informationYou must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in SpainBeing open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. News, Audio tasks, Relevance)Applicants must be 18 years or over.
Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.
Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?Earn extra incomeAccess to our community wellbeing initiativeRemote work & Location IndependenceBe your own bossFlexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyleBe a part of an online communityIf you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact us at sourcingteam89@telusinternational.ai

title: Data Engineer
description:
About the job
IOMED Data Engineering Team is responsible for building and maintaining optimized and highly available data pipelines that facilitate information extraction and transformation for our main products and internal applications. The core of your role will be designing, architecting, implementing, and testing data extraction and transformation tools in a microservices environment:
Data processing pipelinesData model transformationsComponents of a multi-modal distributed database.
You will collaborate with the rest of the Data Engineering team in analyzing and understanding data sources, participating in the design, and providing insights and guidance on database technology and data modeling best practices.
This role should work closely with the Business Development and Data Science teams, gathering technical requirements for data governance and data quality across the company.
About you
You will be working in a very dynamic environment, which means that you must have a strong problem-solving ability, organization skills, and be proactive.
In terms of personality, we are looking for someone who enjoys working in a wide range of areas and adapts quickly to new situations.
Tasks
You will have to feel comfortable giving support to the rest of the team and you can definitely expect to:
Query, model and deploy with PostgreSQL, Redis, RabbitMQ.ETL with SQL and PythonDesign, implement & test microservices.Integrate our products with external APIs.Development and testing of our core products and frameworks.Be comfortable with container development with Docker.Testing, logging, measuring and alerting of the deployed services.Monitor the existing metrics, analyze data, and collaborate with other teams in an effort to identify and implement a system and process improvements.Ensure that the collected data is of high quality and optimal for use across the team and the business at largeOversee activities of the junior data engineering teams, ensuring proper execution of their duties and alignment with business vision and objectives
What we are looking for
At least 8 years of working experience working in a data engineering department, preferably as a Data Engineer in a fast-paced environment and complex businessSetting and a demonstrated experience in building and maintaining reliable and scalable ETL.Experience in data warehousing inclusive of dimensional modeling concepts and demonstrate proficiency in programming (SQL and Python will be your main tools of the trade).Proven skills of putting microservices to use, and you‚Äôre comfortable with working with containers in a cluster architecture.Work well in a team, can teach & learn from others, and communicate what you‚Äôre working on with non-technical team members.

What we offer
Competitive Salary.Permanent contract.Company profit-sharing scheme valued at up to ‚Ç¨15,000 per year.Flexible remuneration with restaurant tickets, transport tickets, nursery, training, and medical insurance.Flexible schedule, with the possibility of home office.28 days of vacations per year.A warm, transparent and supportive team, with a huge emphasis on work-life balance.The opportunity to make your mark in e-health and AI.
About IOMED 
IOMED is a leading technology start-up company in the field of massive medical data extraction and processing. It is made up of a united, young, dynamic, and flexible team, which, after several years of working together, is characterized by its agility, enjoyment of work, and rapport. Accordingly, we are looking for candidates with the desire to innovate, launch a relevant project, and grow with it, always enjoying teamwork and challenges, which are many, every day.
As an employer, we offer equal opportunity. We want to grow our team with talented, dynamic people who want to make their mark in the field of AI and research, regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, physical disability, or age.
What we do 
Nowadays, there is still great difficulty in accessing Real-World Data (Real-World Data), which are those contained in Electronic Health Records (EHR), since up to 85% of the existing clinical data is not structured. This represents a loss of opportunity for the sector to improve its healthcare processes and clinical research.
IOMED has developed a Natural Language Processing solution that extracts and transforms clinical data into an international and federated model, OMOP CDM, resulting in a structured, standardized, and interoperable database that contains complete clinical information from hospitals.
In this way, professionals and the industry can make use of this data and obtain evidence based on all the data, Real World Evidence, that has essential value when it comes to making decisions, among others. All this, in addition, to assuring the protection and governance of the data at all times.

title: SI Data Optimization Analyst, Remote Spain
description:
Hotelbeds is the world‚Äôs leading technology partner, connecting and empowering the world of travel. We‚Äôre game-changers, disruptors, the people who bring together local and global brands in accommodation, transport, activities and payments through our network of 300,000 hotels worldwide, 60,000 hard to reach high value clients such as tour operators, travel agents and loyalty schemes across 140 source markets. We are tech-driven, with a customer-first philosophy, and commercial teams whose knowledge and relationships on the ground are second to none. And of course we have an amazing team! Our people, Team Hotelbeds, are the beating heart of the company who we encourage to ‚Äòmove fast, dream big and make the difference‚Äô every day. In fact, we believe that it is tech + data + people that truly sets us apart in the market, alongside our ‚Äòglobal approach, local touch‚Äô mentality. We‚Äôre headquartered in Palma, Mallorca and employ around 3,500 people worldwide.
Job Summary
The SI Data Optimization Analyst is responsible for analyzing business KPIs combined with data from different processes involved in integrations with hospitality services suppliers (chains, bedbanks, platforms, etc) with the aim of finding opportunities to optimize these connectivities from both technical and business point of views. The main functions for this role will be to work closely together with Technical Account Managers focusing on analysis and providing recommendations to influence the way they optimize these connectivities. It will also provide a meaningful input to Product Management and Applied Science team to shape how critical initiatives are developed and delivered.The role combines strong technical background on data and analytics together with the understanding of business implications, working on implementing new solutions/tools and collaborating as a stakeholder with IT, Product Management, Applied Science, Technical Account Managers and Commercial teams.This role is an amazing opportunity to quickly learn how Hotelbeds business work in all its layers and have high visibility and exposure within the Hotelbeds eco-system interacting with a vast pool of stakeholders including top management.
Job Responsibilities:
Work on analysis to support the business data-driven decision making Investigate, propose, and validate potential improvements or upgrades in the optimization of certain processes with suppliersAnalyze, design, develop and automate the generation of certain reports to understand supplier performance Create customizable tools to improve efficiency of certain processesCrossing large volumes of data from different data sources with the goal to extract conclusions/opportunities and be able to share/present them. Development of ad-hoc scripts for hypothesis testing.
Required Skills:
Technical background / degree - computer science, or relatedKnowledge of python with at least 2y of experienceStrong analytical skills with a data driven mindsetExperience analyzing big data and extracting conclusions and actions from itKnowledge about RESTful APIs.Familiarity interpreting data/logs from XML/JSON/YAML formats and working with SQL databasesExperience interpreting metrics / KPIs, step back, connect the dots and proactively think on opportunities to improveStrong ability to understand business plans (commercial area) and their technical implicationsGood communication and interpersonal skills Proactive attitude and social skillsExperience using Microsoft office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook‚Ä¶)English professional proficiency. Strong written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to convey complex technical situations/conclusions to end users of all technical abilities, together with excellent presentation skills.Strong technical, logical, analytical, and problem-solving skillsTeam player with an agile mind-setCombine a tech and business view, in a good common senseManage priorities to perform highest impact actions firstAbility to multi-tasking, working under pressure and in highly changing environments
