title: Healthcare Research & Data Analyst-1
description:
We are looking for a Healthcare Research & Data Analyst to join our Biopharma team in Barcelona, Spain. This is an amazing opportunity to work on an insights-based market assessment report developed for pharma clients. We have a great skill set in pharma market assessment, competitive assessment, and forecasting and we would love to speak with you if you have skills in pharma market research.

About You ‚Äì Experience, Education, Skills, And Accomplishments

Master‚Äôs degree in pharmacy/life sciences/pharmaceutical management is required.Relevant experience of 3+ years of in the biopharma, healthcare, market research, or financial sector is required.In-depth knowledge of at least one therapeutic area is required.In-depth knowledge of oncology market and products.Experience in analyzing and interpreting complex datasets

It would be great if you also had . . . 

Advanced degree (PhD in pharmacy or life sciences) is a plus.A flexible and collaborative approach to work.Ability to interact and build relationships with co-workersAbility to work well under pressure and meet deadlinesGlobal experience and experience in directly working with global stakeholders is preferable.Excellent attention to detail.Outstanding communication skills (written and oral) with ability to communicate clearly, concisely, and objectively in both written and spoken English

What will you be doing in this role?

The healthcare and research data Analyst role consists of three broad functions:

Primary and secondary market research

Critically analyzes and interprets complex clinical data and commercial information from a multitude of data sources, and draws conclusions to evaluate market trends, assess commercial opportunities and assist in building market forecasts.Assists in design of primary market research surveys including questionnaires.Conducts primary research via surveys with medical and health experts.Uses sound judgement regarding project scope, breadth of coverage and creativity in project design beyond the templates.

Writing capabilities:

Translates domain/therapeutic expertise, primary market research and secondary market research data into knowledge and insights for client needs.Effectively communicates these insights to the appropriate audience via written reports.

Project Management and Execution

With minimal supervision, prioritizes and manages the execution of multiple projects.Ensures deliverables are of high quality and on time.Identifies problems in advance and recommends solutions.Demonstrates sound decision-making ability.

About The Team

You‚Äôll be reporting to the Director, Healthcare Research & Data AnalyticsWe are an international team of 100+analysts and managers located in Europe, India, the US, and Japan.The team culture is dynamic, creative, and supportive ‚Äì excellence, integrity, and care are in our DNA.Biopharma team of Understand Business is a team of business insights analysts who design, research, author, and present market research studies on different indications to help pharmaceutical companies make decisions about the development of new drugs and management of marketed products.

Hours of Work 

This is a permanent full-time position at 40 hours a week (35 hours during July and August). The position is hybrid going to the office in Barcelona 2-3 times per week.

What We Can Offer You

A modern culture environment combined with all the financial and stability advantages of working for a large business.Active volunteering community, with 40 annual paid hours of volunteering time.Private Health and Life & Disability insurances.Tax-free benefits (Ticket Restaurant scheme, kindergarten and transport cards).Language classes (Catalan, Spanish and English).Global and dynamic employee base (more than 20 nationalities).30 working days of vacation.

At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training and other terms, conditions and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.

title: Data Analyst Coches.net
description:
We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.
We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.
Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.
What You‚Äôll Do & Who You Are
We are looking for an exceptional Senior Data Engineer to join the Coches.Net and Motos.Net team. You will work as a member of the vertical Motor team, collaborating closely with Product owners, cluster teams, data engineers and management team stake-holders (Marketing, Sales, Product, BizDev and other Operations teams). Your main mission is to make sure our data flow are correct and executed on time in order to identify trends, opportunities and problems to improve the offering and services we offer. These will be your functions:
 Create and evolve our data proceses using multiple technologies common to digital analytics ecosystem Identify, analyse and interpret KPIs and Health Metrics related to our users and customers, creating dashboard and visualisation to monitor them. Actively participate in the discovery, and development of advanced analytical models (such as clustering, and predictive models), into their implementation in business use cases, such as customer segmentation, and propensity models for upselling, downselling, and churn prediction.5+ years of experience in eCommerce, an online company. Advanced knowledge of SQL and relational databases Experience with big data technology (e.g. databricks, datalakes) Some knowledge of data engineering tools (e.g. Airflow, DBT) Advanced knowledge of Python and/or R for data analysis (e.g. pandas, numpy, matplotlib), and advanced analytics (e.g. scikit-learn) Good knowledge of basic machine learning algorithms (e.g. clustering, classification, regressions)
Nice-to-have
 Advanced user of at least one visualisation tool such as Tableau and/or QlikSense. Analytical skills: know how to interpret data, to extract relevant insights and be able to translate business questions into analytical needs Experience working with sales, operations, and strategy teams.At Adevinta Spain, we believe in the power of a fair and equitable benefits policy. And we do everything we can to make it so. Therefore, we pay special attention to all aspects that are key in your day-to-day life:Our work model prioritizes remote work combined with face-to-face dynamics in the office that help us connect and make strategic decisions as a team. There are a minimum of 5 face-to-face days per quarter that you will pick with your team, that is, a minimum of 20 days a year, of which there are 8 days that we have chosen for everyone because they are meetings that reinforce our culture as a company (development conversations with managers, the creation of objectives or the summer celebration and Christmas party)Furthermore, you have the option of working up to four weeks a year from wherever you'd like. To do this, you must have a good internet connection and be able to follow the team's schedules.Every year we engage in benchmarking against the external market in order to create competitive compensation packages. Moreover, we do have plans that allow you to "flex your gross salary" in order to purchase benefits such as meal vouchers, commuters card, training and child care.We have Apple, Dell and Samsung options to choose the hardware that helps you most in your daily life. Choose between a Macbook Pro (14" or 16") or Lenovo X1 laptop and an iPhone 12 or Samsung S21 phone. Do you travel by car or motorcycle? We subsidize part of the parking costYour well-being is our priority. We cover fully for your medical insurance and we allow family members to be added to the policy for a discounted price.At the Barcelona office, you can enjoy sessions of 1 hour of physiotherapy Do you like going to the gym? We sponsor 70% of the monthly fee of your chosen centre/ studio and we have agreements with both Andjoy and McFit for discounted membership prices. We enjoy 23 days of paid-time-off a year.We offer free breakfast and drinks at our Barcelona office every day of the week. You can also choose to enjoy the freshmade set daily menu in our canteen for an economical price. In Madrid on Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursdays you can enjoy free breakfast.Last but not least, you have 5 extra days to attend conferences and we offer one entrance ticket per year.
Benefits
Competitive compensation packageOpportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisationBenefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plansFlexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computerSmart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more
EN: Flexible benefits programme (transport, restaurants, child-care, etc), Free daily breakfast, 26 days of holidayPrograma flexible de prestaciones (transporte, restaurantes, guarder√≠a, etc.), Desayuno diario gratuito, 26 d√≠as de vacaciones
Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.
If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

title: Data Engineer - Operations (They/She/He)
description:
About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, you‚Äôll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives‚Ä¶ all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will

Design, implement, and maintain Data Products that produce business-critical data reliably and efficiently using cloud technologies and engines for large-scale data analytics. This role requires software engineering skills combined with data analytics expertise. This is our tech stack: SQL, dbt, Python, Spark, Airflow, Kafka, AWS, Terraform, Docker, Datadog, Looker‚Ä¶

Think big and contribute to our Data Mesh strategy within Glovo, leading and contributing to initiatives in the Operations (Contact, Courier and Logistics) data domain. Collaborate with many Product, Engineering, and Business teams to produce relevant data products that can be used across multiple analytical use cases.

Raise the bar on best practices and technical quality standards for Glovo, contributing to the technical decisions across all teams and also making impactful contributions to our code base.

You Have
2-3 years of experience working in data engineering, software engineering or business intelligence Experience designing and building scalable and robust data pipelines to enable data-driven business decisionsProficiency and experience with Python, SQL, pipelines orchestration (Airflow), distributed data processing engines (Spark), event streaming (Kafka), cloud infrastructure (AWS)Good understanding of software development best practices and promoter of agile methodologiesExperience in gathering requirements and creating data modeling designsExcellent spoken and written English
Nice-to-haves
Experience with CI/CD tools (Github Actions, Jenkins)Experience with the Data Mesh approach
Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Competitive Pay and Enticing Equity plan Top-notch private health insuranceMonthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products Zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders! Discounted gym memberships Flexible time off (take the time you need) Flexible working model - Combining 2 days a week working from home and up to 3 weeks a year working from abroadEnhanced parental leave including nursery supportWellbeing via free online therapy and emotional support solutions External learning opportunities Office fun activities from drinks to cinema nights! 
What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quicklyCare: Uplift people and the planetGood Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openlyStay Humble: Self-aware and open to learningGlownership: Act as proud ownersHigh Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee.

For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

title: BI Data Engineer
description:
eDreams ODIGEO is one of the world's largest online travel companies and one of the largest e-commerce businesses in Europe. Under its four leading online travel agency brands ‚Äì eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo ‚Äì it serves more than 17 million customers per year across 45 markets. Listed on the Spanish Stock Market, eDreams ODIGEO works with over 665 airlines and has partnerships with 130. The brand offers the best deals in regular flights, low-cost airlines, hotels, cruises, car rental, dynamic packages, holiday packages and travel insurance to make travel easier, more accessible, and better value for consumers across the globe.
The BI Data Engineer will work within the BI team in an agile environment working on the current BI platform migration from Oracle to Google Cloud Big Data technology. His main responsibilities will cover the full ETL process, from data gathering to basic dashboard building. The new platform will be able to support billions of records per day.
Main Responsibilities:
 Understand and translate Product Owners needs into specific tasks.  Analyse, document and develop reports targeted to a variety of users.  Data load processes development and optimization.  Data QA control.  Support users when needed.  Liaise with other areas of the BI department. 
Desired skills and experience:
 BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent (IT engineer), Mathematics, Physics, Economics, etc.  +4 years of solid proficiency experience in Python.  +2 year experience in SQL and data modelling.  +2 years experience in ETL tools such as Oracle Data Integrator, Power Center, Kettle or such.  +1 year experience in Google Cloud Composer (Airflow), Data Proc and BigQuery.  +2 year experience working in agile environments.  Experience in Visualization tools such as Microstrategy, Looker, Data Studio or Qlikview is desirable but not mandatory.  Analytic mind, organised, team player and self-starter. With attention to detail and focused on results and productivity.  English is a must. 
What we offer:
 We support a phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance with our flexible hours and flexible remote work policy.  A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels.  Competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus structure.  Excellent environment for continuous growth and learning: with our Learning & Development programs, you will have access to tech talks, internal soft skills and technical skills training, language lessons, external events and industry conferences.  Free subscription to Coursera Learning Platform.  Fast-track career development: with our unique programs, you are always working towards the next step on your career path.  We also have for you a Ticket Restaurant benefit & unlimited beverages and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) because we like our eDOers happy and healthy.  New to the city? We also offer great relocation packages.  Additional prizes and awards for a variety of team and individual achievements.  Fun at work: at eDreams ODIGEO, work and fun go hand in hand! 
‚Ä¶ And the opportunity to work on a dynamic, dedicated, fun and passionate team of professionals. We journey together!
Come dream with us and join us now!
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

title: Data Engineer - Fintech (They/She/He)
description:
About Glovo

We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

At Glovo, you‚Äôll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives‚Ä¶ all while having fun!

We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will

Design, implement, and maintain Data Products that produce business-critical data reliably and efficiently using cloud technologies and engines for large-scale data analytics, with a particular emphasis on data-intensive applications and event-driven architecture. This role requires strong software engineering skills combined with data analytics expertise. This is our tech stack: SQL, Python, Java, Spark, Airflow, Kafka, AWS, Terraform, Docker, Datadog‚Ä¶

Think big and contribute to our Data Mesh strategy within Glovo, leading initiatives in the Fintech data domain. Collaborate with many Product, Engineering, and Business teams to produce relevant data products that can be used across multiple analytical use cases, but also develop and deploy in production microservices leveraging data to enable Fintech products.

Raise the bar on best practices and technical quality standards for Glovo, contributing to the technical decisions across all teams and also making impactful contributions to our code base.

Provide guidance, mentorship, and training for junior Data Engineers.

You Have
+3 years of experience working in data engineering, with a strong software engineering background Experience designing and building scalable and robust data pipelines to enable data-driven business decisions, as well as developing event-driven high-throughput data integration systemsProficiency and experience with Python, SQL, pipelines orchestration (Airflow), distributed data processing engines (Spark), event streaming (Kafka) containerized apps (Docker), cloud infrastructure (AWS)Strong understanding of software development best practices and promoter of agile methodologiesExperience in gathering requirements and creating data modeling designsExcellent spoken and written English
Nice-to-haves
Experience with JVM languages (Java, Kotlin)Experience with CI/CD tools (Github Actions, Jenkins)Experience with the Data Mesh approachExperience with Microservice architecture

title: Data Science Manager ESP
description:
At Teladoc Health, we‚Äôre transforming the lives of people through whole person virtual care. You‚Äôll have the benefit to positively impact the lives of hundreds of thousands (soon millions!) of people through personalized interventions to the right person at the right time.
Come work for a data-driven innovator that‚Äôs transforming the healthcare industry. In your role as a Manager, Data science in Reporting & Business Intelligence group is focused on delivering scalable reporting solutions for internal and external stakeholders, you‚Äôll work closely with product and client success teams to empower client-facing teams with the tools that enhance and reinforce Teladoc Health's value proposition. This role will leverage your technical skills, business acumen, and leadership as you deliver insights about our members and clients to drive decision making. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with leaders to support scalability, helping us improve the content we deliver to clients and impact a greater number of people with chronic and behavioral conditions
Role and Responsibilities:-Manage a team of data analysts/scientists and lead them in delivering high-impact analytics for our client success teams driving client satisfaction and growth.-Build automation tools, data pipelines that help us deliver quality reports on time for a multitude of requests.-Influence upstream system/design, definitions and develop scalable solutions to meet expectations from internal/external stakeholders.-Engage with Product, Business, Engineering, and Marketing teams to understand the needs, capture requirements and be the liaison between analytics and business.Independently execute technical projects involving analysis, visualization, and experimentation as needed.-Lead strategic automation roadmap for scaled delivery of reports and data exchange to our ecosystem of clients, partners and business associates of our clients.-Partner with Product on development of new reporting platform and solutions.-Evaluate new tools/technologies for optimized delivery.
Requirements:-4+ years' experience in analytics, automation and/or data science. -Experience building roadmap from strategic vision for an end-to-end solution.-Ability to lead projects from scratch till implementation.-Strong SQL skills, ability to code in and analyze data with Python (or R), practical experience with BI tools like Tableau.-Strong critical thinking and active listening skills to infer business needs, grasp underlying context, and translate loose direction on analytical projects.-Compelling storytelling through analytics and visualization, getting your point across and keeping your audience engaged.-Strong communications and collaboration skills. Ability to work with varied functional teams. An effective team player with a fundamental respect for all people and their values.-The flexibility to respond to changing priorities and business environments.-Ability to build, mentor and manage team to efficiently execute goals while helping team members learn and grow

For a more detailed look at our company and values, visit our website at https://www.teladochealth.com/
At Teladoc Health we thrive on difference and individuality. Teladoc Health is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

title: Data Science Manager - Fraud & Risk (They/She/He)
description:
About Glovo
We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.
At Glovo, you‚Äôll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives‚Ä¶ all while having fun!
We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.
In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).
Your Work-life Opportunity
As a Fraud & Risk Data Science Manager you will be responsible for envisioning, leading and building an all-star team of Data Scientists working closely with key business and product leaders, analysts and engineers. You and your team lead the development of Fraud & Risk strategies, and preventive and predictive ML solutions to mitigate losses while establishing a balance between risk & customer experience. You will leverage our big data platform and use state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms and statistical models to deliver robust and highly scalable algorithmic products and solutions that have a direct impact on our global user base and our business.
Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Recruit, lead and manage an all-star team of Data Scientists of different seniority levels. Collaborate with business, product and engineering stakeholders to prioritise the most impactful work and ensure data science needs are accounted for.Manage the entire lifecycle of your team‚Äôs projects; from exploratory analysis to evaluation, deployment and iteration.Create the channels and tools for communicating results and monitor key metrics.Lead by example and motivate your team while bringing in new ideas on how to improve their ways of working.Ship fast and often measuring the impact using a robust experimentation framework.Coach and mentor your team to advance their careers and improve their professional skills.Act as data science evangelist, proactively looking for new opportunities to impact the business using data science tools and promoting its adoptionAct as data translator, being able to connect business problems with technical solutions and to architect them to be implemented by your teamActively collaborate with your colleagues and learn from each other in a supportive environment that allows you to grow, develop and make a difference 
You Have
2+ years of experience in a similar role, managing a data science team (5+ people) or multiple data science projects. Preferably in the digital/tech space.2+ years of strong hand-on experience as an individual contributor in industry or academia.At least an MSc, and preferably a PhD in a scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science or Mathematics.You have intimate level of ability and proven record of success managing fraud risk, fraud prevention and detection with a team of data professionalsDeep theoretical and applied knowledge in one or more of the following areas: supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, game theory, statistical inference, bayesian statistics, causal inference, time series analysis, decision theory, mathematical optimisationDemonstrable experience at productizing models; from inception to deployment.Knowledge and experience working with modern machine learning platforms & deployment technologies/vendors. (MLFlow, SageMaker, etc.)Full proficiency on Python and SQL; can write, inspect and review code.Good understanding of modern application and data stacks (Microservices, Event Streaming, Data Lakes, Container-orchestration)Experience with big data (e.g. Scala and Spark) and cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, Databricks).Experience in start-up and/or R&D environments.Excellent spoken and written communication skills (English).
We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!
Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing equity plan Flexible schedule and hybrid remote work, with 2 days/week to work from home and up to 3 weeks/year to work from anywhere! Top-notch private health insurance Monthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products and zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders! Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food Discounted gym memberships Flexible time off (take the time you need) Enhanced parental leave including nursery support! Online therapy and wellbeing benefit 
What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quickly Good Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openlyStay Humble: Self-aware and open to learningCare: Uplift people and the planetGlownership: Act as proud ownersHigh Bar: Focus on Top Performance

title: Data Scientist
description:
What Is Hubtype
Hubtype is building tools that help companies communicate with their customers on messaging apps like WhatsApp or Telegram. Some of the largest companies in Europe (like EPSON, Levi's, Volkswagen or Allianz) use our products to attend to millions of customers every month. Our mission is to create better business-consumer relationships by embracing simple, meaningful, and customer-centric communication.
We are growing fast and we're in a unique position to become the leaders in the EU conversational apps space thanks to our award-winning, open-source chatbot technology, and exclusive partnerships.
What You'll Do
You'll help us improve communication between brands and their customers by helping our teams take advantage of our Data, by serving them with customized visualizations, computing tailored metrics, running and analyzing experiments, and extracting datasets. Support any other data or analytics need, by conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities, design and resulting recommendations. Also helping maintain and improve our Data Lake, as well as internal procedures and methodologies of the Data team.
Requirements
Proven working experience (+2 years) as a Data Scientist, Data Analyst or Business Data AnalystTechnical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniquesStrong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracyAdept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
Benefits
WHAT WE CAN OFFER YOU:
Fully remote policy and flexible working hours27 days holiday per year, plus national holidays, plus your birthday, plus a volunteer dayTax relief through flexible remuneration for Ticket Restaurant, Transportation, Nursery, Health Insurance, etcLearning&Development budgetWorkstation budgetReferral bonusQuarterly team activities
Want to know what other people think of Hubtype?
Hear from some of our customers: https://www.hubtype.com/success-cases/bankia-biz-case Read this explanatory blog-post: https://www.hubtype.com/blog/conversational-apps-will-replace-websites Hear from our current and past hires on Glassdoor: https://www.glassdoor.es/Resumen/Trabajar-en-Hubtype-EI_IE3144089.12,19.htm 
If you're ready to apply, here's what we'd like to see:
An up-to-date CVA motivation letter about yourself and why you think you fit the position. Be as specific as you can

title: Metadata Analyst
description:
Mission:
Within the Data and Performance Team, Data Excellence is a cross-functional team responsible for promoting a data culture across the Schneider Group, through the dissemination of its operating model (DeXOM). Metadata management is the core capability upon which DeXOM relies, and the Data Intelligence Analyst should help implement and maintain a reliable and sustainable metadata environment. The tool chosen to achieve this goal is Data Intelligence Portal.
Key responsibilities:
Edit communication materials and manage stakeholder involvementLead training sessions for users, targeted for all of SchneiderDesign and monitor relevant dashboards for metadata managementParticipate in the functional management of data managersDevelop and improve new or existing workflows for the data governance communityParticipate in the design, implementation and monitoring of automatic metadata extractions, and the exploration of their contentSupport the definition of a start-up methodology in Data Intelligence Portal, for a project team or for a functionBe the partner of metadata managers to collect the needs and guarantee the integration, enrichment and consumption of new metadataEnsure version upgrades and implementation of corrections, for all Data Governance technologiesLead user support meetings
Skills and attributes:
You should have at least 2 years of experience in data governance, metadata management, data modelling, and data architecture conceptsYou must have experience in metamodel designExperience in defining and implementing the glossary of business termsExperience in the design and parameterization of metadata types and their modellingExperience in using API connections to ensure the integration of other systems with the Data Governance platformUnderstanding of technical metadata and their relationship to business metadata, i.e., with data elements, measures, indicators, etc.You must have very strong communication skillsGood managerial skills to lead and coordinate the metadata team
Desirable:
Have already used the Collibra environment in depth: its operating model, workflows, dashboards and other functionalitiesExperience in methodologies and software of knowledge graphs
 
Education
Required level of education: Master's degree or higher (economics or computer science or data management)

description:

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
DescriptionWe are a remote-first, international SaaS company helping businesses maximise their revenue potential in Europe and the US with our Go-To-Market SaaS Platform. We are the successful merger of Leadfeeder and Echobot, bringing two industry leaders together.What makes us unique? With origins in Finland and Germany, the country with the highest privacy standards in Europe, Dealfront was born with compliance and transparency in its DNA. This ensures that our users know exactly where their data originated. Compliance does not affect companies' earnings.We have over 330 dealfronters around the world in 40 countries. Join us and help us continue our mission to be the leading Go-To-Market platform that helps B2B companies win deals in Europe.

Position overviewAs a Data Analyst, you will be joining the Data Quality Team to own everything related to data analytics there. Your main focus is to analyze the data we provide to our clients. This includes comparisons with competitors, uncovering data weaknesses, supporting sales and customer service with meaningful insights, developing dashboards that allow us to continuously monitor our data quality and quantity.

ResponsibilitiesYou will visualize data, design dashboards, KPIs, and monitor data landscape for outliers, issues, or unexpected behaviorYou will analyze data drift, evaluate, and forecast data quality and predict developmentsYou will assess new data sources and support strategic decision-making processesYou will compare data sources and quality with those of our competitors

RequirementsA data background, a degree in mathematics, computer science or a comparable qualificationProficiency in at least one programming language (PHP/Python preferred) as well as knowledge in SQLProficient English Level

Nice to haveExperience with Solr, ElasticSearch/ELK-Stack, AWS Redshift or comparable Routine in data crunchingKnowledge in Data Visualisation Software (e.g. Tableau)

PerksThe chance to work with a very knowledgeable, high-achieving and fun teamAn international, diverse, dynamic and committed work environmentThe opportunity to work remotely, with a flexible work scheduleMental Health support with AuntieAnnual company retreats in sunny locations and team off-sites - Last year we went to Croatia ;)

title: Data Analytics Consultant - Barcelona
description:
About Us
 Making Science is a leading digital marketing and technology consulting firm, that is listed in the Madrid Stock Exchange. We are currently expanding our operations internationally, and our offices are located in Madrid, Barcelona, Lisboa, Par√≠s, Mexico City, Milan, and Dublin. We are a company that specializes in providing comprehensive marketing and technological solutions for digital businesses. Our team is composed of more than 1.000 digital native professionals, who have a wide knowledge in the different stages and disciplines of the digital transformation: Digital Strategy, Infrastructures, Software Development, Creativity and UX/UI Design, Digital Marketing, and Big Data. Making Science is People Centric, and we actively bet on our employees! We believe that they are the key to any successful business, and therefore, our greatest asset. We strive to provide daily learning opportunities for those who work with us and their colleagues. It is also really important that they enjoy what they do, and have positive experiences. We want our employees to feel proud of their accomplishments, and that they belong to a company that is in constant growth, because each person‚Äôs contribution is essential to achieve our success. Do you want to be part of this great family?
Some Details About Your Department
 At GMP, we are a young, energetic, and fun team! We believe that shared knowledge, teamwork, and internal training are the basis of a versatile, integrated, and powerful team. We highly value a thirst for knowledge, curiosity, and self-learning capabilities, because they help us stay up to date in an industry as dynamic as digital marketing. We are committed to the promotion of team building events, both inside and outside of the company, that will help us get to know each other better
What We‚Äôd Like You To Do
 Follow-up on clients.  Create personalized dashboards and reports based on the client‚Äôs objectives. Analyze and optimize web pages and apps in order to achieve set goals. Identify digital assets and web page structures that guarantee the best measurements.  Create tags for web, email, and marketing campaigns.  Revise the implementation code for good measurement (GTM, personalized variables and parameters, events, Enhanced Ecommerce...). Revise the implementation code for good measurement in App. Create Attribution Models, funnels, dashboards... Perform usability analysis on different devices (desktop, tablets, mobile). Create A/B and multivariate tests to improve a web‚Äôs conversion rate on different devices.  Perform Cross-device measurements. 
What We‚Äôd Like You To Bring
 We are looking for someone who‚Äôs proactive and eager to learn, and has the capacity to adapt to new challenges with a positive attitude.  You have more than 4 years of previous Data & CRO experience. You have an advanced level of English, both spoken and written.  You have knowledge of JavaScript and/or web layouts. You have knowledge of SQL and BigQuery.
Perks of joining us
 We give you complete stability with an indefinite job contract. We offer a fixed salary according to your worth and experience, plus a performance based bonus.  Get the most out of your salary with our Flexible Payment Plan (Restaurant Ticket, Transportation Ticket, Day Care Ticket, and Medical Insurance. Do you know someone that fits in Making Science? Refer him or her, and you can get a bonus if they‚Äôre hired! Feedback is part of our day to day lives. We recognize a job well done through a continuous feedback model.  We care about a healthy work-life balance. You can count on having flexible working hours, an intensive work schedule during July and August, and one day a week where you can work from home.  You will never stop learning with us: subsidized training, learning capsules, an e-learning platform, and many more. Pack your bags! You‚Äôll have 26 vacation days and the afternoons off on the eve of national holidays.  Work comfortably and follow your own style, because we don‚Äôt have a dress code.  We know how to have a good time! Monthly TGIF events, 5V, and much more! Be a part of a young, adventurous, and professional team, with people you‚Äôll grow fond of!

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
As a Data team we have to cover the three main specialties at the data field: Data Science, Data Analytics and Data Engineering. Today we have covered all the current needs in each field but we are looking for a boost in the Data Engineering part, looking to the future, by adding a person who provides us experience and knowledge about doing things in the right direction.
Requirements:Currently we are working on developing a solid data strategy inside Netquest, so we are looking for a team builder, someone who enjoys working with others and interacting with different people and departments, understanding their needs, sharing the decisions with the team and explaining the data solutions to the stakeholders.Knowledge and BackgroundThe ability to design and implement an entire data pipeline from scratchThe ability to decide which problems to solve with scale-up and which ones to tackle with scale-out approaches and how to combine them in data pipelinesKnowledge about Data ArchitectureAwareness of Data GovernanceAn economic view on questions of operability of crafted data pipelines:Maintenance of data integrity in cases of reprocessingUnderstanding of whether or how (internal or external) customer data deliveries are affected by changes to the softwareAwareness of data design patterns in the organization and best practices in generalDeep understanding of data modelling, data schemas and evolution thereofAwareness of best practices of data transformation design patternsAn advanced focus on data integrity when crafting data pipelines, by building in means to monitor data health and state of intermediate data and alerting mechanismsDesigning Quality Control/Validation processes / Quality Gates
Technologies and standardsProficiency in Python and SQLAwareness of scheduling tools, like Apache AirflowInterest in Big Data solutions, like Apache SparkIn depth understanding of the Data Engineering techniquesAbility to maintain and extend processes and functionalitiesDeep understanding of application packaging and delivery mechanisms, including CD/CI best practices and security concernsThe ability to integrate partial solutions and RnD results into production-ready data pipelinesThe ability to build and operate infrastructure (e.g, for testing purposes)The ability to support on operational questions for environments in productionUnderstanding of cloud infrastructure and services available for setting up and maintaining data pipelines (e.g., AWS)Ability to advise on data transformation workflow designs and optimizations with the dimensions of cost, performance and delivery mechanisms (streams / increments / etc.)
Key Accountabilities:The accountabilities of a senior data engineer include the accountabilities of a data engineer but increased norms apply, meaning a senior data engineer is expected to be able to accomplish their tasks in less time, to a higher standard (total understanding and excellent adherence to applicable standards and guidelines) and be able to solve more complex problems.The senior data engineer is expected to look beyond their primary team scope and strive for harmonization and improvement of solutions across the CSG or even beyond.The senior data engineer is also accountable to pro-actively pass on their knowledge on to other engineers when the opportunity arises during the course of their work:During pair programming/ pair workWhen sought for adviceDuring code reviewsBy participating in Communities of Practice
The senior data engineer is accountable for bringing together technical assets from different disciplines within their cross-functional team and for fostering a common solution approach between team members with different technical backgrounds.

title: Technical Data Engineering Lead
description:
Schneider Electric is leading the Digital Transformation of Energy Management and Automation in Homes, Buildings, Data Centers, Infrastructure, and Industries.With global presence in over 100 countries, Schneider is the undisputable leader in Power Management ‚Äì Medium Voltage, Low Voltage and Secure Power, and in Automation Systems. We provide integrated efficiency solutions, combining energy, automation, and software.We believe that great people and partners make Schneider a great company and that our commitment to Innovation, Diversity and Sustainability ensures that LifeIsOn everywhere, for everyone and at every moment.

Job purpose: 
A Technical Data Lead is the senior-level role responsible for overseeing the technical aspects of data management and analytics initiatives within our DCR Data CoE organization. He/she plays a crucial role in driving the organization's data technical delivery strategy, ensuring the availability, integrity, lineage and security of data, and leveraging data assets to drive business insights and decision-making. Technical Data Lead will work closely with the data engineering team and collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and implement data for the products / use cases owned.

Key core responsibilities include:
‚Ä¢ Technical Leadership and Team management: Providing technical leadership and guidance to the data engineering team. This involves building and managing the team: hiring, mentoring, and coaching team members, sharing best practices, providing guidance, and ensuring the team's technical skills and knowledge are up to date.
‚Ä¢ Data Solutions: Collaborating with stakeholders, such as product owners, business counterparts and data scientists, to understand their data requirements and support the data design solutions accordingly. The Technical Lead team is responsible for designing data models, data integration architectures, and data pipelines to meet use cases needs.
‚Ä¢ Data Pipeline Development: Leading the development of data pipelines that extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources into SE data lake IDS. This includes implementing data transformation logic, data cleansing, and data enrichment processes to ensure data quality and usability.
‚Ä¢ Data Architecture: Collaborating in designing the data architecture for efficient storage, retrieval, and analysis of data. The Data Engineer. Support the data platform owners and infrastructure teams to optimize data storage, data partitioning, and data indexing strategies.
‚Ä¢ Performance Optimization: optimizing the performance of data pipelines and data storage systems following the monitoring SLA and guidance from Platform Owner. Identifying performance bottlenecks, optimizing query performance, and supporting GTS ensuring scalability and reliability of data solutions.
‚Ä¢ Data Governance and Security: Implementing data governance practices and security measures to ensure data integrity, privacy, and compliance working closely with data governance and security teams to define and enforce data policies, access controls, and data protection measures.
‚Ä¢ Communication: communicate technical concepts and solutions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
‚Ä¢ Technology Evaluation and Adoption: participate in PoCs for new technologies, tools, and frameworks related to data engineering. Stays up to date with industry trends and advancements, assesses their relevance to the organization's needs, and makes recommendations for technology adoption to platform owners.
‚Ä¢ Quality Assurance: Implementing data quality checks, testing strategies, and monitoring mechanisms to ensure the accuracy, completeness, and reliability of data. It establishes data validation processes and collaborates with data quality teams to address any data issues.
‚Ä¢ Continuous Improvement: Driving continuous improvement in data engineering practices. This includes identifying opportunities for automation, process optimization, and efficiency gains. The Technical Lead promotes the adoption of best practices, standardization, and reusability in data engineering projects / products.

Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.‚Ä¢ 5 to 10 years of relevant experience in delivering data, analytics, or AI solutions.‚Ä¢ Strong foundations in data engineering principles, data modeling, architectural mindset, ETLs processes.‚Ä¢ Knowledge on programming languages commonly used in data engineering such as Python, SQL, or Java. ‚Ä¢ Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure).‚Ä¢ 3+ years of relevant experience in Agile model / scrum.‚Ä¢ Team & talent management.‚Ä¢ Excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.‚Ä¢ Evidence on leadership skills and sense of risk, urgencies (act like owner)‚Ä¢ Familiarity with product management tools, such as Jira, Confluence or Trello.‚Ä¢ Ability to handle multiple tasks and meet tight deadlines‚Ä¢ Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Why us?Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive. ‚Ç¨25.7bn global revenue137 000+ employees in 100+ countries45% of revenue from IoT5% of revenue devoted for R&D
You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled
It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
It‚Äôs an exciting time to join Tactile. We're one of the largest Danish gaming companies and we have been scaling fast in the last few years. Our dedication to creating top-quality games with global appeal has led to the development of a series of highly successful puzzle mobile games, such as Lily's Garden, Cookie Cats, Simon's Cat, and most recently, Penny&Flo: Finding HomeCurrently we are looking for a Data Science expert to join our Games Team.
As a Data Scientist at Tactile you will have the opportunity to explore data and take the initiative to acquire valuable insights that could help us improve our player‚Äôs experience. In your day to day, you‚Äôll be partnering up with game designers and other data scientists to lead projects on machine learning, behavioural segmentation and monetization. Project after project you‚Äôll be helping evolve the analytics methodologies and tools available company-wide.
We have a growing portfolio of successful games, so you‚Äôll have the chance to assist game development through all of their different stages, from ideation, to soft-launch, to the long-term optimization of top ranking games.
This role is based in Barcelona.
What we‚Äôre looking for:Prior experience working within mobile gamingExperience using SQL to extract and transform large data-setsProficiency in R or PythonHigh proficiency in presenting analyses and results to all audiences, from senior stakeholders to junior colleagues and non-technical teammatesExperience applying rigorous analytic techniques in order to understand the behaviour of our players and the way they interact with the game featuresExperience with data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Periscope, Table)Understanding of statistical concepts such as sampling, distributions, hypothesis testing and confidence intervalsStrong experience and deep understanding of A/B testing methodologiesFamiliarity with collaborative programming (e.g., git), and other tools like Airflow and Docker
Great if you also have:Leadership experience
What we offer:üíª A chance to work with the latest tools and technologyüìö Opportunities for individual growth with development talks as well as workshops, books and courses ü•≥ Social activities, including game nights, book club, Friday bar and more

title: Senior Game Data Analyst
description:
At Tilting Point, we combine data, technology, talent and groundbreaking marketing to scale games to success. As the Senior Game Data Analyst, you will work closely with game teams to help inform decision-making regarding features of the game, balancing, player interactions, finding hidden opportunities and much more.
Your Future at Tilting PointAnalyze large, complex datasets to address ad-hoc and long-term operational and strategic business questionsDraw meaningful conclusions and provide actionable insights from data to shape and influence in-game features, economies, and future product roadmapsOwn the taxonomy for game data, ensuring all key performance metrics are measurable and can be analyzed efficiently.Present analytical findings as both written communication and visual representations that are clear, concise, and understandable, to both technical and non-technical audiences.Build relationships with stakeholders and processes around data deliverables to ensure data driven decisions can be made at all levels across Tilting PointCollaborate with all teams at Tilting Point, driving and supporting data and analytics related projects with game team, User Acquisition, Marketing, Engineering, and more
Your XP & SkillsEffectively communicate in English across verbal and written form.University degree (BA or BS) in Analytics, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Business Management, Information Systems, Computer Science or a related field3+ years of work experience as a data analyst or scientist, supporting consumer-facing products, mobile app/game preferredProficient with SQL2+ years with Python/R a plusAdept in at least one visualization tool such as TableauFamiliarity with PySpark and/or Amplitude a plusPassionate about mobile/social gaming with a good understanding of the market.

title: Data Scientist - Insights (Product - Supply)
description:
At Preply, we are unlocking human potential through learning.

We believe learning with a great tutor is life-changing. That‚Äôs why we match online tutors from across the globe with learners and empower them to create live language classes with AI-powered tools and learning materials. This is how we deliver progress, create engagement and keep our global community of learners motivated. So far, over 32,000 tutors have given more than 15 million lessons to learners from over 175 countries.
Meet the team!

At Preply, we are constantly hundreds of AB tests, each with specific tracking and analytic requirements. This, along with the wide scope of our product and the sophistication of the tutor/learner interactions, makes for some rewarding challenges.

As part of this role, you‚Äôll study and understand user behavior, design AB Tests for our experimentation platform, analyze the results, and provide insights and recommendations to our stakeholders.

You‚Äôll be embedded in cross-functional teams and work closely with product managers, tech leads, designers, etc. to provide our tutors and learners with the best product experience.
What You‚Äôll Be Doing
Master the dynamics of tutors/learners interaction and the economics of Preply‚Äôs marketplace;Produce thorough data analytics of customer behavior and product usage, effectively communicating them to technical and non-technical audiences;Partner with the Supply Product Managers to improve the discovery and activation of new tutors and the performance of the existing ones, by refining product initiatives into lean, experiment-led technical implementations;Quantify the impact of new product features and initiatives in order to identify growth opportunities and help prioritize our roadmap;Design, execute and evaluate experiments on a global scale;Work with Data Strategy & Engineering to define standards and best practices to model data in our Data Warehouse and productionize your data pipelines;Leverage your broad statistical awareness to proactively identify opportunities to improve our existing methods and to create new ones;Make recommendations to leadership team and stakeholders of changes that will impact the company performance;Participate in the definition of engagement metrics and key performance indicators;Build relationships and collaborate with other data and/or technical leaders.
What You Need To Succeed
Experience as a Data Scientist (around 4 years' experience minimum, more preferably);Good understanding of data analysis concepts such as conversion, LTV/CAC, Cohort analysis, Retention, etc.;Ability to confidently apply data science techniques, such as statistical modeling, in a marketplace context;Knowledge of A/B testing and experiment design;Strong knowledge of quantitative fields (statistics, mathematics, etc.);Strong coding skills in one or more analytics languages (SQL, Python, etc.);Strong curiosity, problem solving and problem finding skills;Creative mindset and proactive attitude towards the creation and evaluation of new hypotheses;Good written and verbal communication skills. B1 English is a must.
Nice To Have
Previous experience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C);Experience in Supply analytics;Knowledge of Looker, Tableau, Amplitude or other BI tools;Knowledge of coordination tools (Airflow, Luigi, Jenkins, etc.);Knowledge of version controlling tools (GitHub, GitLab, etc.).Masters degree or PhD in statistics, economics, econometrics, or a relevant field of applied mathematics (or equivalent business experience).
Why You‚Äôll Love It At Preply
Open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse cultureGenerous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.comLearning & Development budget, including time off for your self-developmentCompetitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insuranceAccess to free mental health support platformsFlexible set-up with the option of paid relocation to Barcelona, or working remotely within a close time zoneOpportunity to shape the lives of learners and tutors from over 175 countries through language learning and teaching

But there‚Äôs more. At Preply, we focus on doing better every day ‚Äì pushing the limits of what we know is possible. And we know our purpose is strong. We‚Äôre re-engineering education, providing outstanding experiences for our global community of language learners and building authentic connections across the world. You‚Äôll get to be a part of our online learning innovation!
Propelled by a tenfold increase in revenues over the last three years, thanks to our best-in-class consumer and B2B products, Preply is now leading the online language tutoring segment globally and has 500+ employees of over 50 nationalities based across Barcelona, Kyiv and the US. We do extraordinary things at Preply ‚Äì and we want you to join us.
Welcome to The World Class. 
Our Values
Human: We embrace diversity by fostering inclusive environments where people feel respected and safe to express their opinions.Hungry: We make bold, data-informed decisions to deliver high-impact solutions for our customers.Humble: We experiment continuously by staying open to being challenged, learning from failures and making data-informed decisions.Hackers: We learn by doing, focus on things that matter and move with incredible speed to create simple, creative, and scalable solutions;Curious: We thrive on facing challenges, diving deep to identify root causes and uncovering insights to continuously improve.Learners Obsessed: We put our learners at the core of everything we do to improve the effectiveness of their language learning with us.
Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

title: Senior Data Scientist (m/f/d)
description:
Visi√≥n General 
Bruker is enabling scientists to make breakthrough discoveries and develop new applications that improve the quality of human life. As one of the world‚Äôs leading analytical instrumentation companies, Bruker develops high-performance scientific instruments and high-value analytical and diagnostic solutions that enable scientists to explore life and materials at molecular, cellular, and microscopic levels. We have been driving innovation in analytical instrumentation for 60 years and today, Bruker continues to build upon its extensive range of products and solutions, its broad base of installed systems, and a strong reputation among its customers. Worldwide, more than 7,500 employees are working on this permanent challenge at over 90 locations on all continents.
Our Company is commercializing one of the most powerfully advantageous approaches in spatial
biology. The Company brings together the premier spatial omics approach with leading-edge data
acquisition and analysis capability. The pioneering in situ technology enables examination of some of
the most important questions in genomics and gene expression at the single cell and sub-cellular level.
We aim to find the best talent in the field to join and contribute to this extraordinary, exciting endeavor
becoming a critical member of this groundbreaking opportunity.
 Responsabilidades 
Position Description
 As Data Scientist, the candidate will be responsible for developing statistical methods for the analysis of spatial genomics data.  Using statistical and machine learning algorithms this role will develop tools to analyze spatial 3D genomic data and integrate it with other omics sources.  This position will work closely with software engineers in the analytics team to deliver easy to use reporting tools to help researchers explore, visualize and interpret the results of their datasets. 
Role
 Develop algorithms to analyze spatial information, identify patterns and segregate or group data.  Analyze performance and optimize solutions to enable analysis of big data.  Integrate different sources of information with spatial genomics data in statistical models to enrich the data reporting.  Develop graphical tools using statistical data visualization libraries to analyze the results.  Architect and implement new solutions and validate new ideas by modifying existing solutions or developing new features. 
 Calificaciones 
Requirements
 Proficiency in C++.  Proficiency in code optimization and parallel processing.  Proficiency in statistical modeling and analysis.  Advanced degree in Bioinformatics, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics or Computer Science (M.S. or Ph.D.) D. (preferred) or Masters with 5 years of experience. 
Additional Desirable Skills To Have
 Experience in Python Programming  Familiarity with data visualization libraries such as matplotlib, seaborn, pandas, etc.  A solid background in biology  Ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Adapts to changing priorities. Drive for results.  Embraces effective decision-making skills; uses good judgment and can bring closure to issues.  Continually demonstrates reliability and delivery of measured results, executed with a sense of urgency.  Desire to be part of a rapidly evolving organization, with compelling technology, and taking products and processes to the next level.  Good process and people skills.  Good business acumen with a positive solutions-oriented approach and ability to build productive relationships.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Hybrid Intelligence, a Capgemini Engineering team, is looking for a SENIOR DATA SCIENTIST to join the team in Spain. You will provide analytics expertise to a highly talented team, while participating in the rapid growth and expansion of our client base.
Requirements
To succeed in this role, you should have:
A Masters or PhD in operations research, computer science, mathematics or engineering with more than four years of experience in DS projects.Professional experience applying data science, analytics, machine learning and computational techniques. (Python, Pandas, Keras, Pytorch, Tensorflow)A genuine enthusiasm for using data science to solve complex problems, and an understanding of the algorithms, data processing methods and visualization techniques required.It will valued real experience in Cloud Environment (AWS, Azure, ..)Excellent communication and presentation skills, and the ability to explain complex concepts.Professional level ability in Spanish and English.
About Us
As a member of the Hybrid Intelligence team of Capgemini Engineering you will work on a variety of innovative and rewarding projects that make a difference. Our work is a fusion of applied mathematics, scientific computing, AI, and software engineering. We deliver ground-breaking, multi-disciplinary solutions for our R&D-driven clients tackling humanity‚Äôs generational challenges, from discovering new drug treatments to harnessing green energy.
We are dedicated to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We appreciate individuals for who they are and value the diversity they bring to the workplace.
Capgemini Engineering is an integral part of the Capgemini Group, a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. It is a multicultural company of over 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries.
What we offer?
Permanent working contractRemote working.Flexible schedule + intensive workday on Fridays and in summer (Two months)Social benefits package (private medical insurance, life and accident insurance paid by the company, Gympass, Life -employment and family assistance company-, etc).Flexible remuneration (transport ticket, restaurant ticket, nursery, training, extend health insurance to your family...)Ongoing technical, skills and language training (free English classes for all employees)Annual performance evaluations. Professional development plan, based on your experience and future potential, adapted to you, with both horizontal and vertical growth.

title: Timesheets & Master Data Administrator
description:
Company Description
Introduction
Dentsu is the network designed for what‚Äôs next, helping clients predict and plan for disruptive future opportunities and create new paths to growth in the sustainable economy. Taking a people-centered approach to business transformation, we use insights to connect brand, content, commerce and experience, underpinned by modern creativity.
Merkle is an important part of our world-class offering a global performance marketing agency with a 32-year track record of helping the best brands in the world create personalised experiences at every stage of the customer life cycle. Some of their esteemed brand relationships include Citibank, EmblemHealth, Dell, AARP, AT&T, Target, L‚ÄôOr√©al, Universal Orlando Resorts and the American Cancer Society.
We‚Äôre hiring for a Timesheets & Master Data Administrator as part of Merkle in Barcelona.
Job Description
Life as a Timesheets & Master Data Administrator at‚ÄØMerkle 
Come be a part of our professional, collaborative, international, and fun work environment, where everyone gets to make a difference.
The purpose of this role is to deliver accurate and efficient master data processes and finance reports.
As a‚ÄØTimesheets & Master Data Administrator, you will:
assist in the set-up of employees in our financial system and manage their timesheets;create timecodes and assign them to employees' timesheets;solve timesheets-related issues for employees and finance teams;manage data entry in the financial system;deliver master data maintenance processes, according to established Standard Operating Procedures and agreed SLAs;identify improvements in the existing processes regarding data entry (automation);design, test, and deliver basic reports related to timesheets and expenses using the right tools and applying best practices to meet the business needs;maintain accurate documentation to ensure compliance with established processes and policies;assist in the ongoing training of end-users on how to submit timesheets, expenses, and to record absences. 
Qualifications
What we are looking for in you
University Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher. You‚Äôre a recent graduate (Bachelor or Master). We will also consider you if you‚Äôre not a recent graduate but are looking for a career switch. 0 - 2 years of professional work experience. Very good level of English. Proactive with effective communication skills. Logical thinker with an eye for detail. Good knowledge of Excel. Knowledge of Navision, JetReport & Workfront would be a plus. Basic understanding of financial and accounting concepts. 
Additional Information
A few of the benefits
Whether it‚Äôs the joy of working with people at the top of their game or the Merkle social calendar, people love working here ‚Äì and we hope you will too
Attractive and competitive salarySpanish/English lessonsFree life and health insuranceCareer development through Dentsu University and LinkedIn LearningDay off on your birthdayAnnual wellness daysMerkle Care Employee Assistance ProgramMerkle Benefits ClubReduced fee in Andjoy2 volunteering days per annumFlexible salary remuneration scheme
Inclusion and Diversity
Our diverse and inclusive culture enables our employees to bring their whole selves to work and be proud of doing so. For us, this is the foundation for great innovation which, in turn, generates better outcomes for our people, partners, and communities. This is why we encourage applications from people with disabilities, and of all ages, nationalities, backgrounds, and cultures.
About Dentsu
Taking a people-centered approach to business transformation, we use insights to connect brand, content, commerce and experience, underpinned by modern creativity. As part of Dentsu Group Inc. we are headquartered in Tokyo, Japan and our 65,000 employee-base of dedicated professionals work across four regions (Japan, Americas, EMEA and APAC). Dentsu combines Japanese innovation with a diverse, global perspective to drive client growth and to shape society.
Diversity, equity, and inclusion sits at the heart of our Social Impact strategy ‚Äì our fully integrated sustainability strategy which includes our ambition to build a fair and more equal society, where everyone is equipped to thrive.
If you have any reasonable adjustment needs arising from a disability or medical condition to fully participate in the recruitment process, please discuss this with our recruitment teams.

title: Data Engineer Manager
location: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
description:
HP is a Fortune 100 technology company with $58+ Billion in revenue, with over 50,000 employees operating in more than 170 countries around the world. We provide technology and services that help people and companies address their problems and challenges, and realize their possibilities, aspirations, and dreams. We apply new thinking and ideas to create simpler, more valuable, and trusted experiences with technology, continuously improving the way our customers live and work.

Position background

In the GTM analytics COE our mission is to deliver impact by building machine learning products to optimize pricing and marketing investments and provide guidance to our sales organization.

Those products are of high value to the company: Imagine affecting the marketing investments of all of HP products globally across all distribution channels utilizing ML.

In our production environment data science teams from each domain generate the first algorithmic models to solve questions such as: Should we invest more in search or display? Should we increase investment in keyword XXX in Google/AMZ on in keyword YYY?

To help there we are looking for a Principle data engineer that can help us bring machine learning algorithms to life from the front-end part all the way back to the decision engine

We offer an international experience, collaborative culture, top rate experience in AI and ML and opportunity to create significant real-world impact.

What You Will Do
Lead a team of data engineers that enable applications to build upon reliable dataWork with data science, product, and IT to understand the deployment requirement on one hand and the algorithmic/ data needs on the otherProvide recommendation on how to best bring the model into production (delivery method, algorithmic changes, coding changes)Help build and design the new solutionsWork with the team to productionize the solutions at scaleTake co-ownership of reliability, wait time and commercial results
What You Will Need
Bachelor‚Äôs in Engineering, Computer Science, statistics , Robotics or a related fieldExperience with cloud infrastructureExperience with modern application lifecycle management tools (Git, Visual Studio, Intellij, Code Reviews) .Experience with automated builds, tests and deployment of libraries on a compute cluster.Advanced understanding of Software Test methodologies, and an expert in testing tools. Strong General Project Management.
Who We Are

At HP, we believe in the power of ideas. We use ideas to put technology to work for everyone. And we believe that ideas thrive best in a culture of teamwork. That is why everyone ‚Äì at every level in every function, is encouraged to think big, have original ideas and express and share them. We trust anything can be achieved if you really believe in it, and we will invest in your ideas to change lives and the way people work. This vision is what sets us apart as a company. At HP, we work across borders and without limits. Global virtual teams share resources, pool their big ideas to solve our biggest business opportunities. Everyone is valued for the unique skills, experiences and perspective they bring. That‚Äôs how we work at HP. And this is how ideas and people grow.

About HP

You‚Äôre out to reimagine and reinvent what‚Äôs possible‚Äîin your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what‚Äôs next. We‚Äôre in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.

Our history: HP‚Äôs commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion ‚Äì it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you‚Äôre more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!
