title: Lead Data Platform
description:
Our mission? Creating the finance solution that energizes SMEs and freelancers, so they can achieve more. We simplify everything from everyday banking to bookkeeping and spend management. At Qonto, we‚Äôre passionate about creating the best product, so if you‚Äôre looking for an ambitious team that‚Äôs revolutionizing an old-fashioned industry, get in touch!

Our journey:  Alexandre and Steve launched Qonto in July 2017. Since then, the team has earned the trust of more than 350,000 customers and opened offices in Paris, Berlin, Milan, and Barcelona. Last summer, we joined forces with Penta, a market leader based in Berlin and Belgrade, forming a united team of 1000 Qontoers. We also made it to the Top 3 of LinkedIn Top Startups France !

Our values:

Ambition | We tackle big challenges. No matter what.

Teamwork | We create momentum by working together, at the same speed.

Mastery | We pursue excellence through continuous learning. We face challenges with humility. Every day.

Integrity | We're open. We're honest. And we earn the trust of our clients and each other.

You can find out more about the Qonto Way here .

Our beliefs: Our goal at Qonto is to create a warm and welcoming environment where individuals from all walks of life can truly thrive. We've gone above and beyond to ensure that every applicant is evaluated solely based on their skills and potential, rather than their gender, ethnicity, age, (dis)ability, or any other irrelevant factor. Our team consists of 49% international individuals, with 44% women and 20% parents. With this diversity, we are a powerful force! Join us in our mission to build a workplace that celebrates diversity and embraces individuality. Discover the steps we took to create a discrimination-free hiring process .

Qonto has grown a 60+ data team with Data Engineers, BI, and Data Scientists working together to deliver great dashboards, reports, and data products. Now is the time for Qonto to strengthen its data foundations. Qonto is looking for itsLead Data Platform to build its next-generation data platform.

Our vision of the Data platform

The data platform covers three key functions: governance, ingestion and data modelling. You only ingest the data Qontoers need: this is data governance. You rely on a modern data stack to ingest the data: airflow, dbt and snowflake. And you craft nice and discoverable tables and fields to be used widely at Qonto: this is data modelling. You serve all data teams: BI, Data Science, and Data Products.

There are 12 engineers in the data platform team divided into data engineers and analytics engineers.

Leading a data platform team means leading a team of 2 to 8 engineers

üë©‚Äçüíªüßë‚Äçüíª What you will achieve in this role in your first year
 Simplify the data model: during your first year, you will focus on the analytics engineering part. Analytics engineers are building two key inner layers of the data model ‚Äî the core and reference layers. Then, you will likely switch to leading hybrid teams composed of data and analytics engineers Organise your team delivery: how to make sure the core tables you deliver match the needs of data analysts? What prioritisation system to adopt? Coach and Grow your team: being a Lead at Qonto means setting your team for success Make your team shine inside and outside Qonto: you ingest clean data, transform them into nice documented tables, self-discoverable by every Qontoers. What a success! The incidents have nearly vanished and you feel proud of your team. How about you spread the word and share the key ingredients of your success?

üõ† Tech Stack:
 Our primary language is Python, our core platform consists of a Snowflake data warehouse, fueled primarily by an on site Airflow instance running on a Kubernetes cluster. Data is centralized through custom orchestrated batch jobs, with S3 as our intermediary lake. Data modelization is enabled thanks to an orchestrated dbt repository and quality validation results of a mix of tests using Great Expectations and dbt. We took advantage of ELK forlogging and monitoring as well as Airflow‚Äôs internal database.

ü§î  What you can expect
 Join Qonto who is winning SME banking in Europe. Qonto is on track to power one million SMEs in 2025. Develop dozens of customer-impacting innovative data products ranging from understanding better our clients, to Qonto app killer features Work with a top-notch team Leverage our values and our culture of continuous improvement to boost your impact as a leader

ü§ù Your future Manager

J√©r√©mie , VP of Data, will be the one to help you succeed
 His background?

Before joining Qonto, J√©r√©mie was an associate professor at Telecom Paris and Telecom SudParis. He led data teams for some of France's most reputed digital companies and still advises several deep tech startups. He teaches at Ecole Polytechnique and co-authored over 50 scientific papers.
 What does he bring to the team?

J√©r√©mie defines a clear vision and path to success for our data platform, BI, data science analytics, and data products teams. He ensures they operate efficiently and have a smooth collaboration with other departments at Qonto. He also helps them continuously learn new skills while improving their existing ones and is still very involved in the hiring of his teams.

üèÖ About You
 Management: You have a few years of experience in managing teams of Data and Analytics Engineers Mastery: You are familiar with data pipeline tools (airflow, dbt, etc.), modern data architectures, and data governance processes Simplicity and quality: You prefer simple solutions and are obsessed with quality Languages: You are fluent in English. French is a plus.

If you read this far and feel like this could be a great opportunity for you, don't let the imposter syndrome prevent you from applying and hit the button "Apply", we'd really love to hear from you

At Qonto we understand that true diversity isn't just about ticking boxes on a hiring checklist. Apply regardless of the boxes you tick! Who knows? You may have the missing piece of the puzzle we've been searching for all along.

üéÅ Perks 

A laptop. An inclusive work environment. A tailor-made career track. And so much more to help you succeed‚Ä¶
 A central fully-renovated building in Barcelona with WeWork services Monthly team events Tailor-made remote work policy depending on the job you apply for 23 days of paid leave + 5 additional days of paid leave Alan ( Seguro ) health insurance, Moka Care to take care of your mental health and gym access with Urban Sports Club An Edenred lunch card: 100% covered 50% public transportation reimbursementA progressive parenthood policy as part of our commitment to the Parental Act (1 in 6 of Qonto employees is a parent!) and childcare benefits with selected partners

üí™ Our hiring process:
 Interviews with your Talent Acquisition Manager and future managers A remote exercise to demonstrate your skills and give you a taste of what working at Qonto could be like

We will send you an interview guide so you can best prepare yourself.

On average our process lasts 20 working days and offers usually follow within 48 hours ü§û

Thank you for considering joining Qonto. We cannot wait to learn more about you!

One last thing. We recently raised  486M‚Ç¨ in our Series D  to ensure we keep growing safely, despite the current economic environment looking a bit gloomy. We revealed our plans for the future  here .

To learn more about us:

Qonto's Blog | Business Insider | Metropoli Abierta | Europa Press

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Our opportunity 
Are you passionate about data, processes and analytics, someone who wants to be part of an innovative and motivated team and help us make the difference? Then this is your opportunity within one of the world‚Äôs leading insurance groups!
In this role of a Senior Data Analyst, you will be part of the global ‚ÄúReporting and Analytics‚Äù team within Group Investment Management. You will collaborate closely with business users in different countries and translate analytical and reporting needs into functional requirements and solutions. You will analyse interrelationships of business processes, complex data and financial systems, define IT specifications and implement reporting front-end solution for our global end user base.
 Your role 
 As a Senior Data Analyst   your main responsibilities will involve: 

 Design and implement data products and generate insights for a global client base  Create analytical end to end solutions by extracting, transforming, modelling and visualizing data  Develop analytical, regulatory, and operational reports and dashboards using business intelligence tools  Analysis of reporting & analytics business requirements and translation into functional and technical solution specifications  Lead and support initiatives and projects related to new or existing business intelligence solutions  Perform impact analysis of application and data source changes, holding an end-to-end view of the system  Continuous improvement of existing reporting processes, services and infrastructure.  Provide end-user support/training for global reporting needs  Ensure compliance, governance, and data quality 

Your Skills And Experience
 As a Senior Data Analyst your skills and qualifications will ideally include: 

 Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in relevant field  3+ years of relevant work experience in business intelligence.  Relevant working experience in (insurance) asset management (accounting, controlling/analysis) is a plus  Basic understanding of financial instruments and financial analysis is a plus 

Technical Skills:

 Advanced skills for data analytics, data modelling and visualization with reporting front-end tools (MS Power BI, Tableau or QlikView) is key  Proficiency in data storytelling, including visualization  Strong Business Analyst skills (e.g., analytical skills, requirement engineering, design thinking, agile methodologies)  Experience with data management and cloud platforms  Experience with Data Pipelines and ETL  Proficiency in programming languages (preferably Python, Spark, Dax)  Experience with data engineering tools (Notebooks, Databricks) is a plus 

Personal Skills:

 Strong communication skills in written and spoken English (Spanish language skill is a plus)  Proven analytical and problem-solving skills  Proven ability to work in a multi-cultural environment  Good self-management skills and stress resilience  Highly organised with good attention to detail 

Additional Information
 As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes: 

 Option to work remotely even up to 80%  Flexible working hours  Wide range of internal and external trainings  Free English and Spanish classes depending on the needs  Ticket restaurant  Life Insurance  Collective Life Retirement Plan - after 1 year in the company  Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you  Special banking and insurance conditions  Exclusive Employees discounts 

Primary work location is Barcelona. Please apply with your CV in English by clicking on the button ‚ÄúApply online‚Äù.
Who We Are
Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You‚Äôd give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It‚Äôs a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.
 Diversity & Inclusion 
At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.
So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.
You are the heart & soul of Zurich! 
At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?
We highly value the experience and know-how of our employees and offer a wide range of opportunities across business areas to encourage you to apply for new opportunities within Zurich when you are ready for your next career step.
Let‚Äôs continue to grow together!

title: Data Scientist Manager (They/She/He)
description:
About Glovo
We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.
At Glovo, you‚Äôll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives‚Ä¶ all while having fun!
We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.
In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).
Your Work-life Opportunity
As a Data Science Manager you will be responsible for envisioning, leading and building an all-star team of Data Scientists working closely with key business and product leaders, analysts and engineers. You will leverage our big data platform and use state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms and statistical models to deliver robust and highly scalable algorithmic products and solutions that have a direct impact on our global user base and our business
Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Recruit, lead and manage an all-star team of Data Scientists of different seniority levels. Collaborate with business, product and engineering stakeholders to prioritise the most impactful work and ensure data science needs are accounted for.Manage the entire lifecycle of your team‚Äôs projects; from exploratory analysis to evaluation, deployment and iteration.Create the channels and tools for communicating results and monitor key metrics.Lead by example and motivate your team while bringing in new ideas on how to improve their ways of working.Ship fast and often measuring the impact using a robust experimentation framework.Coach and mentor your team to advance their careers and improve their professional skills.Act as data science evangelist, proactively looking for new opportunities to impact the business using data science tools and promoting its adoptionAct as data translator, being able to connect business problems with technical solutions and to architect them to be implemented by your teamActively collaborate with your colleagues and learn from each other in a supportive environment that allows you to grow, develop and make a difference 
You Have
2+ years of experience in a similar role, managing a data science team (5+ people) or multiple data science projects. Preferably in the digital/tech space.2+ years of strong hand-on experience as an individual contributor in industry or academia.At least an MSc, and preferably a PhD in a scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science or Mathematics.Deep theoretical and applied knowledge in one or more of the following areas: supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, game theory, statistical inference, bayesian statistics, causal inference, time series analysis, decision theory, mathematical optimisationDemonstrable experience at productizing models; from inception to deployment.Knowledge and experience working with modern machine learning platforms & deployment technologies/vendors. (MLFlow, SageMaker, etc.)Full proficiency on Python and SQL; can write, inspect and review code.Good understanding of modern application and data stacks (Microservices, Event Streaming, Data Lakes, Container-orchestration)Experience with big data (e.g. Scala and Spark) and cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, Databricks).Experience in start-up and/or R&D environments.Excellent spoken and written communication skills (English).
We are always looking for the best candidates, so if you think you would be a good fit even if you don't meet 100% of the requirements we would love to hear from you!
Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing equity plan Flexible schedule and hybrid remote work, with 2 days/week to work from home and up to 3 weeks/year to work from anywhere! Top-notch private health insurance Monthly Glovo credit to spend on our restaurant products and zero delivery fee on all Glovo orders! Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food Discounted gym memberships Flexible time off (take the time you need) Enhanced parental leave including nursery support! Online therapy and wellbeing benefit 
What You‚Äôll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: Driven to deliver quality results quickly Good Vibes: Bring positivity and communicate openlyStay Humble: Self-aware and open to learningCare: Uplift people and the planetGlownership: Act as proud ownersHigh Bar: Focus on Top Performance
If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!
Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!
Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://about.glovoapp.com/

title: Senior Data Scientist Marketplace (m/f/d) - Barcelona
description:
Location  : We are flexible! Come and join us either in Hamburg, Berlin or Barcelona or feel free to work 100% remotely in the EU*
At FREENOW we are at an exciting point in our history - we are building a world-class product that is being used daily by more than a million people. We are a part of one of the most dynamic spaces for innovation in today's world: shaping mobility. Our daily business is solving large-scale, complex problems ‚Äì and we love it!
We are keen on hiring a Data Scientist (m/f/d) for designing and implementing the models that enable our business to make even smarter and more efficient pricing and allocation decisions. Being part of the Marketplace team , you will work closely with data analysts, machine learning engineers, and other data scientists while collaborating with business stakeholders and market specialists on a daily basis.
With us, you will stretch, learn and grow in a creative, diverse, and collaborative environment that spans more than 70 nationalities and 11 markets across Europe . Don‚Äôt join FREENOW because of our perks or great office locations, join us if you can‚Äôt wait to disrupt the mobility industry with us!
YOUR DAILY ADVENTURES WILL INCLUDE:
 Work closely with your peers and business end-users to identify, understand, structure, and solve complex problems in the fast-moving world of urban mobility, focusing on the marketplace side of our business.  Collaborate with machine learning engineers to put your models into production.  Strive at growing and sharing your knowledge with the team.  Push the boundaries of what data science can do for FREENOW.  Be an ambassador of FREENOW Data Science for both internal and external stakeholders, presenting your work at core company events, meetups, and conferences. 

 TO BE SUCCESSFUL IN THIS ROLE:
 Your experience working as a data scientist enables you to lead effectively a project from business understanding to deciding on the best data science approach to solving the problem at hand  You possess a sound understanding of statistical analysis and data-driven modelling  You hold experience in designing and building machine learning and predictive algorithms and a strong understanding of feature engineering and model evaluation  While we typically look for candidates with advanced University degrees in Maths, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or other quantitative disciplines, we're happy for you to prove us wrong and show that these degrees aren't necessary You hold specific expertise in either one or more machine learning domains such as Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision, Time Series Analysis, Information Retrieval, Reinforcement Learning, etc.You are proficient in Python.You are comfortable with querying databases using SQL or HQL.Writing clean code and making your work reproducible is important for you.Not only are you curious, eager to learn, and put collaboration ahead of competition, but making your teammates grow with you, by sharing your knowledge and mentoring, is also dear to your heartYou can communicate in English. We are a very diverse team with people from all over the world and English is our language of communication, besides Python.You are passionate about harnessing data science and have the will to play an essential role in the future of urban transportation.

 BONUS SKILLS:
These skills are nice to have, but they are not a deal-breaker for us:
 Prior experience with dynamic pricing  Working knowledge of Spark  Prior experience working with notebooks and DataBricks stack  Enthusiasm for geospatial data  Proficiency in Scala and other programming languages 

 BENEFITS & PERKS IN A NUTSHELL:
 Fully remote* or hybrid working models  Free Udemy e-learning access  Sabbatical & special leave policies  Subsidised gym membership Birthday, 24th + 31st December off Partner product discounts  Mobility Benefits card  Free language courses  Employee assistance program Personal development budget
Plus more local benefits depending on your work location!
in one of the 10 countries where we have a legal entity: France, Spain, Germany, Austria, Portugal, Italy, England, Ireland, Poland & Greece
DIVERSITY, EQUITY & INCLUSION:
FREENOW is an equal opportunity employer and we consider qualified applicants regardless of race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability or age.
We want you to grow and evolve, bring your true self to work .

title: Project Specialist, Data and Business Management
description:
About this role:
We are seeking a customer-focused associate with strong quantitative, process, and communication skills to join the Research and Advisory‚Äôs (R&A) Content and Research Excellence (CRE) organization within Gartner. As the Project Specialist, this role will support the leaders who manage Gartner content coverage by supporting projects and providing insights and tools to drive client engagement and retention. This role will collaborate across different organizations with R&A and Gartner, more broadly.
What you will do:
You‚Äôll collaborate with content creators, market research, product managers, data scientists and engineers to prepare reports and analysis to inform business decision making, and provide general support for R&A‚Äôs data efforts, as well as manage core CRE processes and support core CRE programs critical to enabling the creation and management of contentProvide front-line support for content creators on best practices for planning, creating, managing and promoting content Responsible for providing support to multiple processes and projects for the CPE team (e.g., new content leader onboarding, updates to corporate metadata, etc). Help shape business questions and align the right mix of inputs (quantitative and qualitative) for the most impactful analysis Support the Client Topic Sensing, Continuous Engagement and Key Initiative Leadership community enablement teams on additional projects as needed
What you‚Äôll need:
1-2 years of experience in Economics, Statistics, Finance, Marketing Analytics or other data science field Bachelor‚Äôs degree in data science or other relevant field (e.g. Business Administration, Marketing etc.) Excellent project management skillsNative-level verbal and written communication in EnglishExperience with business information services preferredHigh data literacy, with a passion for data scienceStrong knowledge of Advanced Excel, MS Office, Power BI, statistical methodologies
Who are we?
Gartner delivers actionable, objective insight to executives and their teams. Our expert guidance and tools enable faster, smarter decisions and stronger performance on an organization‚Äôs mission-critical priorities. We‚Äôve grown exponentially since our founding in 1979 and we're proud to have over 19,500 associates globally that support over 15,000 client enterprises in more than 100 countries.
What makes Gartner a great place to work?
Our teams are composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations. We believe that a diversity of experiences makes us stronger‚Äîas individuals, as communities and as an organization. That‚Äôs why we're recognized worldwide as a great place to work year after year. We've been recognized by Fortune as one of the World‚Äôs Most Admired Companies, named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index and a Best Place to Work for Disability Inclusion by the Disability Equality Index. Looking for a place to turn your big ideas into reality? Join #LifeAtGartner
What we offer:
Our people are our most valuable asset, so we invest in them from Day 1. When you join our team, you‚Äôll have access to a vast array of benefits to help you live your life well. These resources are designed to support your physical, financial and emotional well-being. We encourage continued personal and professional growth through ongoing learning and development opportunities. Our employee resource groups, charity match and volunteer programs keep you connected to your internal Gartner community and causes that matter to you.
The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company‚Äôs career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.

title: Data Functional Lead - PageGroup SSC
description:
Internacional environment and a good opportunity for a career boost |English is a must - Spanish is not required 
About Our Client

At the heart of Page Group's business are the thousands of people's lives we change, the outstanding service we provide to our clients and candidates and the exciting opportunities within our offices all over the world. We're proud to set the standard in the recruitment profession - our specialist service with a personal touch is how we change lives for people by creating opportunities to reach potential.

In Barcelona, our Shared Services Centre regroups positions to support our operations in Europe and globally.

Find out more here: https://www.pagepersonnel.es/clientprofile/pagegroup-shared-services-centre

Job Description

Purpose of the Role:

The Data Functional Lead will work with a team of Data Business Analysts with expertise in the Enterprise Data Platform, Page Insights products and knowledge of the source systems & processes feeding the data used in each of these products.

Key Responsibilities

The purpose of the role is to ensure the required functional capability is in place to successfully deliver the Data programme roadmap through all stages of the product development cycle. This will be achieved through adequate resourcing and development of the Data Business Analysts, as well as the continuous improvement of the existing delivery process to maximize delivery efficiency and reduce the time-to-market.
 Work closely with Data Programme leads, Product owners and Customer Adoption and Success teams contributing to an efficient workflow from business demand, business case, delivery and management of change. Distribute work within the Data BA team in collaboration with the Programme Manager and Scrum Master according to the priorities of the Data Programme. Ensure qualified business changes are analysed, clarified and documented and taken to a 'ready for design' stage before they are handed over to the relevant Data Delivery team. This includes the documentation of business requirements (User Stories) with business users and the definition of acceptance criteria. Input to solution options and act as a conduit between the business needs and technical delivery. Once User Stories are 'in build', the Data Functional Lead ensures that Data BAs work closely with the Build team (Technical Leads and Development teams) with whom they address ambiguities, making sure the Build team fully understand the requirements to avoid rework. Ensure the Data BAs support quality assurance activities including functional and non-functional testing and provide guidance on the type/level of test required to safely introduce the change. Accountable for establishing consistent ways of working across the Data BA team, including but not limited to user stories repositories, specification documents as well as maintaining data dictionaries.
The Successful Applicant

Experience

The ideal candidate has experience in the following areas:
 as a line manager to a small team as a Business Analyst or assuming Business Analysis responsibilities as part of their role defining requirements for Reporting / Business Intelligence / Data Analytics projects, producing data mapping files, describing complex data transformations and visualization specifications Data/BI solutions analysing data using basic scripts or excel Scrum and Agile development methodology working at global level with cross-functional teams, demonstrating cultural awareness in a customer facing role in the consultancy sector (this is a plus)
It would be good if the candidate has had exposure to the following areas:
 design of logical data models to deliver business requirements work/project management tools such as DevOps, Jira
Skills/behaviour
 Integrity Drive Self-confidence Capacity to influence at all levels Empathetic Analytical, creative and curious mind High level of autonomy and sense of ownership Positive attitude Fluent in English and another language is a plus
What's On Offer
Career developmentBonus, Food Voucher, Life Insurance, Private Health InsuranceInternational environmentContact: Larissa Gamboni

title: Senior Data Scientist (f/m/d)
description:
About The Role
Essity has a clear strategy to become a data driven organization and is investing in collecting and analyzing data from sales, back office and the factory floor to provide to enable more relevant insights across the organization. Essity has already deployed connected solutions using IoT technologies in Professional Hygiene and Incontinence Care solutions to improve the lives of people using these new technologies. To take this to the next level we need new capabilities to unlock the insights hidden within these data sources.
Therefore, we are searching for an experienced Senior Data Scientist (f/m/d). The purpose of the role is to develop data-driven solutions to difficult business challenges across a range of business domains by using state-of-the-art machine learning techniques and understand how to convert theory and models into company operations.
This role will be part of the Data Science Center of Excellence, delivering advanced data science, machine learning and AI solutions.
This position is offered with a hybrid working pattern. Onsite days based at one of our offices: Munich, Gothenburg, Barcelona, Lisbon, or Paris.
We're looking for people who embody our values, aren't afraid to challenge, innovate, experiment, and move at a fast pace. We're always looking for ways to improve our products and ourselves. If this is you, we'd love to talk.‚ÄØ
‚ÄØ
 What You Will Do
Develop data-driven solutions to difficult business challenges across a range of business domains by using state-of-the-art data science techniques and understand how to convert theory and models into company operations.Coach, mentor and develop team members, act as a technical expert, guide junior colleagues in both technical aspects as well as other management responsibilities (skills and knowledge building, performance evaluation, recruiting etc.)Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging internal and external data to drive business value. Ensure application of data science solution to generate value, e.g., to increase and optimize customer experience, revenue generation, process improvements, ad targeting and other business outcomes, as well as supporting cost savings initiatives.Coordinate with different functional teams to implement end-to-end Machine Learning solutions and monitor outcomes. Lead the development of processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and accuracy (MLOps).Communicate results and ideas in a clear and concise way to key decision makers also on top management level and drive a change in how these solutions are adoptedKeep up-to-data with latest technology trends in the area of AI and data scienceExpert advisory to the business in terms of opportunities, data modelling and data science
 Who You Are
University degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., but not limited to ‚Äì Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, Natural Sciences, etc.) or equivalent work experienceSignificant experience in developing end-to-end Data Science SolutionsExperience with state-of-the-art data science and ML practices along with advanced knowledge of and experience with Python (particularly for ML)Experience in developing scalable ML-based production systems, Databrick, MS Azure ML and MLOps would be an advantageIndependent way of working, self-confident appearance at times on management levelFluent in English (written and verbal)
 What We Can Offer You
At Essity, we believe every career is as unique as the individual and empower employees to reach their full potential in a winning culture motivated by a powerful purpose.
Our diversity makes us strong and creates an inclusive,‚ÄØinviting‚ÄØand harmonious workplace where individuality is appreciated by everyone. For this reason, incoming applications are selected based on professional qualifications and working values regardless of ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual identity, nationality,‚ÄØdisability‚ÄØor age.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Collaborative and Caring Culture | Empowerment & Engaged People | Work with Impact and A Powerful Purpose | Individual Learning & Career Growth | Health & Safety Priority | Sustainable Value Together| Innovation| Sustainable Working Life | Total Reward
Together, we are improving lives, every day.
Working at Essity is not just a career; it is a chance to directly make the world a healthier, more hygienic and safer place. With impactful innovations coupled with sustainable solutions, we strive to reach more people every year with the necessary and essential solutions for well-being.

title: Data Scientist (Remote in Spain)
description:
About Us
Have you always wanted to put your passion for education to use on the job? Would you like to work with an incredible team making an impact on learning around the world? If you answered yes, we can't wait to meet you!
And just who are we? Edpuzzle is a leading edtech company with offices in San Francisco and Barcelona and nearly 10 years of history helping teachers find and create exciting, interactive video lessons. Over 80% of U.S. schools and millions of teachers and students in 190+ countries around the world are already using Edpuzzle to make education more equitable and engaging.
About The Role
We‚Äôre looking for our next Data Scientist to join the Data & Analytics team in Spain. You‚Äôll be responsible for adapting techniques from research to specific clients and research problems. You will advise on technical and theoretical possibilities within the data science domain and report and present research findings and developments clearly and efficiently, both internally and externally, verbally and in writing.
Wondering what it‚Äôs like to work at Edpuzzle?
Picture a place where you can connect with your teammates, whether remotely or in person, whenever you need support. A place where one day you're helping shape one of the biggest edtech platforms in the world, and the next day you're doing a teambuilding activity with your coworkers. A place where everyone has been selected because they're the best at what they do, and where your manager and team trust your decisions fully. A place where you're encouraged to learn and grow because education is the cornerstone of everything we do. Check out the job details below to see if Edpuzzle could be the right fit for you!
About The Job
Identify valuable data sources and automate collection processesExtract and query data from our data lake and data warehouse ‚Äì undertake the preprocess of structured and unstructured dataAnalyze large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns, and interpret and analyse data problemsPropose solutions and strategies to business challengesCollaborate with the Engineering and Product teamsBuild analytic systems and predictive modelsDerive insights from our customer‚Äôs behaviours and journeys to facilitate activities for acquisition, engagement, and retention

About You
You have 1 year of proven experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar roleGraduate degree in Data Science or another quantitative field preferred; BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related fieldYou are able to work with big amounts of data identifying patterns and relationshipsYou can organise, store, protect data, and present it in an accurate and understandable mannerYou have deep knowledge of Python and their most useful librariesYou can work with relational and non-relational databasesYou have proven experience managing projects handling multiple stakeholders, identifying constraints, and organising processes to maximise efficiencyStrong mathematical skills

Bonus skills
Familiarity with Javascript languageExperience working with AWS consoleExperience using business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau)Experience with NewRelic‚Ä¶ or another amazing skill you bring to the table that we haven‚Äôt thought of yet!

What‚Äôs it like to work remotely?
Work from the comfort of your own homeUse the Edpuzzle office as much or as little as you likeMeet with your manager and team via video calls on Google Meet or SlackConnect with coworkers via Slack (with channels for work and for fun!)To enjoy our remote work policy, you‚Äôll need high-speed internet access

What we offer
Competitive salary at ‚Ç¨‚Äé30,000 - ‚Ç¨‚Äé36,000 and a yearly salary review based on performanceFree private health insurance policy with AXA‚Ç¨2000 annually for mealsFlexible remuneration for childcare and transportation24 paid holidays plus December 24th and 31stFlexible working hours and reduced working time on FridaysRemote-friendly: Feel free to work 100% remotely or use the Barcelona office whenever you want, for the best of both worlds!Free coffee, snacks, and drinks in the Barcelona officeTeambuilding events during working hoursIncredible opportunity to grow, learn, and build lifetime bonds with other passionate people!

Edpuzzle is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.
This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship. Edpuzzle makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.
References from previous employers will be requested from candidates during the selection process. If you'd like to be considered for this position, please apply below. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Senior Product Data Analyst
description:
eDreams ODIGEO is one of the world‚Äôs largest online travel companies and one of the largest European e-commerce businesses. Under its four leading online travel agency brands ‚Äì eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo ‚Äì it offers the best deals in regular flights, low-cost airlines, hotels, cruises, car rental, dynamic packages, holiday packages and travel insurance to make travel easier, more accessible, and better value for the more than 18 million customers it serves across 43 markets. eDreams ODIGEO is listed in the Spanish Stock Market.
Our Experiments and Insights team is the centre of excellence for Online (AB) Experimentation and for providing best practices to generate insights and learning from and for the experiments. Our goal is to help different teams across the organization to succeed in their mission by providing insights generation and data analysis support in a healthy data-informed environment.
We are looking for a Senior Product Data Analyst who has experience working with analytics tools such as SQL (mostly for BigQuery usage) and preferably also R/Python, visualization tools as LookerStudio; that has a strong statistics knowledge and experience in statistics applied to AB testing or experimentation.
In this role, you would be performing as a product data analyst (tasks are described below) to support a set of product teams, but you will be also part of the next experimentation generation at eDreams ODIGEO. The team is constantly investigating best in class methodologies and processes to implement in our business/analysis and tests, which means you will be required to apply your mathematical knowledge in some strategic projects that are focused on taking more accurate decisions maintaining a strong statistical confidence level.
Your will be working with multi-disciplinary teams - Qualitative Researchers, Designers, Product Owners, Developers, and Pricing Managers - to blend different statistical and data analytics techniques to generate a holistic understanding of the users and markets.
Main responsibilities (included but not limited to):
 Analyse performance and identify behaviours in our different websites and interfaces related to our products;  Analyse performance and user behaviours in the A/B Tests experiments or Pre-Post run by the product teams;  Help the product teams to generate their testing hypotheses by providing exploratory analysis about our products, past tests, etc,  Data cleaning and validation,  Definition of new tracking that will all mostly be added in Google Analytics (to be able to answer different kinds of research/product questions);  Build and maintain dashboards (mostly using Data Studio) and/or reports (mostly in Google Sheets) to share performance information with senior management and C-level stakeholders;  Lead data-driven initiatives to improve company decision making and business knowledge;  Responsabile for one or more team‚Äôs projects such as the investigation and implementation of new methodologies, new data analysis techniques or the usage of new tools;  Collaborate with user researchers and designers to detect gaps in knowledge about our user; identify research opportunities to fill those gaps. 
NOTE: Data you will be using could come from Google Analytics API or Googe Analytics tables in BigQuery, other sources of data stored in BigQuery such as internal databases, customer service database, etc as well as our data stored and accessible in Microstrategy.
Skills and Experience:
 Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline is a requirement (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, etc.),  Minimum of 6 years experience in a role with strong analytical component,  Previous experience in user behavior analysis (product performance) using data from any of the followings: Google Analytics/Adobe Analytics/Mix Panel/ Amplitude/Matomo/‚Ä¶  Strong knowledge of the math and statistical concepts behind A/B testing,  Strong knowledge of SQL is a requirement, as well as experience in working with databases and large sets of data,  R or Python programming skills (mostly for data extraction and data manipulation),  Advanced Office skills. Strong experience with analytical tools, ideally with the Google toolset (spreadsheets, google docs, etc),  Knowledge of visualisation tools like LookerStudio, Tableau, Looker or Qlikview,  Business Proficiency in English,  A self-starter and team player, who also enjoys to have fun! 
Plus:
 Google Analytics knowledge (as well as Google Analytics API, googleAnalyticsR library for R, GA4, etc.),  Previous experience in programming,  Knowledge on data structure and data sets management in Google Cloud Platform. 
 What we offer: 
 We support a phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance with our flexible hours and flexible remote work policy.  A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels.  Competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus structure.  Excellent environment for continuous growth and learning: with our Learning & Development programs, you will have access to tech talks, internal soft skills and technical skills training, language lessons, external events and industry conferences.  Free subscription to Coursera Learning Platform.  Fast-track career development: with our unique programs, you are always working towards the next step on your career path.  We also have for you a Ticket Restaurant benefit & unlimited beverages and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) because we like our eDOers happy and healthy.  New to the city? We also offer great relocation packages.  Additional prizes and awards for a variety of team and individual achievements.  Fun at work: at eDreams ODIGEO, work and fun go hand in hand! 
‚Ä¶ And the opportunity to work on a dynamic, dedicated, fun and passionate team of professionals. We journey together!
Come dream with us and join us now!
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

title: Data Modelling Architect
description:
En VISEO nos diferenciamos por la participaci√≥n en proyectos innovadores de soluciones Cloud, usando tecnolog√≠as Microsoft. Desarrollamos proyectos con alto nivel de automatizaci√≥n, integraci√≥n continua y Deploy Continuo, ALM avanzado, Release Management, en arquitecturas de microservicios cloud y movilidad.
Tu Rol:

Tu perfil:

title: Junior Big Data Engineer (Tech Support) - Google Cloud Platform
description:
WHAT WE LOOK FOR
Are you looking forward to being a Cloud Engineer? Do you think it could be interesting to learn the top notch technologies available from Google‚Äôs internal point of view? Would you like to learn every single bit of the cloud systems and how Big Data works on the top Companies worldwide? In this case please keep reading as we are looking for a talented Cloud Data Engineer with a deep understanding of Python/Java to join our young and international team based in Barcelona.
Companies all around the world rely on Google Cloud! Here your main responsibility will be to provide outstanding technical support for the most prestigious Google Cloud clients.
As part of our team you will be responsible of providing high level technical support to BigData products and ETL processes ranging from Orchestration (such as Airflow/Kubernetes) to parallel processing frameworks (such as Spark, Hadoop, Beam) to relational databases for analysis (SQL) among other technologies closely related to Artificial Intelligence (such as Machine Learning applications) to worldwide clients while gathering feedback to help improve the Cloud Platform products, which will boost your IT career into the next level.
Minimum requirements:
100% fluent in English.European citizenship or work permit in SpainBachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, software/computer engineering, or applicable work experience.Experience with Linux/UNIXUnderstanding of basic web technologies (e.g. TCP/IP, DNS, HTTP, etc.).In-depth programming skills in Python or JavaExperience with relational SQL and NoSQL databasesUnderstanding of streaming data architectures and technologies for real-time data processing
Desirable skills:
Data warehousing and ETL ToolsExperience with big data tools (e.g. Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, HBase, etc.)Experience in Machine LearningExperience with code repositoriesExperience with cloud providers (Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure)
WHAT YOU WILL GET
Permanent contractFull time position (39 hours / week)Salary package: 30.040‚Ç¨ gross/year (25.000 as base salary + 3.000 as bonus + 1.540 ticket restaurant + private health insurance valued approximately 500‚Ç¨)Salary review after one yearTwo months of paid training!Learning is the key to success. Here you will be having constant training + access to all the Google Cloud certifications, for free!You will become an expert on Cloud. You will get to know how the Cloud really works in a corporate environment.23 days of vacation and day off on your birthday (+ Google Days off)Free fresh fruit and coffeeNot everything can be working: we have Ping pong, arcade machines, pool table and foosball in the office!Teamwork in a multicultural environment, social activities and personal development, where you and your colleagues will be working together in order to achieve the objectives and learn together.Relocation available for new joiners from outside Catalonia!
No dress code! You will be working in a casual environment from Monday to Friday from 9am to 6pm. In the future you might work some weeks from 8am to 5 pm or 10 am to 7 pm (according to business needs).
You will also be working one weekend every two months being extra paid in case that you do so. The weekend working shift could either be from 9am to 6 pm or from 6am to 3pm.
WHO WE ARE
Webhelp Group is a consolidated and dynamic international company providing service to the top 10 companies belonging to the IT and social networking world. We are based in the heart of Barcelona with more than 3000 employees from all over the world. On top of that, we offer an attractive environment with a great team spirit.
The recruitment processes and people involved in them (both recruiters and Project Managers) will not discriminate any candidacy because of age, disability, ethnic, marital status, gender, nationality, ideology, political, race, religion and sexual orientation.

title: Senior Data Engineer
location: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
description:
We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join our data engineering team. If you are passionate about solving problems and making improvements through data and technology, we are eager to talk to you. The ideal candidate has both a willingness and desire to work in a dynamic environment, is able to apply Agile methodologies in day-to-day activities, and is a self-motivated developer who also enjoys working in a team environment. Our people have a creative, innovative, fun, and collaborative attitude, and are dedicated to creating new and valuable solutions for HP.

The Senior Data Engineer applies advanced subject matter knowledge to solve complex business issues and is regarded as a subject matter expert. Frequently contributes to the development of new ideas and methods. Works on complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of multiple factors. Leads and/or provides expertise to functional project teams and may participate in cross-functional initiatives. Acts as an expert providing direction and guidance to process improvements and establishing policies. Frequently represents the organization to external customers/clients. Exercises significant independent judgment within broadly defined policies and practices to determine the best method for accomplishing work and achieving objectives. May provide mentoring and guidance to lower-level employees.

Responsibilities

You will design, develop, test, modify, deploy, and document solutions and services in both local and cloud-based deployments of our Big Data infrastructure. Create solutions using current programming languages and tools and interact with team members, customers, and partners to define requirements. Collaborate with stakeholders and data scientists to analyze, extract, and report meaningful insights from data collected.

A Senior Data Engineer
Provides core contributions to multiple products, projects, solutions and processes through all stages of the development lifecycle including but not limited to design, analysis, coding, testing and integration.Is a highly skilled technical leader responsible for key system areas and ensures that changes are delivered with high quality and that best practices are used.May lead cross-team or cross-organization technical efforts related to the application design and development.Reviews and evaluates designs and project activities for compliance with applications design and development guidelines and standards; provides tangible feedback to improve product quality and mitigate failure risk.Provides domain-specific expertise and overall software leadership and perspective to cross-organization projects, programs, and activities.Drives innovation and integration of new technologies into projects and activities in the software applications design organization.Provides guidance and mentoring to less-experienced staff members.Participates in analyzing requirements and high-level designs.Implements, tests, and maintains software modules created.Participates in code reviews.Gives input to management on task duration estimates, technical information, and issue resolution.Provides domain-specific expertise and perspective to partners.Maintains awareness of new tools, environments, and methodologies being used in the Big Data space.Recommends ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality.Develops processes for data modeling, mining, and reporting.Researches opportunities for acquiring new data and new uses for existing data.
Qualifications
Typically 5+ years of experience in software or data engineering.Extensive experience in data modeling, data integration and processing of structured and unstructured data.Proficient in one or more programming languages (Python preferred).Strong SQL proficiency (experience with NoSQL ‚Äì advantage).Experienced with Apache SparkExcellent communication skills; mastery in English and local language.Ability to effectively communicate product architectures, design and change proposals.
Additional Preferred Qualifications / Advantages
DatabricksPandasDataikuFamiliar with best practices of the data and software engineering lifecycle and/or best practices of the above platforms and tools.Scala
About HP

You‚Äôre out to reimagine and reinvent what‚Äôs possible‚Äîin your career as well as the world around you.

So are we. We love taking on tough challenges, disrupting the status quo, and creating what‚Äôs next. We‚Äôre in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges, driven to learn and grow, and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.

HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone, everywhere.

Our history: HP‚Äôs commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion ‚Äì it's just who we are.

From the boardroom to factory floor, we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves, while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that, you‚Äôre more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

title: Senior Data Solutions, Science & Engineering Specialist
description:
Our opportunity 
Join and help us augment a multidisciplinary and high-profile team of business analysts, project managers, enterprise & solution architects and developers working on key applications and strategic projects for Commercial Insurance ‚Äì Zurich Resilience Solutions with an ambitious goal: deliver global applications that enable Zurich Resilience Solutions best practices and trusted risk assessment methodologies.
The Senior Data Solutions, Science & Engineering Specialist leads the identification, assessment and design of specific solutions to address identified business challenges. Plans and collaborates with organizational unit stakeholders through the lifecycle of a project to lead the development of advanced analytics models and production of business insights.
If you have a sound knowledge in designing and developing big data solutions, and experience in insurance industry and a vast interest to deepen your domain knowledge in Commercial Insurance, we look forward to receiving your application.
At Zurich we truly care about our employees, customers, stakeholders, and the communities we serve. Imagine working for a values-driven organization that has the ambition and desire to be the best global insurance provider in the world. Zurich is that place. Where 55,000 employees across approximately 200 countries and territories are all focused on helping people and helping companies protect what is truly most important to them. We are a values-driven organization that takes pride in the work that we do every day and we have the ambition to be the best global insurer in the world.
 Your role 
 As a Senior Data Solutions, Science & Engineering Specialist your main responsibilities will involve: 

 Leading designing, development and validation of prototype models built using a variety of modeling techniques. Constructing dataset procedures that can help with data mining, modeling, and production, enhancing the data quality. Developing advanced analytics model and supporting implementation of these models, ensuring data solutions align with business objectives and looking ahead to understand future technology options for the business.  Serving as technical expert in a specific process or product area, conducting process reviews and initiating change to contribute towards continuous improvement of services to internal customers.  Use descriptive data model for data aggregation to extract historical insights. Create predictive models applying forecasting techniques to get future actionable insights and recommendations, identifying hidden patterns from stored data.  Looking externally/internally to research primary data sources, selecting relevant information, continually evaluating key themes in technology, making recommendations to inform policy and/or product development in own area of IT.  Provide support to Zurich Resilience Solutions platforms support team when required in resolving queries/errors and ensuring technological problems are resolved quickly and efficiently.  Develop, propose and lead the implementation of initiatives to improve processes, develop policies and support innovation in the Zurich Resilience Solutions field.  Analyze key themes from data around risks and loss to identify how different scenarios may have an impact upon the business.  Balance the competing constraints of scope, schedule, budget, quality, resources, risk and dependencies to produce the specified product, service or result.  Coaching and training more junior team members. 

Your Skills And Experience
 As a Senior Data Solutions, Science & Engineering Specialist your skills and qualifications will ideally include: 

 At least 5 years in a Data Science & Engineering Specialist role, ideally supporting application development in large, complex organizations.  Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in relevant field.  Sound experience coding in a core programming language (i.e. Python, Java, Scala) and familiarity with distributed computing e.g. using Apache Spark.  Proficient in Big Data Analytics technologies (Databricks preferred) including hands-on expertise with complex proof-of-concepts, governance and public cloud platform(s).  Proficiency in Teams, Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Project.  Experience working in Agile methodology (Scrum, Kanban) and tooling (e.g., Azure DevOps).  Experience in project management is a must.  Team player who is skilled at building up and managing stakeholder relationships.  Proven ability to work in a multi-cultural environment.  Good self-management skills and stress resilience.  Highly organized with very good attention to detail.  Advanced Communication skills in written and spoken English.  Spanish and German language skills are a plus.  Sound knowledge of the insurance industry, ideally Commercial Insurance is of advantage. 

Additional Information
 As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes: 

 Option to work remotely within Spain even up to 100% - you choose  Flexible working hours  Wide range of internal and external trainings  Free English and Spanish classes depending on the needs  Ticket restaurant  Life Insurance  Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company  Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you  Special banking and insurance conditions  Exclusive Employees discounts 

Primary work location is Barcelona, Poblenou. Option to telework from any location within Spain territory is also feasible.
We are looking forward to receiving your application!
Please apply with your CV in English.
Who We Are
Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You‚Äôd give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It‚Äôs a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.
So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.
At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.
Why Zurich
At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?
We are an equal opportunity employer who knows that each employee is unique - that‚Äôs what makes our team so great!
Join us as we constantly explore new ways to protect our customers and the planet .

 Location(s): ES - Barcelona  Remote working: Yes  Schedule: Full Time  Recruiter name: Alvaro Gallego Zazo

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Are you ready to shape the future of travel by working at one of the world's largest online travel companies? At eDreams ODIGEO you can make travel experiences better for people across the world, combining more than 600 airlines and 100.000 flights worldwide every day into billions of potential combinations and helping our users find the very best travel deals.
Our passion is travel, our business is technology.
Our dynamic team of young, talented professionals from over 60 different nationalities and varied academic backgrounds is driven by one clear mission: making travel easier, more accessible, and creating better value for our customers worldwide. Within the Data Science team, we are focussed on researching and building cutting-edge solutions to evolve better travel experiences for our customers, all by leveraging the information from over 30 million searches that we receive everyday! Due to this scale, we are able to have a wider and better selection of travel plans that are tailored to suit the traveller‚Äôs needs which is probably more than any other travel site. We have dozens of machine learning models in production making hundreds of thousands of predictions which help improve customer experience, optimise processes and adapt to changing market conditions. The team is constantly analysing the past to understand it, and predicting the future to guide the business on making decisions that drive the most value both for our customers and our business.
We set the path with data and intelligence. Shape with us the way people travel.
We are looking for a passionate, highly analytical Data Scientist to join our talented team in the sunny and vibrant Barcelona office. You will have the opportunity to crunch massive datasets using the latest Big Data technologies as well as solve problems using state of the art algorithms. You will have the chance to debate and explore new ideas, approaches and technologies with your compatriots to design and implement the best solutions. We follow the philosophy of using the right tool for the right job and are not afraid to explore the greenfield. You will be a key player in the organization; designing and implementing advanced analytics and using machine learning to build AI powered solutions for almost every area in the business like online fraud detection, recommendation engines, user experience personalization, optimizing the flight combinations we offer or the marketing campaigns we launch, and virtually every possible area subject to optimization in the business. Join us and help us reach our ambitious goal of becoming the global leader in online travel!
As a Senior Data Scientist, apart from gathering and analysing data, generating insights and building models, you will also be responsible for:
 As a first step, take a business challenge, understand it, and translate it to a data science or machine learning problem  Successfully discuss and negotiate plans and initiatives with stakeholders, leading necessary meetings  Organise, create, communicate and present effectively to large audiences of different backgrounds  Coordinate with stakeholders and organize tasks for yourself and peers involved, guiding projects to ensure its alignment with company's strategy  Train and execute models following best practices in DS, designing and implementing any end-to-end ML solution necessary in collaboration with IT and Data Engineering stakeholders  Write quality code following good practices and standards (we love PEP-8, testing and documentation), and coach and mentor your peers to do so  Address potential pitfalls due to technical constraints before they arise by working around them  Take advantage of cloud solutions to improve the time to market  Mentor and lead other data scientists, and keep yourself updated on advancements in the field of ML and share it with your peers  Capitalize the opportunities for testing and implementing cutting edge algorithms, prioritizing delivery and impact on business  Create or adapt algorithms to fit non-standard problems 
About you:
 Degree in a quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or other quantitative fields).  5+ years of related experience as a Data Scientist, Machine Learning engineer or similar.  Previous experience in problem solving, strong analytical and technical skills.  A solid understanding of appropriate statistical, data mining and machine learning methods for various analysis situations.  Experience using programming languages like Python, Scala, Java, Spark etc.  Experience in Big Data technologies; such as NoSQL/graph databases and/or distributed computing would be a plus.  Written and oral communication skills (in English). 
What do we offer?
 Safe environment during COVID times: Onboarding and daily work can be done 100% remote.  A free eDreams Prime subscription to benefit from significant discounts on your travels.  Competitive compensation package with an attractive bonus structure.  Excellent environment for continuous growth and learning: with our Learning & Development programs, you will have access to tech talks, internal soft skills and technical skills training, language lessons, external events and industry conferences.  Free subscription to Coursera Online Learning.  Fast-track career development: with our unique programs, you are always working towards the next step on your career path.  We also have for you a Ticket Restaurant benefit & unlimited beverages and coffee for free at the office (with many types of milk alternatives) because we like our eDOers happy and healthy!  A phenomenal lifestyle and work-life-balance.  New to the city? We also offer great relocation packages.  Additional prizes and awards for a variety of team and individual achievements.  Fun at work: at eDreams ODIGEO, work and fun go hand in hand! 
‚Ä¶ And the opportunity to work on a dynamic, dedicated, fun, and passionate team of professionals. We journey together!
Come dream with us and join us now.
eDreams ODIGEO under its four leading online travel agency brands ‚Äì eDreams, GO Voyages, Opodo, Travellink, and the metasearch engine Liligo ‚Äìis an equal opportunity employer and value diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

title: Data Governance & Enablement Manager (d/f/m)
description:
THE ROLE
This role can be filled in any of our offices (hybrid) or fully remote from one of the following countries: Germany, Spain, Netherlands, Ireland or UK.
Personio is growing rapidly. With that growth comes the increasing demand for data to support decision-making, set and track goals, predict the future and automate processes. In order to meet that demand, Data is on a mission to enable better decisions within the company. We do that by facilitating internal teams to create and share high quality data products easily, and by building core data products on our own.
As Data Governance & Enablement Manager, you will have a crucial role on that mission. You are part of a newly forming Governance & Enablement team, which leads a federated governance group. On top of that, you provide the best capabilities for others to deliver quick, stable and valuable solutions around data and facilitate decision-making around global policies.
Therefore, you will be working closely with different Data Experts and Business Stakeholders in a modern data environment (AWS, Snowflake, dbt and more).
Responsibilities:
Together with the Data Governance Group you implement and evangelize for Personio‚Äôs Data Manifesto, which defines roles, responsibilities and values around data and thus the company's data visionFollowing our principles, you collaborate with experts to create best practices and set global policies, which ensures efficient, cross-functional and high-quality work with dataYou assure that other teams adopt new practices, processes and tools over a transition or learning period and help them to monitor their successYou act as a stakeholder to the data platform team. Through a strong network in the company you identify global opportunities to increase integrity, efficiency and accessibility of data

WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED
Leading experience on transformative data governance projects such as implementing a Data Manifesto with changing roles and responsibilitiesExperience in allowing independent teams to own Data Products end2end while ensuring interoperability through global policies (Data Mesh principle)Outgoing personality that proactively connects with data producers and consumers to understand their needs and to advocate for our principlesExperience in Data Security and Privacy and it‚Äôs limitations and opportunitiesIdentifying global solutions and actionable guidance for a diverse stakeholder groupExperience with implementing tools around Data Management (e.g. Data Catalog) to ensure quality, accessibility, transparency, searchability and security of dataExperience in data platform tools along the whole dataflow is a big plus (such as Gitlab, Airflow, Fivetran, dbt, Tableau)Up to date with current trends and technologies around Data Governance, ensuring we can choose the right processes and tools for our needs

WHY PERSONIO
Aside from our people, culture, and mission, there are a variety of additional benefits that help make Personio a great place to work!
Competitive compensation package ‚Äì reevaluated each year ‚Äì that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity28 days of paid vacation, plus another additional day after 2 and 4 years (because we love what we do, but we also love vacation!)2 Impact Days you can use to have an impact on the environment and society ‚Äì one for an individual project of your choice and one for a company-wide initiative! #SocialResponsibilityFind your best way to work with our office-led, remote-friendly PersonioFlex! We offer a roughly 50% remote, 50% in-office working framework to suit your needsAnnual personal development budget for you to invest in your development via professional memberships, external certifications, conferences, and moreRegular company and team events like All Company Culture Week and local year-end celebrationsHigh-impact working environment with flat hierarchies and short decision-making processesReceive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities with PersonioCaresSave money with corporate discounts across brands like Adidas, LG, Bosch, Apple, and moreChoose between green mobility options, including a bike lease covered by PersonioMonthly tax-free stipend of ‚Ç¨162 to help cover food and public transportation expenses (Cobee)Private health insurance (company level plan): Access to Sanitas plan at a reduced employee cost (‚Ç¨43 for employees, spouse, or children)Access multiple fitness studios and sports facilities across Spain for ‚Ç¨30 per month with a subsidized Gympass membershipFree English and Spanish language classes

ABOUT US
Bring your best. Make your mark. We‚Äôre using technology to revolutionize the way HR operates so that we can transform the way millions of people experience work every day. We move fast, challenge the status quo, and support our people as they shape their careers.
With over 8,000 customers and a team of 1,700 in seven offices across Europe, now is the perfect time to join! We believe in hiring driven people who want to make an impact. So bring your best, and let‚Äôs build the future of HR technology together.
Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We #EmbraceUniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

title: Head of Data Engineering (d/f/m) - Barcelona or Remote Spain
description:
THE ROLE
This position can be held on-site in any of our offices or remote in any of the following regions and countries, Germany, Spain, Ireland, UK and the Netherlands. 
Personio is growing rapidly. With that growth comes the increasing demand for data to support decision-making, set and track goals, predict the future and automate processes. In order to meet that demand, Data is on a mission to enable better decisions within the company. We do that by facilitating internal teams to create and share high quality data products easily, and by building core data products on our own.
As the Head of Data Engineering, you will play a vital role in our mission. You will take ownership of our data platform and lead a team responsible for its tooling and maintenance.
Personio is constantly enhancing their data tech stack to meet the needs of our rapid growth. Alongside working within Amazon Web Services (AWS), you will have the opportunity to enhance our platform which consists of Snowflake, Airflow, dbt, Fivetran and more, which you will leverage to ensure the platform's efficiency and effectiveness.

Coordinate with stakeholders, understand project requirements, and ensure successful execution. description:

 COTY, Granollers, Spain

 Deliver Key Performance Indicators, making sure to reach the Service Level Agreement targets  Deep understanding of the product creation cycles and basic data maintenance, whilst understanding the business impacts and ensuring that the data flows correctly to all platforms.
