title: Azure Data Architect
description:
Data Lake Architect/ Manager CoE 
Coty is one of the world‚Äôs largest beauty companies with an iconic portfolio of brands across fragrance, color cosmetics, skin care and body care. COTY is the global leader in fragrance and number three in color cosmetics. COTY‚Äôs products are sold in over 150 countries around the world. COTY and its brands are committed to range of social causes as well as seeking to minimize its impact on the environment. For additional information about Coty Inc., please visit  www.coty.com  .
 THE ROLE 
 Understanding and experience with modern cloud data architectures and engineering for one or more of the following cloud providers - AWS, Azure (preferred), GCP.  Leading multiple engagements to design and develop data solutions using data modeling techniques. Design and develop data pipelines from differnet sources, Azure ML model execution architecture. Acts as a key contributor to the complete lifecycle (design, development, test & support) of analytic applications utilizing Microsoft Azure and BI technology platforms.  Implementing cloud data solutions in the context of business applications, cost optimization, client‚Äôs strategic needs and future growth goals. Produce efficient and elegant code/solutions that meets business requirements; Proactively communicate progress, status, issues, and risks to stakeholders. Accurately estimate assignments. Create and maintain high quality detailed technical documentation.  Responsible for overall data lake stack and development standards.  Leading and working with large Cloud Data Platform, Cloud Data migration or Enterprise Information Management programs.  Review and align on technical solutions in response to application enhancement requests.  Lead and mentor data architecture team. Performs other related duties as directed.  Willing to learn and apply modern, cloud based technology skills, ability to research emerging trends, analyst publications, and adoption of modern technologies in solution architectures. 
 Strategy & Planning: 
 Deliver and support long-term strategic goals & vision for Data Lake stack in conjunction with data users, internal customers, and other stakeholders  Based on data findings and trends, make recommendations for improvements, standardization, upgrades and determine ways to optimize the Data Lake platform. 
 Skills: 
 Demonstrates thought-leader-level as a team leader, emphasizing the following areas:  Leading multiple engagements to design and develop data solutions using expert data modeling techniques. Implementing cloud data solutions in the context of business applications, cost optimization, client‚Äôs strategic needs and future growth goals as it relates to becoming a ‚Äòdata driven‚Äô organization.  Broad experience in Microsoft SQL technologies including SSAS Tabular models, DAX, T-SQL, Service Broker, Replication, and Performance Tuning.  Broad multi-tenant data architecture and implementation experience across different data stores (e. g., Azure Data Lake GEN2, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, Azure Blob Storage, HDFS), messaging systems (e. g., Azure Event Hubs, Apache Kafka), and data processing engines (e. g., Azure Data Lake Analytics, Apache Hadoop, Apache Spark, Apache Storm, Azure HDInsight).  Experience with data integration through APIs, Web Services, SOAP, and/or REST services. Experience using Azure DevOps and CI/CD as well as Agile tools and processes including Git, Jenkins, Jira, and Confluence.  Understanding of enterprise data concepts such as Master Data Management and Enterprise Data Warehouse, experience with MDM standards. Implementing cloud data architecture and data integration patterns (AWS Glue, Azure Data Factory, Event Hub, Databricks, etc.), storage and processing (Redshift, Azure Synapse, BigQuery, Snowflake); Infrastructure as code (CloudFormation, Terraform). Understanding of SQL, report generation using visualization tools such as Tableau/Power BI, programming using Python/Spark. Experience designing and implementing data pipelines for consumption by machine learning and BI solutions. Knowledge of SOA and Micros Services Application Architecture.  Additional programming experience is a plus including experience with .NET, Scala, R, Java. 
What You‚Äôll Bring
We‚Äôd love to see candidates who have:
Essential:
 Excellent written and oral communication skills. Excellent interpersonal skills.  Ability to conduct and direct research into IT issues and products as required.  Ability to present ideas in business-friendly and user-friendly language.  General financial statement understanding.  Highly self-motivated and directed.  Ability to work under pressure, and to tight deadlines.  Keen attention to detail.  Proven analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities.  Exceptional customer service orientation.

title: Head of Master Data Management
description:
The Siegfried Group is a global life science company with a network of 11 sites in Europe, the USA, and Asia. Siegfried offers contract development and manufacturing of active pharmaceutical ingredients, intermediates, and drug products. Siegfried has sales of 1.2 billion Swiss Francs and employs over 3,600 people. Siegfried Holding AG is listed on the SIX Swiss Exchange (SIX: SFZN).
Within this context, we are currently looking to fill the position of Head of Master Data Management in our Site of Barber√† del Vall√®s (Barcelona). In this role you will define the future of our digital footprint by driving improvements of day-to-day tasks and processes as well as by playing a driving role in all strategic projects while expanding our global production network organically and by mergers and acquisitions.
If you see yourself as a hands-on leader capable of driving change, this role could be just perfect for you.
The Role
As Head of Master Data Management, you will lead a global team of 5 people and provide functional leadership to all master data teams of the 11 Siegfried sites. In addition, you will directly report to the Chief Information Officer (based in Switzerland).
Your responsibilities
Redefine the global master data concept for product related data and business partners and ensure proper Data Governance across the company
Promote and oversee initiatives to improve processes in SAP and support in this process the various specialist departments
Manage the global Master Data project for the SAP S/4 roll-out
Shape - from the MDM point of view - any integration project running in the 11 Siegfried Sites and in our expanding global network
Create and oversee the life cycle of Standard Operating Procedures (SOP's) related to global Master Data tasks
Your Profile
A Degree in computer science, computer engineering or in a related discipline as well as several years of experience as project manager would give you the ideal background for the role
Proven ability to lead, coach, and motivate employees, clearly communicate job requirements and effectively manage the performance of the assigned tasks, while keeping a "hands-on" mentality is key in this role
Solid knowledge of SAP is fundamental to carry out this role successfully
Proven track record in Master Data Management
You speak English fluently, and ideally have some knowledge of German. Spanish would also be considered an advantage as the position is located in Barcelona region
Why joining Siegfried in Barber√† del Vall√®s
 Competitive performance-based bonusGenerous employee Share Matching PlanCanteen on-site strongly subsidized from the company or Restaurant Ticket: to eat out or to use when doing home officeMedical, life and accident insuranceAccess to "Club Siegfried": an exclusive platform with discounts and offers on more than 400 servicesContribution to nursery costsFree parking or shuttle bus from the city of Barcelona

title: Senior Data Scientist - Insights (Product - Payments)
description:
Preply is a global language learning marketplace, connecting 50,000+ tutors with millions of learners from all over the world. Since the company launched in 2012, students have signed up to more than 15 million lessons.
Meet the team!

At Preply, we are constantly running hundreds of AB tests, each with specific tracking and analytic requirements. This, along with the wide scope of our product and the sophistication of the tutor/learner interactions, makes for some rewarding challenges.

You will be embedded in cross-functional teams and work closely with product managers, tech leads, designers, etc. to provide our tutors and learners with the best product experience.

Your primary responsibility will involve overseeing and facilitating the global expansion of our company's payments infrastructure and operations, as well as managing the end-to-end evolution of our Subscription product. This entails guiding your squad in making informed decisions based on valuable data insights regarding user behavior and preferences, exploring alternative payment methods for learners, and reassessing our proposal for payouts.

Visit our Tech Radar to learn about the technologies we use at Preply!
What You‚Äôll Be Doing
Master the payments dynamics, for both pay-in and pay-out, was well as tutors/learners interaction and the economics of Preply‚Äôs marketplace;Focus on our subscription product through gathering essential data analytics which will serve as valuable insights for driving the continuous improvement of our product;Produce thorough data analytics of customer behavior and product usage, effectively communicating them to technical and non-technical audiences;Quantify the impact of new product features and initiatives in order to identify growth opportunities and help prioritize our roadmap;Design, execute and evaluate experiments on a global scale;Contribute to the development of analytics libraries and frameworks;Collaborate with the Data Strategy team to define standards and best practices as well as sharing knowledge and capabilities across the team;Participate in the definition of tracking events, engagement metrics and key performance indicators;Build relationships and collaborate with other data and/or technical leaders;Support the technical growth of data scientists in your team or area of speciality;Be a flexible data leader across the whole product spectrum;Partner with the team‚Äôs Product Manager to refine product initiatives into lean, experiment-led technical implementations;Work with the Data Engineering team to model data in our Data Warehouse and productionize your data pipelines;Work closely with our BI experts to develop effective data visualizations, reports and dashboards.
What You Need To Succeed
Experience as a Data Scientist in product analytics (5+ years' experience at least);Experience with A/B testing frameworks;Good and broad understanding of data analysis concepts such as (but not limited to) conversion, LTV, cohort analysis, retention, etc.;Strong coding skills in one or more analytics languages (SQL, Python, etc.);Strong curiosity, problem solving and problem finding skills;Creative mindset and proactive attitude towards the creation and evaluation of new hypotheses;Knowledge of quantitative fields (statistics, mathematics, etc.);Have mentored others before;Good written and verbal communication skills. C1 English level is a must.
Nice To Have
Masters degree or PhD in physics, statistics, econometrics, or a relevant field of applied mathematics (or equivalent business experience);Previous experience in Marketplaces and/or digital businesses (B2B, B2C, B2B2C);Knowledge of Looker, Amplitude, Databricks or other BI tools;Knowledge of version controlling tools (GitHub, GitLab, etc.).
Why You‚Äôll Love It At Preply
An open, collaborative, dynamic and diverse culture;A generous monthly allowance for lessons on Preply.com, Learning & Development budget and time off for your self-development;A competitive financial package with equity, leave allowance and health insurance;Access to free mental health support platforms;A flexible set-up with the option of paid relocation to Barcelona or working remotely within 3 hours CET;The opportunity to shape the lives of learners and tutors through language learning and teaching in 175 countries (and counting!).
About Preply

At Preply, we focus on doing better every day ‚Äì pushing the limits of what we know is possible. And we know our purpose is strong. We‚Äôre re-engineering education, providing outstanding experiences for our global community of language learners and building authentic connections across the world.
Propelled by a tenfold increase in revenues over the last three years, thanks to our best-in-class consumer and b2b products, Preply is now leading the online language tutoring segment globally and has 400+ employees of over 50 nationalities based across Barcelona, Kyiv and the US. We do extraordinary things at Preply ‚Äì and we want you to join us.

Welcome to The World Class.
Our Values
Human: We embrace diversity by fostering inclusive environments where people feel respected and safe to express their opinions.Hungry: We make bold, data-informed decisions to deliver high-impact solutions for our customers.Humble: We experiment continuously by staying open to being challenged, learning from failures and making data-informed decisions.Hackers: We learn by doing, focus on things that matter and move with incredible speed to create simple, creative, and scalable solutions;Curious: We thrive on facing challenges, diving deep to identify root causes and uncovering insights to continuously improve.Learners Obsessed: We put our learners at the core of everything we do to improve the effectiveness of their language learning with us.
Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

Preply is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive. Different opinions and viewpoints are key ingredients in our success as a multicultural Ed-Tech company.

That means that Preply will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or veteran status. Together, we are The World Class.

title: Sales Data and Reporting Manager
description:
About the role: 
This a critical role in our ongoing transformation of the Sales force delivering ~$5B annual revenue growing at double digits. We are looking for someone that can help us drive sales productivity through innovative technology solutions that will generate accurate data and analytics usage of CRM across 7000+ Sales associates. The right person is effective at developing trust-based relationships and move towards the important vs. the interesting. Having a strong goal-orientation (vs. a task-orientation) and deep empathy will help you navigate our organization to create distinctive value for Sales while strengthening your internal brand and career growth. If you are excited about the challenge of driving strategy within a fast-moving environment - this is the role for you!
What you will do:Product Manager of the technical solution that help Sales Managers and Leaders effectively manage their businesses and reinforce the global adoption of programs proven to drive productivity. Design for users by communicating directly with Sales Leaders, Cont Ops, SBAs and other stakeholders to fully understand users‚Äô workflows, mindsets, and experiences. Examples includeUser tests of prototypes and live software to identify improvements. Continuously interview and survey critical stakeholder to incorporate client feedback into requirements, designs and feature roadmaps. You generate enthusiasm for new products by leading client demos. This person will be analytical, data-savvy and have previous hands-on experience with enterprise data systems so they can effectivelyAnalyze, assess, prioritize, and define the tactical solutions to drive efforts in resolving data quality issuesLead efforts to define and iterate future-state process flows and solutions (e.g. Pipeline, Conferences, CRM reporting, etc.)Work directly with IT using an agile development methodology. You are responsible for documenting feature requirements in user stories clearly and comprehensively. You address questions quickly. While you might not have programming experience, you are savvy with technology, understanding databases, cloud-based software, and web development. 
What you will need:
Experience in a business environment ‚Äì involving business analytics to solve challenging business problems, analyzing and improving operations or project managementVery strong project and program management skills; demonstrated track record leading cross-functional initiativesAble to solve complex problems and successfully manage ambiguity and unexpected changeAbility to define, prioritize and maintain a product roadmapSubject matter expert on enterprise information system including an awareness of data models / data structures / and data warehouses, including experience with SQL, DAX, TSQL, etc. Must have experience with BI tools (PowerBI, Tableau or CRM Analytics)Strong knowledge of Agile principles and process; experience driving requirements and delivery with SCRUM teamsExperience developing and utilizing analytics to make sound recommendations and decisionsExperience delivering and supporting B2B solution and fully understand the dynamic of people, process and technologyExcellent verbal and written communication skills including PowerPoint presentation development and deliveryStrong collaborator and business partner
Who are we?
Gartner delivers actionable, objective insight to executives and their teams. Our expert guidance and tools enable faster, smarter decisions and stronger performance on an organization‚Äôs mission-critical priorities. We‚Äôve grown exponentially since our founding in 1979 and we're proud to have over 19,500 associates globally that support over 15,000 client enterprises in more than 100 countries.
What makes Gartner a great place to work?
Our teams are composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations. We believe that a diversity of experiences makes us stronger‚Äîas individuals, as communities and as an organization. That‚Äôs why we're recognized worldwide as a great place to work year after year. We've been recognized by Fortune as one of the World‚Äôs Most Admired Companies, named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index and a Best Place to Work for Disability Inclusion by the Disability Equality Index. Looking for a place to turn your big ideas into reality? Join #LifeAtGartner
What we offer:
Our people are our most valuable asset, so we invest in them from Day 1. When you join our team, you‚Äôll have access to a vast array of benefits to help you live your life well. These resources are designed to support your physical, financial and emotional well-being. We encourage continued personal and professional growth through ongoing learning and development opportunities. Our employee resource groups, charity match and volunteer programs keep you connected to your internal Gartner community and causes that matter to you.
The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.
Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company‚Äôs career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at +1 (203) 964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com.
Job Requisition ID:79299
By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.
Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy
For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.

Multinational company.

Provide strategic direction and leadership to the data analytics team, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and objectives.Develop and implement a comprehensive data analytics strategy, including data collection, analysis, interpretation, and reporting.Manage and mentor a team of data analysts & engineers, fostering a collaborative and high-performing work environment.Collaboration and supervision of technological partners.Oversee the design and implementation of data analytics projects, ensuring accuracy, reliability, and efficiency.Collaborate with cross-functional teams.Stay abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analytics, and leverage them to enhance our data capabilities.Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and develop data-driven recommendations to drive operational efficiencies and optimize business outcomes.Ensure data governance.Present findings and recommendations to senior management and key stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.The Successful Applicant

title: Data Team Lead
description:
At Tilting Point, we combine data, technology, talent and groundbreaking marketing to scale games to success.
As the Senior Game Data Analyst, you will work closely with game teams to help inform decision-making regarding features of the game, balancing, player interactions, finding hidden opportunities and much more.
Your Future at Tilting Point
Drive the various data initiatives for UA and mobile gaming growthCreate, review and distribute regular performance reports based on core KPIs to key stakeholders: UA managers, game managers and finance. Manage and groom a team of data analysts, BI analysts and data engineers, providing career oversight and mentorshipCollaborate with VPs, Game Managers and Product Owners to build team roadmaps and schedules and OKRsGather requirements from complex initiatives and able to break down and generate technical specsAbility to prioritize: establish metrics for determining ROI of any given project vs development effortsAbility to both generate a vision and then get buy-in from both developers and stakeholders. Build and help support our game teams for analyzing our player behaviors and build new solutions to grow retention and monetization through live ops technologyWork closely with our Growth team to consistently upgrade and enhance our UA marketing, creatives & community Tech
Your XP & Skills
3+ years experience in managing direct reports and leading a high-performing data team which includes both engineers and BI analysts. In depth experience with advanced data mining tools, such as Tableau, R, Python and with extensive SQL and Python skills. You must know SQL Must have experience with at least one data warehousing systems and be familiar with others like Big Query, Spark, Databricks or SnowflakeBachelor's degree in a quantitative or computational field (ie, Math, Statistics, Computer Science or an emphasis in quantitative methods or business analytics etc.) ideally with a background in testing and modelingYou are fluent in English, additional languages a plusExcellent communication skills: You must be able to present your ideas in a clear and articulate manner. Excited to work in a lean, small team environment working with the world's leading developersPrevious experience in mobile gaming and or UA and advertising tech (nice to have)Databricks experience (nice to have)Experience with international markets, growth marketing a plus (nice to have)
Location
This position is 100% hybrid from Spain, preferably in the Barcelona area.
What We Offer
100% hybrid policy to work from home or at the office at your own convenience, from Spain. Unlimited Vacation Policy, on top of the 23 official vacation days. Home office expenses bonus & WFH setup supportWellness & Sports monthly allowanceDaily Meal allowance [Flexoh]Flexible retribution program for Childcare and Public Transportation [Flexoh]Private Health Insurance, covering you and your first family circle (Partner, Children) [DKV Integral Elite]Training & Development supportSabbatical program for your 5th and 10th anniversary at Tilting Point4 Office Closing days, on top of the regular Bank Holidays (distributed throughout the year)Spanish, Catalan and English group language lessons (online)Annual Tax Declaration aid bonusWork time reduction for new parents upon returning from Parental LeaveOffice in Gracia with drinks, coffee, healthy snacks, plug & play set up, and events. 
Interested? We would love to hear from you! 
All submissions are confidential.
Direct applicants only - No agencies/headhunters.
Tilting Point provides equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of their race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law. Discrimination of any type will not be tolerated. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, promotion, termination, time off, and compensation.

title: Head of Go to Market (GTM) Data
description:
THE ROLE
Personio is growing rapidly. With that growth comes the increasing demand for data to support decision-making, set and track goals, predict the future and automate processes. In order to meet that demand, Data is on a mission to enable better decisions within the company.
Personio is looking for a Head of GTM Data with a strong track record of developing and evolving analytics capabilities and funnel optimization in alignment with the overall business goals and objectives. This position reports to the VP of Data and will be highly visible within the GTM executive and senior leadership teams.
As the head of this function, you have the opportunity to lead a team who is key in developing reports and providing insights around the marketing funnel (Return on Acquisition, Demand Gen Marketing performance, Account Based Marketing) and sales processes (revenue forecasting, performance to Quota).
The responsibility includes building the base foundation of the GTM data team (e.g KPI definition, reporting dimensions, etc.) and also enabling the team to apply advanced analytics models to optimize the performance of key GTM processes, with projects such as marketing attribution modeling (first touch, multi-touch, last touch), lead scoring, pricing strategies, and funnel optimization or opportunity scoring.
You will partner closely with our Marketing, Sales, and Leadership teams to align on goals, identify growth opportunities, and build strategy and operations to drive the growth of Personio. The GTM teams rely heavily on analytics to inform their data-driven decision-making processes, and the role requires excellent systems, analytical, and communication skills. Your data-driven acumen and experimentation mindset will be critical to our success, as we aim to innovate and scale our business.
Responsibilities: Insights: You and your team will generate actionable insights that enable our sales teams to make data-driven decisions and achieve our business goals. You will also own the build and presentation of clear narratives on sales performance in MBR/QBR formats to a broad audience.Reporting: You will be the subject matter expert in all sales and marketing processes and KPIs associated with them. You will be responsible to define and develop the reporting suite for the GTM team and enable them to self-serve for their daily activities.Leadership: You will lead, manage, and coach a team of data professionals, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and impact.Strategy: You will drive the creation and implementation of the analytical vision to closely align with the business needs in order to maximize efficiency and support the GTM growth. By proactively engaging with our executive team to communicate the impact and value of our data activities and insights, you will be expected to provide guidance for strategic and operational decision-making.Stakeholder management: You will collaborate closely with key stakeholders, including sales executives, sales and marketing process owners, and our central data team, to understand their needs, prioritize projects, communicate recommendations, and support their adoptionRole model: You will embody and promote our Personio values and culture (https://www.personio.com/about-personio/careers/culture/), leading by example and upholding high ethical and professional standards. You will inspire and motivate your team and colleagues to strive for excellence, growth, and impact, and to continuously learn and innovate.

WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED
10+ years of experience working in and leading a Go-to-Market analytics team with a proven track record of driving impact.You have a background in a quantitative field such as computer science, business informatics, statistics, physics, or math.You have demonstrated experience and success in leading data teams that have delivered measurable business results through their insights and data products. You know to act as a mentor to support career progression.You have worked in a hyper-growth B2B SaaS business before, investment banking or consulting.You have experience working with executive-level business stakeholders and are able to concisely communicate and influence them.You have profound knowledge of Python and SQL, as well as experience with data visualization and dashboarding tools, such as Tableau or Power BI.You have strong knowledge of GTM operational software such as Salesforce or HubSpot and experience developing a data strategy based on those data sources.You have experience with A/B testing and experimentation methodologies and are able to implement a culture of experimentation to drive continuous improvement in sales and marketing processes

WHY PERSONO
Aside from our people, culture, and mission, there are a variety of additional benefits that help make Personio a great place to work! Work with us and receive:
Competitive compensation package ‚Äì reevaluated each year ‚Äì that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity28 days of paid vacation, plus another additional day after 2 and 4 years (because we love what we do, but we also love vacation!)2 Impact Days you can use to have an impact on the environment and society ‚Äì one for an individual project of your choice and one for a company-wide initiative! #SocialResponsibilityFind your best way to work with our office-led, remote-friendly PersonioFlex! We offer a roughly 50% remote, 50% in-office working framework to suit your needsAnnual personal development budget for you to invest in your development via professional memberships, external certifications, conferences, and moreRegular company and team events like All Company Culture Week and local year-end celebrationsHigh-impact working environment with flat hierarchies and short decision-making processesReceive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities with PersonioCaresSave money with corporate discounts across brands like Adidas, LG, Bosch, Apple, and moreChoose between green mobility options, including a bike lease covered by PersonioMonthly tax-free stipend of ‚Ç¨162 to help cover food and public transportation expenses (Cobee)Private health insurance (company level plan): Access to Sanitas plan at a reduced employee cost (‚Ç¨43 for employees, spouse, or children)Access multiple fitness studios and sports facilities across Spain for ‚Ç¨30 per month with a subsidized Gympass membershipFree English and Spanish language classes

ABOUT US
Bring your best. Make your mark. We‚Äôre using technology to revolutionize the way HR operates so that we can transform the way millions of people experience work every day. We move fast, challenge the status quo, and support our people as they shape their careers.
With over 8,000 customers and a team of 1,700 in seven offices across Europe, now is the perfect time to join! We believe in hiring driven people who want to make an impact. So bring your best, and let‚Äôs build the future of HR technology together.
Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We #EmbraceUniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
At AstraZeneca, we work together to deliver innovative medicines to patients across global boundaries. We make an impact and find solutions to challenges. We do this with integrity, even in the most difficult situations, because we are committed to doing the right thing.
Job Description
The Digital Health R&D Human-centered AI (HAI) Team aims to transform the patient experience and clinical trial process. Our solutions make a difference to the lives of our patients.
The team is looking for a Senior Data Scientist to specialize in applying innovative machine learning methods to augment decision making in clinical trial planning, monitoring and execution. This role will sit within the Enterprise Products team which aims to optimize clinical trial processes to ensure that the trial designed and developed is optimal for the patient population, drug target, and trial endpoints. The team also support the monitoring of the portfolio with forecasting and advanced analytics to provide operational insight.
The Data Scientist will work closely with the Digital Health R&D subject matter experts, stakeholders and other team members to develop novel approaches that support the development of innovative products. Applicants should have a strong foundation in statistics, and experience with machine learning in a production environment.
Examples of projects the team works on include machine learning models for predicting and monitoring various aspects of clinical trials such as patient recruitment and trial duration, optimization of trial design from site selection to patient experience and much more!
Typical Accountabilities
Works with complex multimodal clinical datasets. Conducts analysis using data science and machine learning techniques.Builds data and analysis pipelines to deliver clinical insights and reusable capabilities.Researches and implements novel methods in optimization, machine learning, data analysis, data visualization.Communicates results to technical and non-technical stakeholders at multiple levels.Independently keeps own knowledge up to date and learns from senior team members, proposing appropriate training courses for personal development.Collaborates in a multidisciplinary environment with world leading clinicians, data scientists, biological experts, statisticians and IT professionals.
Essential
Education, Qualifications, Skills and Experience
M.Sc. degree in rigorous quantitative science (such as mathematics, computer science, engineering) or have demonstrated an outstanding track-record of industry experience (2+ years) with the desired data science methodologies with a B.Sc. in a relevant field (such as mathematics, computer science, engineering).Demonstrated experience with and a sound understanding of a variety of statistical and machine learning methods and standard statistical/ML development practices.Practical software development skills in standard data science tools: Python, Code versioning (bitbucket/git), UNIX skills, familiarity working in cloud environment (AWS preferred)Experience developing machine learning first products such as timeseries analysis, multi-objective optimization, forecasting, behavioral analysisStrong communication and teamwork skills
Desirable
Ph.D./M.Sc. degree in rigorous quantitative science (such as mathematics, computer science, engineering)Interactive data visualization (interactive dashboards w/ DASH, plotly, etc.,)Advanced experience with Kubernetes and machine learning product architectureAdvanced statistical and machine learning models such as hierarchical mixed bayesian models, transformer-based NLP models, reinforcement learning, deep learning models that span CNN/RNN/LSTM, GNNs, constrained optimization, state-of-the-art timeseries & forecasting modelsExperience in data-led solution delivery and software lifecycle development practices including Agile/Scrum, Waterfall, DevOps and/or CI/CD.ML Ops experience: model tracking, model governance, multiple models in different production contextsCommunication, business analysis, and consultancyExperience within the pharmaceutical industry

title: Staff Data Software Engineer (They/She/He)
description:
About Glovo
We‚Äôre a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Africa, and Western Asia. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.
At Glovo, you‚Äôll have the job of your life while working together towards our shared vision to give everyone easy access to anything in their city. We welcome top performers that will bring new ideas, diverse perspectives, and provide you the opportunities and freedom to grow and make a real impact on millions of lives‚Ä¶ all while having fun!
We believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.
In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example: she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).
Your Work-life Opportunity
We are looking for a talented and passionate Staff Data Engineer to join the Central Data team in our Barcelona HQ.
As a Staff Data Engineer you will be expected to drive the architectural paradigm and good practices that will allow Glovo data practice and tools to scale effectively. This means you will be working with multiple data teams (platform and use case oriented) and exploiting a variety of technologies (Python, SQL/Trino, Kafka, Spark, Amazon Web Services, FastAPI, Jupyter Notebooks) to bring our vision (API first, declarative) to reality. Joining us, your work will have an immediate influence on the shape of the tools and data consumed by teams across Glovo including Data Engineers, Analysts, Data Scientists and Business Users.
Your depth of experience and past achievements will speak for itself, having helped deliver on Data projects that have had significant impact. You have developed tools and defined standards which have helped different data teams achieve efficiency and reduce cognitive load while providing mentoring and leadership where necessary. You will at times be working independently, and at other times within a team to achieve a given goal. You are known in the engineering community having worked on well known projects or because of your public speaking experiences. Others respect you and you are a sought out Engineer because of your expertise and depth of knowledge. This is a high impact position within Glovo engineering as you will be defining the way for Glovo engineering into the long term.
You Will
Have a 360¬∞ view of Data environment and how it can be leveraged to create the maximum business valueHave a strong focus on the User Experiences of Data professionals and understand user journeys related to building and consuming dataDesign, review and improve Glovo‚Äôs Data tools through iterative architectural and technology techniquesDrive the scaling of Glovo‚Äôs Data Mesh initiative (data pipeline resilience, data contracts, DP dependency management, cost effectiveness)Mentor & share technical expertise with engineers, data scientists, data engineers, analystsManage multiple projects and priorities simultaneouslyBe on top of new technologies and industry trendsPromote best in class operations standards, taking inspiration from the thought leaders in the industry
You Have

description:
En Mango inspiramos y unimos mediante nuestra pasi√≥n por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos en 118 pa√≠ses y nuestra presencia online se extiende a m√°s de 80 pa√≠ses. Nuestro equipo est√° formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades y en un 80% por mujeres.

Cada una de las brigadas de an√°lisis avanzado tiene como objetivo desarrollar y evolucionar algoritmos de aprendizaje autom√°tico para hacer frente a algunos de los principales retos t√©cnicos y empresariales de Mango:
 Personalitazion Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de Inteligencia Artificial para proporcionar una experiencia personalizada a los clientes del sitio web y de la App de Mango, incluyendo recomendaciones de producto, ajuste y tama√±o, aprovechando las capacidades de despliegue en tiempo real y el flujo de clics en tiempo real. Purchasing/Production Squad: Desarrollar algoritmos de ciencia de datos para la detecci√≥n temprana de best-sellers y para determinar cu√°ntas unidades de cada producto y talla debe fabricar Mango durante la planificaci√≥n de la temporada.

Debido a la relevancia de los proyectos de Mango Advanced Analytics, cada squad tiene visibilidad y presentaciones a nivel de junta directiva.

¬øC√ìMO ES NUESTRO EQUIPO?

En Mango nos inspira y une nuestra pasi√≥n por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos presentes en 118 pa√≠ses y nuestra presencia online se extiende a m√°s de 80 pa√≠ses. Nuestro equipo est√° formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades, de las cuales el 80% son mujeres.

Somos un equipo muy din√°mico, motivado por las nuevas tecnolog√≠as, con pasi√≥n por lo que hacemos y ganas de asumir grandes retos que nos permitan seguir creciendo y aportando valor a trav√©s de los datos.

¬øQU√â HACE UN MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER EN MANGO?

Como Machine Learning Engineer formar√°s parte del equipo que da forma a la inteligencia, estrategia y arquitectura de datos de Mango. Estos productos de datos permiten casos de uso muy innovadores en el espacio del retail, como la geoanal√≠tica, la robotizaci√≥n, la personalizaci√≥n omnicanal, la tienda conectada, la visi√≥n por ordenador, el consumidor 360¬∫ y las decisiones en tiempo real.

En tu d√≠a a d√≠a‚Ä¶
Dise√±ar√°s, desarrollar√°s y mantendr√°s pipelines para la extracci√≥n, limpieza y transformaci√≥n de datos con Spark.Trabajar√°s con una gran variedad de datos (estructurados y no estructurados) relacionados con el producto y todo su ciclo de vida, desde la fase inicial de dise√±o hasta la venta en nuestros diferentes canales.Realizar√°s la puesta en producci√≥n de soluciones con algoritmos avanzados de aprendizaje autom√°tico para mejorar nuestros procesos y decisiones comerciales principales.Participar√°s en la definici√≥n de la arquitectura de las soluciones de anal√≠tica avanzada desarrolladas por el squad y su posible integraci√≥n con herramientas y aplicaciones desarrolladas por otros equipos.Definir√°s e implementar√°s mecanismos para la orquestaci√≥n y monitorizaci√≥n de los procesos y aplicaciones desarrolladas.Participar√°s en la automatizaci√≥n de tests, CI/CD y despliegue autom√°tico de nuestras aplicaciones. Ayudar√°s en la definici√≥n y mejora de los est√°ndares de calidad del c√≥digo.Estar√°s conectado a los √∫ltimos desarrollos en Big Data y MLOps e invertir√°s tiempo en traer nuevas tecnolog√≠as y mejores pr√°cticas a Mango.

¬øQU√â ESPERAMOS DE TI?
Grado en Inform√°tica, Ingenier√≠a u otros campos cuantitativosAl menos 3 a√±os de experiencia desarrollando en Python, Scala, u otro lenguaje orientado a objetos.Experiencia en el desarrollo de ELT escalable, procesos de integraci√≥n de datos con Spark, Spark Structured Streaming o cualquier otra tecnolog√≠a de procesamiento de datos.Experiencia en la construcci√≥n y el mantenimiento de cargas de datos complejas con un alto volumen y orquestando dependencias (por ejemplo, Airflow).Experiencia llevando a cabo proyectos que involucren algoritmos de Machine Learning, idealmente en un entorno cloud con computaci√≥n distribuida. Se valorar√° la experiencia desarrollando modelos matem√°ticos y algoritmos predictivos (optimizaci√≥n, modelos supervisados y no supervisados, clustering, redes neuronales...).Persona comprometida, proactiva, que se preocupe por la calidad de sus entregables, y una mentalidad hands-on.Se valora muy positivamente el inter√©s en buenas pr√°cticas de programaci√≥n y desarrollo de software: tests, automatizaciones, construyas pipelines en CI, etc.Se valora haber trabajado con servicios de AWS (por ejemplo, S3, Lambda, DynamoDB, API Gateway, Glue, Athena, ECR/ECS), y Databricks es muy deseable.Capacidad para poseer la entrega de un proyecto, incluyendo la comunicaci√≥n con otros equipos de IT.

Incorporaci√≥n inmediata con contrato indefinido.Ofrecemos horario flexible (puedes entrar de 8 a 9.30 y salir de 17 a 18.30) con jornada intensiva todos los viernes (puedes entrar de 8 a 9 y salir de 14 a 15) y la mayor√≠a de las vigilias de festivosNuestras oficinas se encuentran en Palau- Solita i Plegamans.Posibilidad de teletrabajo en un 50%.35% de descuento en todas nuestras l√≠neas Te podr√°s formar a nivel t√©cnico en plataformas como O'Reilly, entre otras, as√≠ como en idiomas, y en habilidades para tu desarrollo personal. Te acompa√±amos para que sigas creciendo a nivel profesional y personal!Pol√≠tica de referrals, podr√°s participar en la incorporaci√≥n de talento a nuestros equipos, ¬°y te recompensaremos por ello! Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vall√®s para llegar a nuestras oficinas centralesServicio de fisioterapia en las oficinas centrales, as√≠ como sala de fitness y vestuarios por si te gusta hacer deporte en tu tiempo libreWorkshops, meetups, comunidades de pr√°cticas, team buildings y company meetingsPaquete de retribuci√≥n flexible con ventajas fiscales: seguro m√©dico, formaci√≥n, descuento comedor, guarder√≠as etcServicio de comedor y cocina en las instalaciones de la central. La empresa subvenciona parte del men√∫ diario, as√≠ como los art√≠culos de cafeter√≠a.Servicio m√©dico propio en las instalaciones de la central.Formar√°s parte de una empresa l√≠der en el sector de la moda, din√°mica, en plena innovaci√≥n, con gran concienciaci√≥n y realizando acciones hacia la sostenibilidadAmbiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso, trabajar√°s con un gran equipo que va en la misma direcci√≥n para conseguir los mejores resultadosOportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo

title: Data Steward Veeva/Salesforce
description:
HAYS Technologies is the Business Consulting Line of the HAYS Group
 Hays is collaborating with the leading company in the pharmaceutical sector, TOP 10 pharma with more than 146 affiliates around the world and 47 employees, of which 1,600 are located in Spain.
 They create innovative medicines for people and animals, adding value through innovation for all three business areas: human pharmaceuticals, animal health, and contract manufacturing of biopharmaceuticals. Now they are in the expansion phase and are developing the animal area. Our client is forming a technological hub that will serve the entire group internationally. This hub is located in San Cugat del Vall√©s.
 We are looking for a Data Steward (Veeva/Salesforce CRM). You will manage various customer data, user data and other support functions for the EPIC tool (internal BBDD)
 What would your duties be?
 Customer data addition to the EPIC platform as prescribed by Global Capability Owner and key Users.As and when Data error spotted or requested for a change in data as the customer might have changed bio-details, you will take up such requests and correct the desired entry. Various bulk upload requests may be requested by key users and upon approval, you will conduct such activities in the Salesforce environment. You will maintain various IDs matched for each customer as per the global practice. User data in the form of name, role, teams, any changes requested based on organization. EPIC will have a specific layout to manage consent based on customer geographic location. Maintain such records in the system and help avoid any privacy breaches.EPIC platform is a strategic planning tool for cross functional teams and time to time users may need support on basic functionality of EPIC. You should be able to help end users in such requests, but not trainer for the platform.Users may request various standard reporting from the platform - run those reports and share with users. Based on increasing business needs, write requirements, advice on how to implement, UAT these requirements and train users on its usage. (Eg. Community calls, release notes, etc.).Monitor the usage of the platform to ensure data quality and adoption. Support steering Business activities with metrics to be defined.
 Which are the ideal requirements for this position?
 Degree or equivalent in a relevant subject.Experience with Salesforce, Veeva or any other CRM used within a pharmaceutical environment.Strong communication skills e.g., liaison with stakeholders.Previous experience conducting Data Steward activities and strong reporting skills.Previous experience or knowledge of SQL.Previous experience dealing with user data and customer data.Experience in data maintenance and management on CRM‚Äôs. 
What we offer? 
Participate in international projects.Young and dynamic environment.Office located in Sant Cugat del Vall√®s (Barcelona).Flexible Schedule ‚Äì Monday to Friday from 8/9 to 5/6.Remote 100%Buffet onsite.Contract by Hays in a long project (indefinido).

title: Cloud Data Analyst Engineer (FinOps)
description:
Company Description
We are in Business for People, empowering people in service organizations with innovative Enterprise and Business software solutions. We‚Äôve innovated and taken a new approach to delivering ERP that works for people. Self-driving, adaptive and intuitive software that is changing the way people work. Our solutions
empower people and deliver a better people experience so people can spend time on meaningful high-value work they live for.
Read more on our website about how we transform work and how people feel about it, so our customers and their people can thrive.
Job Description
As a Cloud FinOps Engineer, you will work on analyzing various data streams - one of them being cloud spend accross Cloud platforms, identify potential cost savings and define follow-up activities.
Key part of the job is data extraction, setting up processes and systems to make working with data more efficient and presenting data to the wider audience.
You will work closely with our DevOps and Finance teams to ensure we maintain our cloud cost spend and environment stability through data analysis, consulting, accurate documentation, and creative problem-solving.
Qualifications
Strong financial analysis skills, including forecasting, budgeting, and cost analysis using tools like Excel, PowerBI, or other financial modeling tools.Solid understanding of accounting principles and practices, ensuring accurate financial reporting.Experience in budget management, including development, tracking, and forecasting of spending.Familiarity with cloud cost optimization strategies, such as rightsizing, reserved instances, and spot instances.Proficiency in using cloud cost management tools like Azure Cost Management for monitoring and controlling spending.Understanding of Azure services and pricing models to optimize cloud usage and reduce costs.Ability to identify and resolve billing issues or discrepancies with cloud vendors and internal stakeholders.Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work with stakeholders across finance, IT, and business teams.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills for identifying cost optimization opportunities and troubleshooting.Proficient in creating detailed financial reports and dashboards for insights and optimization in cloud spending.Knowledge of compliance and regulatory requirements, including security and data protection.Experience with automation and scripting tools to optimize cloud usage, reduce costs, and improve efficiency.Familiarity with Azure DevOps for optimizing cloud usage and automating workflows.Project management skills for effectively managing and prioritizing multiple initiatives.Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, managing competing priorities and adapting to changing requirements.Understanding of agile methodologies for iterative and incremental progress in cost optimization.Mentoring and training skills to educate finance and IT teams on cloud cost optimization strategies.Relevant certifications, such as Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate or Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert, showcasing proficiency in Azure and cloud cost optimization.
Additional Information
Join Unit4 and be part of one of the most exciting journeys in the cloud ERP software space. We‚Äôre a fastpaced, high-growth, people-centric company, delivering enterprise software for a great people experience,
and offering our own people a host of benefits and development opportunities. Grow with us
At Unit4, we offer:
 a culture built on trust - giving you the freedom and autonomy to be successful, balance - with our uncapped time off policy, remote working opportunities and Global Wellbeing Days when the whole company can switch off and prioritize well-being, talented colleagues, role models and mentors - work, learn and be inspired by some of the best talent in the software industry, a commitment to sustainability - with initiatives such as our Act4Good program, a way for everyone at Unit4 to come together and engage in actions that benefit society and the planet, a safe and inclusive working environment ‚Äì supported by our Employee Resource Groups, which are open to all and include Women at Unit4, Pride at Unit4, Mental Health and Access at Unit4, and People of Color at Unit4

title: DATA SCIENTIST - Dubai, UAE
description:
Location: Dubai, UAE (We provide visa sponsorship & relocation assistance)
Annual Base Salary range of $75,000 - $100,000 per annum + performance-based bonus - 0% tax environment + an opportunity to join our employee share scheme
About Cobblestone Energy
Cobblestone Energy is an energy trading company specialising in the Great Britain and European wholesale electricity markets. Founded in 2017, we are part of the next generation of companies defining the future of global commodity trading.
We make use of advanced data analytics and extensive research to drive profitable decision making, trading enough electricity every day to power a small country, and growing every day. In doing so, we help to balance the electricity grid, lowering the cost to end consumers, and aiding the transition to a renewable future. Technology and risk management form the backbone of our business.
At Cobblestone Energy, we are a diverse team of over 50 people from 20+ nationalities - we believe in hiring extraordinary talent from all around the world. Our flat organizational structure helps us in giving our team members complete ownership of the work and ensures ideas come from every level. We believe in providing unlimited growth opportunities to our people alongside constant feedback and support, which allows us to cover our vulnerabilities and grow as a team in new and interesting ways. With the right performance and potential, you could be managing the power desk for an entire country within eighteen months in your role. Come join our dream team!
Cobblestone Values
Lifelong learning with continuous reflection Independent thinking through a meritocracy of ideas The team is more important than the individualBeing the best in any market we enterHiring and keeping only the most effective people Others must benefit from our existence. 
What We Offer In This Role
A full-time position on our Commercial teamCommitted and remarkably talented colleagues. Highly competitive compensation dependent on performance An exciting, challenging and fulfilling career. Investment in your development to ensure that you always remain the best in business. Equity participation for strong contributors, ensuring our interests are all aligned long term. 
Summary: We are seeking a highly motivated and talented Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. With a passion for data-driven solutions and a strong academic background, the successful candidate will play a key role in supporting our business decisions and driving operational efficiencies through the use of advanced analytics and predictive modelling techniques.
Key Responsibilities:
Analyse large and complex datasets to uncover key insights and inform business decisions. Design and implement predictive models to support the optimization of trading strategies and market forecasting. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business needs and develop data-driven solutionsStay up to date with the latest advancements in data science and machine learning and apply these to the power trading domain Communicate findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner. 
Requirements:
2-3 years of experience in data science or a related field, with a proven track record of success Strong academic background in computer science, mathematics, statistics, or a related field Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills Proficiency in python programming language. Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and data visualization tools Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, cross-functional team environment. 
This is an outstanding opportunity for a driven and talented Data Scientist to join a market-leading power trading company and make a significant impact on our business operations. If you possess a passion for data science and a proven track record of success, we encourage you to apply.
Note: While previous work experience in the power trading domain is highly desirable, it is not a requirement for this role.

title: Data Product Manager for Tax Engine Business, Tax Engine Business
description:
Description
Amazon‚Äôs growth requires leaders who move fast, have an entrepreneurial spirit to create new products, unrelenting tenacity to get things done, and are capable of breaking down and solving complex problems. We are looking for a smart, customer-obsessed, and analytical Senior Data Product Manager to own and execute on the Data Product Strategy for Tax Engine Business Product Classification and Taxonomy Services. The role blends aspects of product management, data analytics and data science, and entails a deep understanding of data products and passion for creating world class customer experiences.
As Senior Data Product Manager for the Amazon Product Classification and Taxonomy Services you will be responsible for driving Data Product Strategy as part of the Platform Product Strategy, applying product thinking on Existing and new Data Products, ensuring to balance the strategy, governance, and implementation of anything data-related, while facilitating the conversations between all impacted stakeholders‚Äîexecutives, engineers, analysts, other product teams, and customers‚Äîwho consume the data.
In the role, you‚Äôll manage a cross-functional product development and deployment process while communicating with the business leaders whose operations are going to be impacted by the model and the programming surrounding it. You‚Äôll coordinate across functions and units, exercising influence without formal authority, and understanding customer needs.
You‚Äôll ensure the Data Products that started as a minimum viable products (MVP)‚Äìbased approach ‚Äî have an ongoing iteration cycle that allows for new versions of the product on a rolling basis. You‚Äôll be responsible for ensuring and measuring the ongoing use and value of the data product on a quarterly basis, whether the product has internal or external customers
You‚Äôll partner with Data Program Managers and Data Engineers, responsible for a complete data and advanced analytics solution, product adoption, user interface architecture and product usage. Our Program Managers are focused on how the product is adopted and used, what the user interface looks like, how many people use it, and how it creates value for the business/Ops. You‚Äôll participate with them on staff meetings, understand the priorities of that part of the business, and do bi-directional translation between business needs and opportunities and the solutions that can address them.
Key job responsibilities
 Create and manage Data Product Strategy for Product Classification and Taxonomy Services Partnering with Program Managers on ensuring our Data Products fulfill all attributes and are in alignment with overall Product Strategy Working closely with product, analytics and tech teams to test and implement new features and influence product roadmap Partnering with Business and Analytics to use quantitative and qualitative data to optimize business and Ops processes, while applying insights to the data traffic and product strategy Partnering with Business Intelligence Engineer and Tax Engine Artisans teams to develop consumer insights that inform product plans, as well as test the effectiveness of analytical activities
We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:
Barcelona, B, ESP
Basic Qualifications
 6+ years of professional experience in Project/Program or Product Management Experience building, executing and scaling cross-functional data products Experience using data and metrics to drive improvements Experience with Tableau or QuickSight (data manipulation, charts and pivot tables)
Preferred Qualifications
 4+ years of demonstrable data product management experience with Data Mesh (experience in building a decentralized data architecture)
Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
Company - Amazon Spain Services, S.L.U.

L'objectiu √∫ltim de la medicina pedi√†trica de precisi√≥ √©s estratificar els nens afectats per malalties per millorar el diagn√≤stic i els tractaments m√®dics.

Els investigadors translacionals estan aportant quantitats cada vegada m√©s grans de dades cl√≠niques heterogenies i informaci√≥ cient√≠fica per crear estrat√®gies de classificaci√≥ que permetin adequar la intervenci√≥ als mecanismes subjacents de la malaltia en subgrups de pacients.

La majoria de les malalties gen√®tiques pedi√†triques, com els trastorns del neurodesenvolupament, les malalties metab√≤liques heredit√†ries, els trastorns neuromusculars, les epil√®psies i altres afeccions monog√®niques ultrarares, s√≥n causes importants de mort i discapacitat infantil a Espanya i a tot el m√≥n.

Els objectius principals d'aquest projecte s√≥n:

1- Establiment d'una Xarxa de Recerca Pedi√†trica en Malalties Rares per a la Medicina de Precisi√≥ a Espanya;

2- Aplicaci√≥ d'est√†ndards d'Hist√≤ria Cl√≠nica Electr√≤nica mitjan√ßant la introducci√≥ d'un "conjunt m√≠nim de dades cl√≠niques" en quatre grups de malalties per obtenir un conjunt d'est√†ndards comuns de dades cl√≠niques que es pretenen incloure a les RER, CSUR i CIBER;

3- Implementaci√≥ d'eines comunes entre unitats pedi√†triques i desplegament de "Casos d'√ös" per a IMPaCT-Data i IMPaCT-Genomics.

4- Aplicaci√≥ d'eines automatitzades per analitzar i compartir la informaci√≥ gen√≤mica de nens amb malalties rares i la interacci√≥ amb IMPaCT-Genomics.

El projecte desplegar√† una plataforma federada de dades seguint les directrius, la documentaci√≥ i els demostradors desenvolupats per IMPaCT-Data.

Aquest projecte pilot pret√©n donar el tret de sortida de la Xarxa, estructurar les seves bases m√≠nimes aprofitant les dades fenot√≠piques i gen√≤miques existents en 300 pacients i realitzar estudis gen√≤mics i an√†lisis fenot√≠pics estructurats com a estudi pilot en altres 200 pacients amb quatre grups de patologies.

Un cop constitu√Øda la Xarxa, es pret√©n optar a altres fonts de finan√ßament globals tant a l'√†mbit cl√≠nic assistencial com al de la recerca a nivell Regional, Nacional, Europeu i Internacional.

Les funcions principals de la persona contractada seran les seg√ºents:
Identificar les dades requerides pel projecte Impact3Documentar les dades en el model de gesti√≥ i governan√ßa de la dada de l'hospitalModelar l'emmagatzematge de les dades i posar-les a disposici√≥ dels investigadors del projecte

Oferim:
Contracte estable, lligat al projecte Impact3.Jornada 100% de dilluns a divendres de 8:00h a 16:30h

El presente contrato est√° financiado por el ‚ÄúInstituto de Salud Carlos III (ISCIII)‚Äù con c√≥digo de expediente PMP22/00008 y fondos de Next Generation EU, que financian las actuaciones del Mecanismo para la Recuperaci√≥n y la Resiliencia (MRR).

Requisits:

Requisits:
Estar en possessi√≥ del t√≠tol d'Enginyeria Inform√†tica o equivalent.Experi√®ncia en Govern de la Dada, Modelatge de Dades i Gesti√≥ de l'Acc√©s a les Dades.Coneixements o experi√®ncia en gesti√≥ de dades gen√≤miques.Es valora coneixement d'eines espec√≠fiques de govern de dades, de cat√†leg de dades, llenguatge SQL, creaci√≥ de serveis web (API-Rest, SOAP, ...) i tenir experi√®ncia en AWS.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Who We Are

Bitpanda simplifies wealth creation. Founded in 2014 in Vienna, Austria by Eric Demuth, Paul Klanschek and Christian Trummer, Bitpanda exists to help people trust themselves enough to build financial freedom for their future. Our user-friendly, trade-everything platform empowers both first-time investors and seasoned experts to invest in the cryptocurrencies, crypto indices, stocks, precious metals and commodities they want ‚Äî all possible with any sized budget , 24/7. With more than 700 team members and more than 4 million customers, our company is one of Europe's most successful fintechs.

Headquartered in Austria but operating across all of Europe, our products are built by fast-moving, talented, ‚Äúroll-up-your-sleeves-and-make-it-happen‚Äù kind of people who represent more than 50 nationalities. If you‚Äôre someone who thinks big, moves fast and wants to make an impact right from day one, then get ready to join our industry-changing team. Let‚Äôs go!

Your mission

Do you want to develop data pipelines and do innovative work on the data processing frameworks and architectures with the ability to scale intelligently? Then join Bitpanda Data Engineering team!

What You‚Äôll Do
 Opportunity to build and define the data initiatives for the company  Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a variety of data sources using AWS technologies. Implement data pipelines and data integration solutions with Python and Java languages  Ensure accuracy and timeliness of data is maintained in the data layer. Clean and wrangle data into a usable state that are ready to be used by our Product and Engineering teams  Work with stakeholders to align solutions and data integration with business objectives  Debug, troubleshoot, and improve cloud-based applications and s2uggest improvements to current data architecture 

Who You Are
 Strong skills in data integration and data gathering methodologies and APIs and experience working with a variety of APIs (e.g., REST API or SOAP API)  Experience with AWS services and Service-Oriented Architecture  Proficient in at least one of the following languages: Python, Java, Scala  Understanding of ETL/ELT infrastructures and Cloud architectures  Experience with event driven Architectures and tools such as Kafka and knowledge of version control systems such as GIT 

What‚Äôs In It For You
Competitive total compensation package including participation in our stock option planMarket-leading Flex-Ben approach and package (see our careers page)Exclusive premiums when trading on BitpandaOccasional company-wide and team events - both in-person and virtually!Bitpanda swag to keep you living the brandA diverse team of fast-moving, talented, ‚Äúroll-up-your-sleeves-and-make-it-happen‚Äù kind of people who are united (across cultures and time zones) by our unique way of working

And, above all, the opportunity to learn and grow as part of Bitpanda‚Äôs incredible journey towards being Europe‚Äôs future #1 investment platform.

Bitpanda is committed to fostering a fair and equal environment based on trust and mutual respect. We believe that a diverse and inclusive workplace is paramount to our success and we are committed to building a team that represents a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
At Clarity AI, we are committed to bringing social impact to markets. We are a tech company started in 2017, leveraging AI and machine learning technologies to ensure environmental, social and governance dimensions are the focal point of decision-making within financial markets.We are now a team of more than 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as SoftBank, BlackRock, and Deutsche B√∂rse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, Portugal, the UK, and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading!
Clarity is looking for a Senior Data Engineer for the Tech team.
If you‚Äôre a Software/Data Engineer, specialized in Data and enjoy solving complex problems with code, developing and you are not afraid of learning new things, we are looking for you.You will be part of the team delivering the different parts of our production-ready product while co-designing and implementing an architecture that can scale up with the product and the company.Our tech stack is documented here: https://stackshare.io/clarity-ai/clarity-ai-data
Location: This position can be based within Spain.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:You will help to build a data platform to enable other teams to self-service high-quality data while performing data operations to support their day-to-day actions.You will join the data engineering team which is responsible for developing models, practises and systems to support the data lifecycle.You‚Äôll support designing and creating all aspects of our ever-growing set of external and internal data pipelines, understand the problems, and tie them back to data engineering solutionsYou will be responsible of designing and building our ETL'sYou‚Äôll transform raw data from different sources (batch and near-real-time) into intuitive data models, using a diverse set of tools (such as Spark, Hadoop, Redshift, Kafka, etc.) to build robust data pipelines of high quality in a scalable fashion (regarding volume and maintainability).In order to develop feature and product features, you will form part of cross functional squads including people of many different teams.Work closely with Platform, Data Science and Backend teams, as well as product and tech teams.Fix, troubleshoot and solve bugs and issues
Requirements
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR:We like engineers who adapt quickly to new challenges and break them down in smaller pieces that a highly productive team will find high-quality solutions for. As an Engineer, you will have a solid technical foundation and a strong focus on growing your development skills.They use best practices to ship high-quality code and continue to push their knowledge.You have more than +5 years of professional experience as a Software Developer/Data Engineer, and hold a degree in a quantitative field (CS, Engineer, Math, Physics, ‚Ä¶ ).You have built production data pipelines in the cloud, setting up data-lake and server-less solutions; on top of that, you have hands-on experience with schema design and data modeling.Proven knowledge of Python(Pandas) is required, Java/Scala will be a plusYou have strong SQL skills and knowledge and familiarity with other distributed data stores such as Redis, ElasticSearch, Druid, Cassandra, Hbase.You are comfortable working in containerized cloud developments, and familiar with the integration of public and private APIs.Strong communication skills. The right candidate can thrive in an environment of asynchronous conversation, since a part of the Clarity team will be based remotely.Open to try new technologies and programming languages.Fluency in EnglishIt will be a plus if you had:Experience in SaaS fast growing business would be preferable, although not required.Ideally experience in the financial sector or regulated markets.Familiarity with some other technologies / frameworks( Spring Boot, Jersey, Play..) is a plus
Benefits
WHAT WE OFFER:Our people are our main asset. We have built a unique team and we all share 3 differential aspects: Excellence, Passion and Values:Our team comprises professionals from leading tech, consulting and banking firms, entrepreneurs, PhDs from top research institutions, and MBA graduates from top business schools.Clarity‚Äôs Founder and CEO, Rebeca Minguela, is a successful entrepreneur who has been recognized as one of the most distinguished leaders under the age of 40 by prestigious institutions like the World Economic Forum. Rebeca is joined by an excellent leadership team coming from diverse backgrounds, countries and experiences.We are different. We work hard to become the best place to work and pride ourselves on our culture:Fact based: Promoting objective, fact-based and solution-oriented discussions.Diverse: Encouraging diversity of personalities, cultures and experiences.Transparent: Communicating feedback transparently, constructively and in real-time.Meritocratic: Striving for excellence and rewarding the best.Flexible: Working flexibly in the broadest sense (schedule, location, vacation, styles).
Clarity AI believes diversity, inclusion, and belonging are essential for creating an innovative and successful workplace. Thats why we created our own ERG groups. Our own ERG groups act as a voluntary employee resource group, they commit to promoting these values and creating a safe and supportive community for all employees. They are committed to creating a workplace that champions sustainability, diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI).To do this, they will advocate for sustainability initiatives, host and participate in events, workshops, provide a safe space for employees to share their experiences, ideas, and solutions, and collaborate with other departments and employee groups to improve the company's sustainability goals.By actively promoting and engaging in sustainability efforts, we can help create a more equitable and resilient future for our planet and all its inhabitants.
We care about our employees and think they deserve the best.ESOP/ Phantom stock: We want our employees to really feel part of Clarity. That‚Äôs why we give them the opportunity to participate in our success with ESOP or phantom stock options.Training budget: Continued learning is important to us so we provide everyone with a yearly training budget.Additional benefits are available depending on your location.We are a US company with a UK and Spanish subsidiary. We have offices in New York City, London and Madrid and have possibilities for remote working for many of our roles.
Clarity has received several awards:World Economic Forum PioneerOne of the most innovative projects in the US. Harvard Innovation LabTop startup with impact worldwide by IMPACT Growth 2017Top 10 Fintech startup worldwide by BBVA Open TalentYoung Global Leader to Rebeca Minguela 2017

title: Principal Data Architect & Data Steward
location: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
description:
We are looking for a Principal Data Architect to join our data engineering team. If you are passionate about data and technology, we are eager to talk to you. The ideal candidate has both a willingness and desire to work in a dynamic environment, is able to apply Agile methodologies in day-to-day activities, is self-motivated and also enjoys working in a team environment. Work closely with relevant teams to design the data solution end to end.Hands on lead of the data discovery, validation and integration process with stakeholders, data scientists, data engineers and software engineers across internal and external teams and organizations.Support the data standardization, governance, and transformation initiatives.Assures designs and project activities are in compliance with data policies, architecture, security and quality guidelines and standards.Drives innovation and integration of new technologies into organization wide projects and activities in the data space.Work with other data engineers to improve the subject matter expertise across the data engineering organization.Participate in the development and continues improvement of data pipelines and data products.
Knowledge & Skills
Extensive experience with data engineering tools, languages, frameworks and methodologies to mine, cleanse and explore data.Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.Extensive experience in data modelling and analysis using SQL and relational database systems.Excellent written and verbal communication skills; mastery in English and local language.Ability to effectively communicate solution requirements, architecture and design proposals and negotiate options at senior management levels.Python & PySpark experience
