title: Senior Director of First-Party Data Strategy
description:
Craft:
Data, Analytics & Strategy
Job Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Senior Director of First-Party Data Strategy to join our Central Insights team in Barcelona. This role will be responsible for leading the development, execution, and evolution of our company's first-party data strategy, ensuring it aligns with our overall business objectives. The ideal candidate is an expert in first party data, data strategy, analytics, and privacy, with a proven track record of successfully driving data initiatives in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Responsibilities:
Develop, implement, and maintain a comprehensive first-party data strategy and roadmap that supports the company's long-term goals and objectives. Identify and assess data opportunities across the organization, including new data sources, technologies, and partnerships, to enhance our games and player experiences. Develop actionable recommendations for data-driven strategic initiatives, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive the implementation and change management process. Support the building of strong data privacy and governance best practices, ensuring we‚Äôre industry leaders with regards with regulations and internal policies. Collaborate with key stakeholders, including product, marketing, and technology teams, to align data strategy with overall company goals and objectives. Continuously monitor and analyze the performance of data-driven initiatives, providing insights and recommendations for optimization and future growth. Keep abreast of industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data strategy, analytics, and privacy, to ensure the company remains at the forefront of the gaming industry. 
Requirements:
Strong experience in management consulting, strategy, program management, product management, or other cross-functional leadership roles in the gaming industryExperience working with machine learning / predictive modelingExcellent skills in financial modeling, advanced data analytics, and business case developmentDemonstrated ability to forge cross-functional partnerships, influence teams without formal authority, and lead through change. Outstanding written and oral presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex data concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences. Demonstrable ability to work in a dynamic environment with high ambiguity and adapt to changing priorities. Proven track record of operating effectively in cross-functional settings, working with stakeholders from a broad range of backgrounds and at all levels of the organization. Hands-on experience working in the mobile advertising business (supply or demand side) is a strong plus. Previous work experience in or exposure to one or more of the following sectors: mobile gaming, consumer mobile, consumer internet, marketing
About King
King is the game developer behind the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as mobile game hits including Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch and Pet Rescue. Candy Crush is the top-grossing franchise in US app stores, a position it has held for the last two years, and King‚Äôs games are being played by 245 million monthly active users as of Q3 2021. King, which is part of the Activision Blizzard group since its acquisition in 2016, employs nearly 2,000 people in game studios in Stockholm, Malm√∂, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in San Francisco, New York, and Malta.
A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes
Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.
Making the World Playful
Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It‚Äôs what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid-core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players - and we‚Äôre not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!
Applications need to be in English.
Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Tech & Data Strategy Consultant (f/m/d)
description:
At TRKKN, we are driven by the excitement of taking our client's data-driven businesses to new heights. As the leading European Google partner and reseller of Google Cloud & Google Marketing Platform, we act as a catalyst for cutting-edge digital marketing solutions. Our team is diverse, international, inspiring, and operates in a fast-growing digital & technological environment. This provides the ideal and dynamic work environment for individuals with a hunger for growth, responsibility, and the desire to shape their future. With Google in close proximity, the learning and development opportunities at TRKKN are limitless



How you will make an impact‚Ä¶

As a Tech & Data Strategy Consultant at TRKKN, you will play a critical role in connecting people, data & tech. You will lead companies towards digital maturity by systematically identifying levers and technical solutions from Google Marketing Platform and Google Cloud that help advertisers to solve their business challenges in the evolving privacy centric ecosystem.

Specifically, you will be responsible for:

 Providing strategic consulting to our clients on 1st party data strategy, tech stack, and other related topics 

 Conducting Tech & Data Maturity Assessments for clients and provide recommendations for improvement

 Leading Strategy Workshops for clients on various topics, such as Privacy

 Supporting other TRKKN service teams with your expertise in Tech & Data Strategy Consulting

 Collecting and analyzing customer data to identify opportunities for improvement and increase customer satisfaction

 Working closely with account leads on strategic clients to ensure that clients receive the best possible consulting experience

 Managing multiple projects and priorities effectively, meeting deadlines and exceeding client expectations

 Keeping up-to-date with the latest industry trends and best practices in Tech & Data Strategy

 


The person we are looking for‚Ä¶

 Has solid consulting experience in tech & data, preferably in the tech and digital marketing industry

 Has experience with google fund ownership and management 

 Has proven track record of success in delivering exceptional customer service and driving business growth

 Has excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to build strong relationships with clients and stakeholders

 Has strong account management skills and the ability to effectively manage multiple clients and priorities

 Is a strategic thinker and highly detail-oriented with exceptional organizational skills

 Excels as a self-starter and is driven to continuously improve and exceed customer expectations

 Has a passion for tech & data topics and a desire to work with high-performance teams

 Is an excellent communicator in fluent English (German is a plus)



 
Our benefits

We empower you to take responsibility right from the start and provide you with an environment for enormous growth potential within the company and beyond your initial role. We see you as an important part of our success story - We grow with you, you grow with us!

In addition, you can expect:

 Competitive salary

 Knowledge sharing & company events

 Personal development plan & leadership training

 Hybrid work model

 Choose your own device

title: Data & DBI Service Manager
description:
Our opportunity 
In this role, you will be responsible for the delivery of Data & Business Intelligence delivery services across all platforms, including integration points between them, managing a service team. You will proactively manage relationships and communications with business and outsourcing partners and effectively address escalations related to application issues and drive service improvement.
 Your role 
 As Data & DBI Service Manager, your main responsibilities will involve: 

 Manage the service delivery for assigned application portfolio spanning across different segments according to Service Level Agreements managing a service team  Report overall application service performance to different business stakeholders proactively taking action to address issues and gaps with the business.  Engage in major incident management and problem management  Proactively drive communications to the business (e.g. Incident alerts, change freezes, etc.).  Contribute to the service management strategy and definition of reusable frameworks  Manage customer satisfaction and service improvement programs, as well as escalation and complaint management  Manage the Project hand-over process into operations and Approve operational readiness for projects and releases  Collaborate with Project Management, Solution Architecture teams, Platform and applications support Teams to ensure the operational aspects of a solution are considered, with in a DevOps and Agile framework and mindset.  Proactively drive the Continuous Service Improvement (CSI) as well as Automation initiatives.  Maintain a business-oriented IT service catalogue for the relevant portfolio of applications  Monitor critical application governance and report on service level performance, generating improvement actions where necessary  Contribute to the definition of new vendor services in close collaboration with Sourcing Management  Ensure compliance with appropriate internal control and regulatory requirements for both internal and external suppliers, provide assistance and support for audits, where applicable 

Your Skills And Experience
 As Data & DBI Service Manager, your skills and experience will ideally include: 

 University level education or equivalent  Over 5 relevant years of experience  Prior experience working in a finance services, preferably insurance  Knowledge of Data Analytics, BI tools and Cloud with functional and technical background in at least two of the following: SAP BW4HANA, Analytics Cloud (SAP SAC and HANA DB), Tibco EBX MDM, MS Azure, Power BI.  Solid understanding of ITIL processes ‚Äì Incident and Request Management, Change Management, stakeholder management (e.g.: ITIL)  Desirable some experience in Agile and DevOps framework  Tooling: Service Now (SNOW), JIRA, bamboo, bitbucket (DevOps), Azure DevOps and MS 365,  Communication/presentation skills, team management, relationship management  Ability to work effectively in a global organization across different geographies, under time pressure and to manage ambiguity  Fluent in English (spoken and written). 

Additional Information
 ‚ÄØAs well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes: 

 Option to work remotely within Spain even up to 100% - you choose  Flexible working hours  Wide range of internal and external trainings  Free English, German and Spanish classes depending on‚ÄØthe‚ÄØneeds  Ticket restaurant  Life Insurance  Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company  Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you  Special banking and insurance conditions  Exclusive Employees discounts 

Primary work location is Barcelona, Poblenou. Please apply with your CV in English by clicking on the button ‚ÄúApply online‚Äù.
Who We Are
Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You‚Äôd give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It‚Äôs a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.
 Diversity & Inclusion 
At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer.‚ÄØ We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.
So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.
You are the heart & soul of Zurich! 
At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?
We highly value the experience and know-how of our employees and offer a wide range of opportunities across business areas to encourage you to apply for new opportunities within Zurich when you are ready for your next career step.
Let‚Äôs continue to grow together!

Location(s): ES - Barcelona Remote working: YesSchedule: Full TimeRecruiter name: Alvaro Gallego Zazo

title: Digital Security & Data Privacy Leader
description:

Lead customer engagements and ensure product security and privacy aspects are addressed in collaboration with cross-functional teams.Respond to customer inquiries, Privacy & Security questions, contractual agreements, and post-market activitiesSupport product security incident and vulnerability response in collaboration with product security incident managerDesign processes that both leverage existing tools, and new ones to support our customers Create KPIs and tools to measure Privacy and Security customer support effortsProactively identify and address customers‚Äô P&S concerns  Identify security and privacy documentation gaps, develop and/or partner, and maintain documentation, tools and methodologies to support customers  Identify Privacy & Security opportunities, lead continuous improvement security control projects, and associated corrective action plans (CAPs). title: Engineering Manager (Data Catalogue)
description:
We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.
We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.
Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.
What You‚Äôll Do & Who You Are
The team and the product
The Data Catalogue team is a group of highly qualified backend and frontend engineers. The team manages the Data Catalogue, the place where everyone at Adevinta can discover all existing data assets, search and manage rich metadata, request and manage access in a self-service fashion. The Data Catalogue is part of the Data Hub and it commonly collaborates with the different teams at developing and maintaining other functionalities. Data Hub is the place where more than 9,000 people across 14 countries can manage Kafka clusters and pipelines, create or edit data transformation pipes, assess and control the quality of the datasets, discover and explore tens of thousands of datasets among many other functionalities.
The Data Catalogue is developed over LinkedIn‚Äôs Data Hub Open Source platform. We closely collaborate with the team in charge of the third party product and we are commonly featured as top contributors. We have successfully merged more than 30 PRs over the last 12 months.
What You‚Äôll Do
We are looking for an experienced, technical Engineering Manager with a passion for data to lead one of our teams in Barcelona. The data catalogue provides the first of a series of crucial steps and marks the beginning of many of our users' journeys, from Data discovery to Data exploration. It also represents one of the key elements to drive our data mesh journey.
As part of the Data Highway area you‚Äôll have the opportunity to learn from and share knowledge with engineers, UX specialists and data scientists. We encourage a diverse, collaborative and creative work environment, where you will develop and push for the state-of-the-art in big data processing and build reliable, highly scalable services with an emphasis on volume, velocity and privacy.
You‚Äôll Also
Support the team and help them with high-level tech decisions, technical architecture, as well as to raise blockers and needs from the rest of the organisation.Mentor team members in their career development.Help the teams with coordination/alignment/methodology challenges and issues.Be the liaison between the team and the rest of the organisation:Ensure the team‚Äôs external blockers and issues are correctly identified, communicated and addressed.Work closely with the team‚Äôs Product Manager(s) and the larger product organisation to ensure the team is building the right products.Collect strategy and high level direction from senior management to influence roadmaps and short term backlogs, as well as be the representative and advocate of the team in the upper-management councils.Communicate big updates & act as mediator between the team and other parts of the organisation, including in case of major issues (technical and otherwise)Be responsible for maintaining healthy team dynamics and keep the team output at high, measured levels of velocity, quality and reliability.Set the team for continuous improvement
Who You Are
First and foremost a people person: assertiveness, empathy, influence, fairness, honesty, humbleness.Excellent oral and written communication (English).Experience in software development lifecycle: agile, lean startup, scrum, kanban, OKR, etcLeadership: influencer, change driver, people & org developer, strategic thinkerTechnical skills: familiar with running a global data organisation, offering capabilities and services like event collection, stream/batch pipelines, data mesh and the pros/cons connected with such infrastructures is a nice to have. Previous experience with data asset inventory tools, such Apache Atlas or LinkedIn Data Hub highly considered as a plus; lAbility to understand and review codeThe ideal candidate would have experience collaborating with open source projects and managing teams who run innersource products.
Benefits
Competitive compensation packageOpportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisationBenefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plansFlexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computerSmart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more
EN: Flexible benefits programme (transport, restaurants, child-care, etc), Free daily breakfast, 26 days of holidayPrograma flexible de prestaciones (transporte, restaurantes, guarder√≠a, etc.), Desayuno diario gratuito, 26 d√≠as de vacaciones
Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.
If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

title: Lead Data Engineer
description:
LEAD DATA ANALYTICS ENGINEER 
About The Operations It Team
Operations IT is a global IT capability supporting the Global Operations organisation. We business partner with Operations capability areas: Pharmaceutical Technology Development, Manufacturing & Global Engineering, Quality Control, Sustainability, Supply Chain, Logistics and Global External Sourcing and Procurement. We operate out of Operations hubs sites including in the UK, Sweden, US, and China; and out of our Global Technology Centres in India and Mexico.
Here our work has a direct impact on patients ‚Äì transforming our ability to develop life-changing medicines. We empower the business to perform at its peak and lead a new way of working, combining cutting-edge science with leading digital technology platforms and data. All with a passion to impact lives through data, analytics, AI, machine learning and more.
It‚Äôs a dynamic and challenging environment to work in ‚Äì but that‚Äôs why we like it. There are countless opportunities to learn and grow, whether that‚Äôs exploring new technologies in hackathons, or transforming the roles and work of colleagues, forever. This is your chance to be part of a team that has the backing to innovate, disrupt an industry and change lives.
Lead Data Analytics Engineer - Operations IT
We are seeking a Lead Data Analytics Engineer to join our Data, Analytics & AI (DA&AI) team in Operations IT. As part of our ground-breaking journey in Data DA&AI within Operations IT, we are advancing our Operation Data Hub (ODH) and adopting the Data Mesh architecture and ways of working. ODH provides Operations units with access to critical data and analytic tools, accelerating their work on life-saving medicines. With Data Mesh, Operations units can build reusable data product foundations for advanced analytics and insights.
Responsibilities:
Provide detailed design, aligned with the high level design provided by Solution Architects.Support solution development, provide technical leadership, and oversee technical delivery across multiple initiatives.Perform regular quality checks and validation on Data Engineering work delivered on projects under his/her leadershipEnsure efficient, secure, and compliant engineering and operation of data products.Develop scalable solutions for various data use cases, including batch analytics, data warehousing, data mart, Big Data stack, and real-time analytics based on streaming.Guide and collaborate with engineering teams responsible for data harvesting, storage, quality checks, transformation, and visualization.Build reusable data products that enable self-service analytics and AI/ML workflows for Operations units.Define engineering standards, processes, and roadmap in collaboration with solution architecture and Platform lead.Drive the consolidation of technology stack and implementation of modern data engineering tools and platforms.Provide technical leadership throughout the software development lifecycle, collaborating with teams in Chennai, UK, and Sweden.Work closely with Enterprise Data & AI teams to leverage central Enterprise Data Platforms.Utilize a collaborative delivery approach, using Agile or other appropriate methodologies as needed
Requirements: To be successful in this role, you should have:
Extensive experience as a Technical Lead for Data Analytics and Engineering Projects.Ability to support solution development, provide technical leadership, and oversee delivery across multiple initiatives.Experience leading engineers in matrix organizations.Experience in managing technical delivery Proficiency in owning technical delivery, working with solution architects, and ensuring detailed design and implementation.Knowledge and experience in defining standard ways of working for Analytics and Engineering.Experience working with international teams, including those in India, Mexico, and the US.Expertise in a broad range of data tools, ETL frameworks, monitoring and data technologies, such as SAP HANA, SAP MDG, PowerBI, Qlik Sense, Qlik Replicate, EMR, Hudi, Collibra, Snowflake, DBT, AWS Kinesis.Proficiency in visualization technologies, particularly Power BI and Qlik Sense.Knowledge of Data Mesh and Data Product concepts, including experience in delivering and managing data products.Familiarity with data architectures, including dimensional modelling.Understanding of cloud-based data management services, such as AWS or equivalent.Advanced SQL skills.Experience in building scalable and high-availability analytics solutions.Knowledge of continuous integration and continuous development practices.Proficiency in data analysis, including profiling, investigating, interpreting, and documenting data structures.Experience in identifying and executing data engineering activities for multiple initiatives.
WHY JOIN US
Here our work has a direct impact on patients ‚Äì transforming our ability to develop life-changing medicines. We empower the business to perform at its peak and lead a new way of working, combining cutting-edge science with leading digital technology platforms and data. All with a passion to impact lives through data, analytics, AI, machine learning and more. Join us at a crucial stage of our journey in becoming a digital and data-led enterprise. Make the impossible possible by building partnerships and ecosystems, creating new ways of working and driving scale and speed to deliver exponential growth. Focused and committed, and backed with the investment to succeed, we‚Äôre driving cross-company change to disrupt the entire industry.
About Astrazeneca
AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven Biopharmaceutical business that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world‚Äôs most serious disease. But we‚Äôre more than one of the world‚Äôs leading pharmaceutical companies.
At AstraZeneca we‚Äôre dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There‚Äôs no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration. Always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development.
SO, WHAT NEXT? 
If you‚Äôre interested in applying, we encourage you to apply using your completed Workday profile where possible.

title: Senior Data Scientist, Knowledge Management LS
description:
Senior Data Scientist, Knowledge Management, Life Science

Great opportunity for a Data Scientist to join our Knowledge Management team in Barcelona.

We are always looking for talented scientists to grow and develop our Knowledge Management team and currently we are looking for an experienced data scientist who will work with our clients ‚Äì ranging from pharmaceutical companies to clinical centers and non-profit organizations ‚Äì on different projects, related to data analysis, data processing, literature curation and reconstruction of molecular pathways.

About You ‚Äì Experience, Education, Skills, And Accomplishments

PhD or master‚Äôs degree with at least 3 years of relevant experience in data management/ data governance.Background in molecular biology, biochemistry, bioinformatics, data science, engineering or information technology.Extensive experience with curation of multiple data sources and processing omics (transcriptomics, proteomics, genotypes, etc.) or other high-dimensional data is strongly preferred.The ability to clean, transform, and manipulate data from a variety of sources, as well as to create effective visualizations of data.Experience with scripting languages (Python, R) or database querying languages (SQL) is required.

It would be great if you also had . . .

Proficiency with relational and NoSQL databases, and database schema/structure design is preferred.A strong background in statistical analysis, including knowledge of statistical models, methods, and hypothesis testing is preferred.Familiarity with AI/ML techniques and approaches is preferred.Knowledge of Clarivate proprietary databases, such as Cortellis, MetaBase, Web of Science and OFF-X would be a plus.Prior experience in the pharmaceutical industry or a related field is preferred.Experience in project management, excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to conduct regular presentations, lead customer conversations and write scientific texts/articles.Aptitude for working in a customer-oriented consulting environment: an ability to earn customer trust through effective communication, efficiency, integrity and a proactive mindset and motivation to drive and implement own ideas.

What will you be doing in this role?

Delivery:

Be responsible for systematization of biological and medical information, search and in-depth analysis of translational and medical data.Collaborate on research projects that leverage text-mining and machine learning techniques to address biomedical problems, such as drug discovery, disease diagnosis, or treatment optimization.Contribute to data engineering and knowledge representation efforts for biomedical research, including ETL processes, data normalization and integration, and knowledge graph modeling.

Project management:

Work independently and as part of the team to carry out a variety of data analyses ensuring adherence to the agreed project scope, timeline and budget.

Client Service:

Scope data management projects by understanding client needs and developing analytical strategy to meet them.Work with customers in data analysis, extraction, curation and processing of translational research datasets.

Portfolio development:

Contribute to improvement of existing and development of new offerings within Knowledge Management Consulting.Contribute to the development of data management solutions and new approaches to address complicated and interesting scientific questions.Participate in business and strategy development by scoping customers‚Äô needs and transforming their requirements into solutions.Publish results of your research in scientific journals, prepare customer-oriented presentations, training materials and lead webinars.

About The Team

You‚Äôll be reporting to the Senior Manager based in Barcelona.Our Knowledge management team of Data scientists comprises a dynamic group of experts specializing in data management and governance. With a global presence, our team consists of experts located in Barcelona, Spain with some team members based throughout the rest of Spain and US.As specialists in data management, we excel in providing comprehensive support to clients across the pharmaceutical and biotech industries.Our team culture thrives on collaboration, emphasizing mutual support and a dynamic work environment.

Hours of Work

This is a permanent full-time position at 40 hours a week (35 hours during July and August).The working schedule is flexible, mostly centred on CET time zone with occasional need to accommodate late or early meetings with US or East Asia time zones.The position is hybrid going to the office in Barcelona 2-3 times per week.

What We Can Offer You

A modern culture environment combined with all the financial and stability advantages of working for a large business.Active volunteering community, with 40 annual paid hours of volunteering time.Private Health and Life & Disability insurances.Tax-free benefits (Ticket Restaurant scheme, kindergarten and transport cards).Language classes (Catalan, Spanish and English).Global and dynamic employee base (more than 20 nationalities).30 working days of vacation.

At Clarivate, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all persons with respect to hiring, compensation, promotion, training and other terms, conditions and privileges of employment. We comply with applicable laws and regulations governing non-discrimination in all locations.

title: Data Team Lead/Senior Data Team Lead (FSP) - Home Based, Europe
description:
JOIN US ON OUR EXCITING JOURNEY!

IQVIA‚Ñ¢ is The Human Data Science Company‚Ñ¢, focused on using data and science to help healthcare clients find better solutions for their patients. Formed through the merger of IMS Health and Quintiles, IQVIA offers a broad range of solutions that harness advances in healthcare information, technology, analytics and human ingenuity to drive healthcare forward.

This Clinical Data Team Lead will be responsible for managing end-to-end delivery of data management services for single/multi-service projects, ensuring quality deliverables on time and within budget, to customer satisfaction. Provide comprehensive data management expertise to Clinical Data Management (CDM) team to provide high quality data management products that meet customer needs. Direct the team in areas of project planning, execution and close-out, financial management, communications and milestone deliverables. Comply with Good Clinical Practices (GCPs), applicable regulatory guidelines, SOPs, policies, and, where available, CDM guidance documents.

Responsibilities

Client Management
Serve as primary point of contact for customer on clinical data management deliverablesProvide project management expertise working with customer data managers, key decision makers, and internal team members to manage continuous process improvements, issue escalation, workload projections, and provide technical expertiseProvide justification for and perform direct negotiations with customer, e.g., timelines, financial, process, resourceMaintain strong customer relationshipsEnsure open communications with customer and Quintiles management to manage and meet contractual obligations
Service Management
Meet with Data Operations Coordinator (DOC) and/or Data Operations team members on a regular basis to ensure milestones meet timelines and quality deliverablesEstablish strong communications with Data Operations team, functional leads, project managers and all other stake holdersSupport DM service delivery with comprehensive DM process and technical expertise in executing projectsServe as the escalation point for unresolved data issues; work with client data managers, vendors, and internal team members for resolutionWork with functional manager(s) to ensure appropriate resources are assigned to meet project deliverablesCreate and/or review and sign-off on all data management plan (DMP) documentsImplement proactive quality management plans across multiple projects/programme. Track service performance and provide leadership to identify root causes of issues and implement remedial actionsServe as Subject Matter Expert (SME)Provide leadership and expertise in a specific CDM task or technologyMaintain internal tracking databases and systems
Qualifications
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree, or educational equivalent, in health, clinical, biological or mathematical sciences, or related field5+ years direct Clinical Data Management experience in CRO or pharmaceuticals industry , including 3+ years as a CDM project lead; or equivalent combination of education, training and experiencePrevious experience and proven competence in managing delivery of multiple projects through full DM life-cycle (several studies/programmes)Previous experience of handling customer negotiationsKnowledge of Good Clinical Practices and relevant regulatory guidelinesExcellent communication, interpersonal, customer service, and teamwork skillsComprehensive understanding of clinical drug development processAbility to establish and maintain effective working relationships with co-workers, managers and customers
IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible ‚Äì to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

title: Senior Data Engineer - Shared Technology (Incident Management)
description:
Craft:
Job Description:
Do you have excellent critical thinking skills and enjoy working quickly to solve emerging challenges?
If so look no further! We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to be a member our top performing Incident Management team at King. You will get the opportunity to work across multi-disciplinary departments across the Kingdom, including game teams, shared tech, infrastructure, data teams to detect various types of game related incidents. A large part of your role will be to own strategic projects, such as real-time anomaly detection where we work with external parties.
As a Senior Data Engineer in the Incident Management team at King, you will have the opportunity to work with best-in-class tools, including innovative AI solutions for anomaly detection and monitoring. These tools are designed to enhance the team's ability to detect and respond to various types of game-related incidents effectively.
The job can be challenging yet very rewarding, with opportunies to work on business critical projects that make a significant impact within the organization. We strive for excellence and take pride in being one of highest-performing teams at King.
In such an environment, our team members feel a sense of belonging and purpose. They understand that their work is meaningful and that their contributions make a difference. This sense of importance and impact further strengthens their commitment to the team's goals and objectives.
Your role within our Kingdom
You will be working collaboratively across all parts of the business to crack company- wide problems in how we operate our business.
Reporting to the Associate Director of Incident Management Technology, you will:
Lead our main project of real-time anomaly detection that detects short term and long-term anomalies/trend shift on company KPIsUnderstand the real-time data landscape at King and thrive for opportunities to innovate new ways to detect incidents, analyze both business and technical trendsUnderstand GCP ecosystem and its monitoringDesign and maintain real-time data pipelines, batch ETLs and API integrationsDesign data models for root cause investigationMeasure and evaluate the efficiency of owned productsWork closely with the Incident Operation team, to provide anomaly detection and analytical capabilitiesFoster strong relationships with other key functions across King, such as Game Studios and Shared Tech Engineering, as well as to support their needs around monitoring and anomaly detectionGenerate ad-hoc data visualizations (reporting, dashboards) during on-going incident investigation, deliver actionable insights that can support and drive impactful decisionsRecognize opportunities and risks in anomaly detection and incident prevention area
Skills To Create Thrills
You are a passionate problem solver with the ability to draw data driven insights that will add real value to King. You will understand the requirements and expectations of your stakeholders and understand the technical requirements for solutions.
Experience working in a commercial data team, providing business insights and models which lead to data informed business decisionsExperience in managing stakeholder relationsBusiness Insight: Be able to understand the problems and issues our games and business wants to solve, and then defining the right data, analysis or interpretation to lead to the right recommendations and decisionsCommunication: Designing good ways of communicating, visualizing or reporting your results/analysis so that they are clear and unambiguousGreat relationship building skills and experience working with a wide range of stakeholders across the businessExperience working with a product life cycle, prioritizing backlog, managing stakeholder expectationsExperience working with cloud-based environments (GCP, AWS)Experience building data models, proficiency with SQL and PythonExperience with Git and development processExperience working with API‚ÄôsAbility to manage multiple projects and tasksStrong Technical understanding or Technical background

Solid understanding or passion for the games industryExperience with Anomaly Detection tools and processesUnderstanding of AI/ML workflowsPragmatic problem- solver ‚Äì someone who looks for solutions rather than worrying about problemsGCP certification
While we value dedication and commitment, we also understand the importance of work-life balance. We promote a healthy work-life integration where you can manage your responsibilities effectively while maintaining a fulfilling personal life. Our aim is to create an environment where you can thrive both professionally and personally
About King
King is the game developer behind the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as mobile game hits including Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch and Pet Rescue. Candy Crush is the top-grossing franchise in US app stores, a position it has held for the last two years, and King‚Äôs games are being played by 245 million monthly active users as of Q3 2021. King, which is part of the Activision Blizzard group since its acquisition in 2016, employs nearly 2,000 people in game studios in Stockholm, Malm√∂, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in San Francisco, New York, and Malta.
A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes
Making games is fun. Especially when you do it with people who share the same idea of what makes a good workplace great. We design games for everyone, no matter where they are or who they are, and we employ all sorts of people from all kinds of backgrounds to bring them to life. Truth is, we simply cannot expect diversity in our players and originality in our games without first nurturing it in our people. A great saga needs all sorts of heroes.
Making the World Playful
Making the World Playful is what inspires us to create new experiences and raise the bar. It‚Äôs what makes King a place where we can all dream bigger, continue to add innovation to our games, broadening the portfolio and exploring new territories in mid-core and casual. We take the art and science of gaming to the next level through our curiosity for the unexplored, passion for games, respect for each other and love for our players - and we‚Äôre not afraid to have fun along the way. In fact, together with our parent company Activision Blizzard and experts around the world, we believe having fun is good for you. There has never been a better time to join us. We're dreaming bigger and see a world of possibilities ahead. If you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful!
Applications need to be in English.
Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Director, Commercial Data Science & AI - EU
description:
Make a greater impact on lives through a digitally-enabled enterprise
We are working towards our aspiration of shaping the future of Pharma. Backed by investment at every step, we harness the latest technology, data, and innovative ways of working to introduce new approaches that put Digital at AstraZeneca‚Äôs heart.
Be part of a chapter that‚Äôs still being written. Trusted and empowered to change the way things are done, with the tools and support to get you there. Here we are free to unleash our curiosity and turn thinking into reality where smart risks and quick decisions come together to power disruption and innovation.
Office Locations: This is an on-site - office-based, global role. Please consider the following AZ HUB locations ‚Äì Cambridge, UK - Madrid, Spain ‚Äì Gothenburg, Sweden ‚Äì Milan, Italy ‚Äì Hamburg, DE.
Role and Responsibilities:
The Director, of Commercial Data Sciences & AI - European Union is a key leader in the Commercial Data Science & AI team whose mission is to take a patient-centric, data-driven approach to personalize and transform healthcare delivery to the millions of patients along with a multi-disciplinary team of physicians who care for them. This responsibility involves working closely with cross-functional Science, Medical, and Business leaders to identify, prioritize, and develop Data Science, AI, and Advanced Analytics Platform & Products across AZ Oncology and Bio-pharma Business
The scope of this role is Global with a focus on EU markets where AstraZeneca‚Äôs life-changing medicines are approved to help patients live longer and realize AZ‚Äôs bold ambition of eliminating Cancer as a cause of death.
YOUR MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES AND TASKS:
Collaborate across the AstraZeneca Data and AI community to develop best practices and cross-functional opportunities that drive valueOversight of partnerships with multiple third parties, academic or outsourced partners to shape and drive project outcomes and knowledge buildingOwn and lead Data Science & AI products per Cancer tumor type and /or Biopharma disease area. Product features includeDevelopment of ML Models & Classifiers for a deeper understanding of the patient journeyDevelopment of Predictive ML models around patient disease progression, Adverse events, and other outcomesOwn and lead the development of ML models using unstructured notes, Scientific, Clinical documents, and Research publicationsOwn and lead the development of Personalized ML models around the dissemination of Scientific, Medical content and messages across Physical & Digital Channels in a coordinated manner for the best patient outcomesThese products include the application of specialized approaches in classification, regression, clustering, NLP, image analysis, deep learning, knowledge graphs, and/or other advanced techniques.Using domain-specific understanding, translate unstructured, complex business problems into the appropriate data problem, models, and analytical solutions across multiple disease areasDevelop effective relationships with EU commercial and medical leaders to ensure the utilization and value of information resourcesResponsible for Evangelizing & Applying advanced data science capabilities across multiple cross-business teams, including Sales, Marketing, Medical, and Market Access that drive value to AstraZeneca Commercial BusinessLead and apply ongoing knowledge and awareness in trends, standard methodology, and new developments in data science to influence functional practices.
Your Education & Experience
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree plus 5-7 years of progressive professional work experience in mathematics, computer science, engineering, physics, statistics, economics, computational sciences, or a quantitative discipline. * 7+ years of qualified professional experience can be substituted for Bachelor‚Äôs degreeDocumented track record of Developing Data Science and AI products that have generated business value, and impact across multiple IndustriesIn-depth experience with modern data science approaches, including unsupervised and supervised classification and regression algorithms such as k-means clustering, support vector machines, random forests, neural networks, and deep learning. May also have expertise in advanced statistical modeling or broader aspects of applied mathematics such as dynamic systems or optimizationExperience in the modeling of complex datasets in applied business and/or scientific application domainsAdvanced software development skills in at least two of the standard data science languages (such as R, Julia, or Python) and familiarity with database systems (e.g. SQL, NoSQL, graph)In-depth experience in manipulating and analyzing large high dimensionality unstructured datasets, drawing conclusions, defining recommended actions, and reporting results across stakeholdersUnderstanding of algorithm design, development, optimization, scaling, and applicationsExcellent written and verbal communication, business analysis, and consultancy skills with stakeholders and colleagues
Preferred Qualifications:
Advanced degree plus 3 - 5 years of progressive professional work experience in mathematics, computer science, engineering, physics, statistics, economics, or a quantitative discipline.Previous work experience in high-performance computing or cloud environmentDocumented track record of publishing relevant predictive modeling results and tools in peer-reviewed journals, conferences, and other scientific proceedings.Prior experience in understanding biomedical data sets and real-world data sets relevant to life sciences and healthcareKnowledge of novel methods of development and applicationFamiliarity with navigating a complex global organizationPrior people management experience in recruiting, leading, and mentoring Data Science and Machine learning EngineersTrack record of success in influencing and controlling budgets
Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can‚Äôt wait to hear from you.
To be considered for this exciting opportunity, please complete the full application on our website at your earliest convenience -- it is the only way that our Recruiter and Hiring Manager can know that you feel well qualified for this opportunity.
Where can I find out more?
Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en

title: Senior Data Engineer - Tech Anchor
description:
Data Engineers at Thoughtworks develop modern data architecture approaches to meet key business objectives and provide end-to-end data solutions. You might spend a few weeks with a new client on a deep technical review or a complete organizational review, helping them to understand the potential that data brings to solve their most pressing problems. On other projects, you might be acting as the architect, leading the design of technical solutions, or perhaps overseeing a program inception to build a new product. It could also be a software delivery project where you're equally happy coding and tech-leading the team to implement the solution.
Thoughtworks Data & AI service line has a strong focus on data-driven solutions and is a pioneer in Data Mesh and Continuous Delivery for Machine Learning (CD4ML). We pride ourselves on delivering innovative and cutting-edge strategies and solutions that empower businesses to succeed in a rapidly evolving data landscape. Our team is composed of skilled professionals who are passionate about harnessing the power of data to drive tangible outcomes. By joining our team, you will have the unique opportunity to work at the forefront of Data Mesh and CD4ML implementations, contributing to their evolution in the industry, and gaining invaluable experience in these groundbreaking methodologies.
We are currently seeking an experienced and motivated Senior Data Engineer to join our growing team. As a Senior Data Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of data-driven projects, leading both the technical and strategic aspects of our engagements. You will be responsible for mentoring and guiding your team while ensuring the delivery of high-quality solutions that meet our clients' needs.
Job responsibilities
Lead the design, development, and implementation of high-quality solutions to complex data engineering problems.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify data requirements and develop innovative strategies to meet client needs.Act as a technical and strategic leader, driving architectural design decisions and providing thought leadership in data engineering best practices.Mentor and guide data engineering team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and growth.Develop and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders, serving as a trusted advisor on all data-related matters.Continuously evaluate and optimize data engineering processes and technologies, driving improvements and efficiencies across the team.Oversee data quality, ensuring the highest standards are met across all projects and engagements.Assure effective collaboration between Thoughtworks‚Äô and the client‚Äôs teams, encouraging open communication and advocating for shared outcomes.
Job Qualifications
Technical skills
Comfortable with both coding and guiding a team to implement data-driven solutions.Proven track record of innovation and expertise in Data Engineering across various industries and organizations.Deep understanding of data modeling, with hands-on experience using data engineering tools and platforms such as Kafka, Spark, and Hadoop.Proficient in building large-scale data pipelines and data-centric applications on distributed storage platforms (e.g., HDFS, S3, NoSQL databases like Hbase and Cassandra) and distributed processing platforms (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Oozie, and Airflow) in a production setting.Experience with MapR, Cloudera, Hortonworks, or cloud-based Hadoop distributions (e.g., AWS EMR, Azure HDInsights, Qubole).Ability to apply data-driven approaches and data security strategies to address business challenges.Genuine enthusiasm for data infrastructure and operations, including familiarity with cloud environments and large-scale distributed systems.Proven experience in creating Big Data architectures, building and operating data pipelines, and maintaining data storage within distributed systems.
Professional skills
Advocate your data engineering expertise to the broader tech community outside of Thoughtworks, speaking at conferences and acting as a mentor for more junior-level data engineers.You‚Äôre resilient and flexible in ambiguous situations and enjoy solving problems from technical and business perspectives.An interest in coaching others, sharing your experience and knowledge with teammates.You enjoy influencing others and always advocate for technical excellence while being open to change when needed.
If you have most but not all of the skills we ask for, don‚Äôt worry! You don't have to check all the boxes. Feel free to apply!
Other things to know
Learning & Development (L&D)
There is no one-size-fits-all career path at Thoughtworks: however you want to develop your career is entirely up to you. But we also balance autonomy with the strength of our cultivation culture. This means your career is supported by interactive tools, numerous development programs and teammates who want to help you grow. We see value in helping each other be our best and that extends to empowering our employees in their career journeys.
Benefits
We offer thoughtful, well-rounded benefits to support your personal and professional development goals and your health and well being. Benefits packages are periodically reviewed to provide the best work experience, ensuring everyone is supported on their journey with us.
Some of the perks you will enjoy while working with us are:
Enjoy a flexible benefits budget (restaurants/public transport/nursery/health insurance)Keep growing thanks to Learning budget Enjoy 2 days extra days off per year for learningUnlimited Business Udemy access to learnBrush up your English, Spanish, Catalan thanks to free online classesTake care of your mental well-being thanks to ifeel app Get a work from home budget Team outing budget Business trips will be stress free thanks to travel insurance Enjoy working in an international, diverse and inclusive environment
Our contribution to the Tech community
Our job is to foster a vibrant community where technologists from all walks of life come together to build solutions that look past the obvious. One of the ways we do this is through digital publications, books and tools, such as the Technology Radar, Perspectives or Looking Glass. Here are some of the most famous books written by our colleagues.
About Thoughtworks
Thoughtworks is a global technology consultancy that integrates strategy, design and engineering to drive digital innovation. For 30+ years, our clients have trusted our autonomous teams to build solutions that look past the obvious. Here, computer science grads come together with seasoned technologists, self-taught developers, midlife career changers and more to learn from and challenge each other. Career journeys flourish with the strength of our cultivation culture, which has won numerous awards around the world.
Join Thoughtworks and thrive. Together, our extra curiosity, innovation, passion and dedication overcomes ordinary.
We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, we value diversity and it's one of our core values. Here at Thoughtworks, we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.
We work remotely from all around Spain. Check out where our Thoughtworkers are based in the country.

location: Sant Cugat del Vall√®s, Catalonia, Spain
description:

Your main responsibilities will be:

You will be responsible to lead our cloud department (including Delivery, Presales and Team Lead). You will be part of the GFT Cloud Centre of Excellence, collaborating daily with other GFT experts to push our value proposition.Leading the Data Governance offering in the company, also providing support in pre-sales activities.Developing and implementing data governance strategies and policies to meet both our company's and our clients' objectives.Engaging in pre-sales activities, effectively articulating our data governance approach, capabilities, and benefits to prospective clients.Leading data governance projects, ensuring they are completed on time, within scope, and within budget.Designing and monitoring data standards, processes, and technology to manage data assets.Ensuring compliance with regulations such as GDPR, CCPA, and any other relevant data protection legislation.Conducting data governance maturity assessments and delivering strategic recommendations to our clients.Collaborating with cross-functional teams to provide input and leadership on data governance matters.Establishing and maintaining strong relationships with both clients and internal stakeholders.

title: Data Science & Supply Chain planning consultant - Global Supply Chain & Operations Artificial Intelligence.
description:
Job Description


Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all of these services. With our thought leadership and culture of innovation, we apply industry expertise, diverse skill sets and next-generation technology to each business challenge. We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person. Our core values comprise of Stewardship, Best People, Client Value Creation, One Global Network, Respect for the Individual and Integrity. Year after year, Accenture is recognized worldwide not just for business performance but for inclusion and diversity too. ‚ÄúAcross the globe, one thing is universally true of the people of Accenture: We care deeply about what we do and the impact we have with our clients and with the communities in which we work and live. It is personal to all of us.‚Äù ‚Äì Julie Sweet, Accenture CEO As a team: Supply Chain & Operations is a major functionally-oriented strategy & consulting practice: we help our clients reimagine and transform tomorrow‚Äôs supply chains and operations to positively impact business, society, and the planet. We do this through a human centered and data driven approach that encourages our people and clients to continuously innovate and generate significant, sustainable global impact. Built on the three pillars of customer centricity, zero based mindset, and responsible operations & organizations, this is what we call the Intelligent Supply Chain. You'll learn, grow and advance in an innovative culture that thrives on shared success, diverse ways of thinking and enables boundaryless opportunities that can drive your career in new and exciting ways If you‚Äôre looking for a challenging career working in a vibrant environment with access to training and a global network of experts, this could be the role for you. As part of our global team, you'll be working with cutting-edge technologies and will have the opportunity to develop a wide range of new skills on the job. Supply Chain & Operations ‚Äì Capability Network is seeking to recruit a Manager/Consultant with strong advisory consulting experience and a history of strategic Intelligent Platform implementation and/or planning & Fulfilment. The Planning & Fulfilment community is one of the key components of Accenture‚Äôs Supply Chain & Operations service line within Strategy & Consulting that operates across industry groups alongside Supply Chain & Fulfillment, Operations & Process Transformation, and Responsible Value Chain.

In our team you will:

Learn at the forefront of the industry, provide actionable insights to the world's top organisations, helping them address priority C-suite issues with strategies and improvements they can execute with speed and at scale

Play a central role enabling our Planning & Fulfilment capabilities in working with some of the best global companies in the world, responsible for helping the CSO/COO, and her or his business partners, address some of the critical business issues faced today, including:- Supply Chain Strategy & Segmentation (Operating Model, Process Design, etc.)

Strategic Cost Reduction (Zero Based Supply Chain)

Demand and Supply Planning

Control Towers

Platform-Driven Transformation (Technology Strategy, Systems Implementation, BlueYonder, Kinaxis, OMPartners, Relex, o9 etc.)

Responsible and Resilient Supply Chain (Risk, Performance, Innovation, Diversity, Sustainability)

Warehouse & Inventory Management

Network Design & Optimization

Qualifications

Experience, Attributes and Qualifications:

Bachelor in mathematics, statistics, physics, Industrial or other Engineering is required

From 3 to 5 years of experience developing or running advanced analytics capabilities, preferably with consulting experience. Candidates that does not provide proven experience, there will not be processed.

Demonstrate strong understanding of business, technology and process implications as related to supply chain planning

Solving skills, with expertise in quantitative/qualitative process analysis techniques, process metrics and performance measurement

Exhibit effective oral and written communication, leadership, project management, and teamwork skills with an ability to interact effectively with different levels of management. Should be diplomatic, flexible, and have a good team approach.

Experience in a similar role, working as a data science, preferably in supply chain space

Excellent spoken and written communication skills (English).

Demonstrable experience at productizing models; from inception to deployment.

Professional Skill Requirements

Having supply chain strategy and operation consulting experienced is preferred.

Advanced algorithm modeling skills: Python, R

Deep theoretical and applied knowledge in one or more of the following areas: forecast modelling, inventory optimization, network optimization, supply simulation or digital twin modelling

Cloud architectures know how: Azure, AWS, GCP

Working knowledge of agile development, including DevOps and DataOps concepts.

Experience with Azure Data Factory, Databricks, etc‚Ä¶is a plus.

Experience with Statistical/Machine Learning techniques is a plus.

Familiarity with business solutions tools (such as o9, BlueYonder, etc‚Ä¶).

Skills in business diagnostics, value assessment and opportunity identification, and application design of Supply chain

title: Data Provisioning Lead
description:
Warsaw PLN, Barcelona ESP, Gothenburg SWE
Competitive Salary + Benefits
Be empowered to be innovative and creative where difference is valued
Would you like to be a part of a Data Science & Artificial Intelligence (DS&AI) group who has direct strategic impact on drug development, playing a key role in getting medicines to patients?
At AstraZeneca, we are constantly pushing the boundaries of science to deliver life-changing medicines to patients, with a real passion for discovery and a pipeline to show for it. Here, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to make a difference in people‚Äôs lives every single day.
AstraZeneca is investing in data management and analysis capabilities, through its long-term Growth Through Innovation Strategy. The DS&AI team collaborates across R&D to drive innovation through data science and AI. Together we seek to:
Improve our understanding of disease and uncovering new targetsTransform R&D processesSpeed the design and delivery of new medicines for patients
The R&D Data Office, within DS&AI, is a key organisation to deliver upon AstraZeneca‚Äôs strategy. Data Office operates a central capability, with R&D wide accountability, to ensure that we harness the power of data to drive innovative science. Data Office will govern data, drive data quality and ensure our data is readied for analytics, crafting paved-paths for scientists to perform data-driven research, without compromising our legal restrictions or ethical principles.
Within Data Office, your role is Data Provisioning Lead, a member of a dedicated Data Provisioning Operations team. In this role you will coordinate end-to-end activities associated to Data Provisioning including: Collaborating closely with partners; performing risk assessment associated to data-sharing, with emphasis on AstraZeneca‚Äôs four sharing principles; business sensitivity, legal rights, ethical and scientific merit; and coordinate cross-team activities to achieve delivery outcomes.
Crucially, your role will drive the maintenance and improvement of the four sharing principles to make data available for re-use within or outside AstraZeneca.
To be successful in this role you must have excellent critical thinking skills, enjoy succeeding in task-orientated goals, and be able to connect with partners from different experience levels and cultures.
This is an opportunity to secure a unique, centralised role within AstraZeneca, joining a team of highly motivated people in a truly global organisation.
Tasks And Responsibilities
Coordinate data provisioning requests and associated information.Ensure that data requestor needs are met as each request goes through the process.Assess requests and assign an appropriate service level for request fulfilmentResponsible for tracking progress of request, ensure relevant information is captured as part of request and responsible for keeping each request running smoothly.Acting as a central coordinator for projects requiring cross-functional activities, including arranging, hosting and minuting meetings, coordinating actions to-time and to-task.Monitor request progress, handle and seek mitigation for any issues that might arise.Work with the Data Provisioning team and other partners to eliminate blockers.Ensure data sharing standards and requirements are met, bringing in other specialists where clarifications are required.Use tools to monitor progress on requests.Support the Data Provisioning team in considering ways to improve processes and value to our customers.Contribute to department metrics on performance efficiency
Minimum Requirements
Proven work experience as a Project Leader/Manager or similar roleAbility to handle partner requirementsGood communication and teamwork skillsMust have a high level attention to detailsAn ability to create relationships across different levels and cultures.Solid organizational skills, including multitasking and time-managementBSc in Business Administration, related field, or equivalent professional experienceLeadership Core Capabilities: Influencing, innovation, business awareness
Preferred Experience
Experience from Pharma industry is a plus.
Why we love it
If your passion is science and you want to be part of a team that makes a bigger impact on patients‚Äô lives, then there‚Äôs no better place to be. Here we truly understand science and apply it every day to strengthen and grow our pipeline.
So, what‚Äôs next?
This role opens on the 11th July, and we encourage your application no later than the 28th July 2023.
Where can I find out more?
LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/
Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/
Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en

title: Big Data Architects
description:
Job Description


Esta es tu oportunidad para unirte a un equipo diverso de personas apasionadas por el Big Data.

En buenas manos ¬°las tuyas! las enormes cantidades de informaci√≥n que las empresas recopilan hoy pueden convertirse en un activo muy valioso manejadas estrat√©gicamente. Ayudamos a nuestros clientes a ser m√°s eficientes haciendo el mejor uso posible de los datos, aprovechados por los expertos para impulsar un nuevo motor de crecimiento de servicios de informaci√≥n.

Si te gusta aprender y disfrutas de una gran pasi√≥n por trabajar con nuevas tecnolog√≠as adem√°s de ayudar a los clientes a administrar los datos de manera efectiva para generar conocimiento y valor, este es tu sitio. Estamos buscando desarrolladores senior y arquitect@s en Accenture, el lugar perfecto para continuar construyendo tu carrera. Nuestro equipo est√° creciendo por lo que siempre estamos atentos a nuevo talento como el tuyo. Las oportunidades dentro de las emocionantes iniciativas en el entorno digital que llevamos a cabo con nuestros clientes son ilimitadas, por tanto no te faltar√°n inspiraci√≥n o desaf√≠os.

Algunas de tus responsabilidades:

Dise√±ar e implementar arquitecturas de datos en grandes clientes

Formar parte y liderar equipos de desarrolladores software
