title: Azure Data Engineer
description:
Job Description
Role Overview:
 As a Consultant, Data Engineering, you will collect, aggregate, store, and reconcile data in support of Client business decisions.  You will help design and build data pipelines, data streams, reporting tools, information dashboards, data service APIs, data generators and other end-user information portals and insight tools.  You will be a critical part of the data supply chain, ensuring that stakeholders can access and manipulate data for routine and ad hoc analysis to drive business outcomes using Advanced Analytics 
Day-to-day:
 Translate business requirements to technical solutions leveraging strong business.  Analyze current business practices, processes and procedures as well as identifying future business opportunities for leveraging Microsoft Azure Data & Analytics PaaS Services.  Support the planning and implementation of data design services, providing sizing and configuration assistance and performing needs assessments.  Deliver of architectures for transformations and modernizations of enterprise data solutions using Azure cloud data technologies.  Design and Build Modern Data Pipelines and Data Streams.  Design and Build Data Service APIs.  Develop and maintain data warehouse schematics, layouts, architectures and relational/non-relational databases for data access and Advanced Analytics.  Expose data to end users using PowerBI, Azure API Apps or any other modern visualization platform or experience.  Implement effective metrics and monitoring processes. 
Key Technical skills
 Data Lake Store  Azure Data Factory  Azure Blob Storage  Azure SQL DB  Azure Synapse Analytics  Azure DataBricks 
Preferred Education Background
You likely possess a bachelor‚Äôs degree in Applied Mathematics, Statistics, or another relevant field. An equivalent combination of education and experience will also suffice.
Work experience:
You likely have about +3 years' relevant professional experience.
¬øWanna know more about us?
 üíª Flexible schedule  üè† Possibility to work 100% remotely  üéâ Days off during Christmas and Easter.  ü©∫ Medical insurance.  üí∞ Variable and flexible remuneration.  üå± Microsoft certification and training in soft skills 
If you want to know more about our benefits, check this link
¬øAre You interested in us? ¬°Sign up bellow!
About Avanade
Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital, cloud and advisory services, industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day, our 59,000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers.
We have been recognized as Microsoft‚Äôs Global SI Partner of the Year more than any other company. With the most Microsoft certifications (60,000+) and 18 (out of 18) Gold-level Microsoft competencies, we are uniquely positioned to help businesses grow and solve their toughest challenges.
We are a people first company, committed to providing an inclusive workplace where employees feel comfortable being their authentic selves. As a responsible business, we are building a sustainable world and helping people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential.
Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .

title: Investment Data Operations Team Lead
description:
Our opportunity 

As an Investment Data Operations Team Lead you will provide financial and investment related data with high levels of quality and consistency. Develops the services concerning governance, processes and distribution of data and pricing and reacts to regulation and business changes in a timely manner. Local Data Operations Team is part of a global team and requires some flexibility to work extended hours during month end activities and on local holidays.

 Your role 

  As an Investment Data Operations Team Lead your main responsibilities will involve  

 Delivers financial, investment, pricing, and valuation data according to agreed Standard levels and service scopes working with own team and/or with service providers  Runs daily business and closes deliverables in terms of reference data, pricing, and valuation.  Manages the global activities of the Data Operations Teams in the different locations, mainly organizing and monitoring daily and monthly closing activities.  Reviews all the predefined global (and group) requirements and controls regarding reference data/ pricing.  Reviews, designs and drives improvements and automation on all existing processes  Continuously improves data quality, integrity, and consistency in the data supply chain.  Supports the global organization in projects by acting as a Subject Matter Expert in addition to BAU activities.  Reviews and supplies regular and ad hoc reconciliation of Investment Information Solutions data and accounting data and ensure it is produced to the highest standard.  Acts as service owner vis-√†-vis stakeholders and as a single point of contact on investment data matters.  Manages demand and meets all project requirements ensuring alignment to global standards.  Enables information flows between various teams and team members in terms of processes, incidents, documentation, interaction model or other open topics ensuring transparency.  Acts as local contact for external partners and vendors and manages the vendors actively.  Provides input into strategic Data Management topics and supports such implementation  Strongly supports the Service Manager Data Solutions in overall strategic direction of the team and in implementing strategic initiatives  Creates a trusted and enabled environment where each team member can work at their best.  Coaches, develops, and inspires team members to help individuals reach their full potential  Coaches and assesses team members in establishing and leading high-performing teams, supporting the teams to reach their full potential  Makes the teams aware of what the team's business purpose is and how they deliver on that purpose  Leads the functional area, makes the teams aware of what they are required to achieve and how they are performing against their objectives. Sets objectives, reviews performance, and provides on-going formal and informal feedback. 

Your Skills And Experience

  As an Investment Data Operations Team Lead your skills and qualifications will ideally include:  

 5+ years of relevant experience in a similar role within the finance industry  Strong leadership and people management skills  Excellent stakeholder management / engagement skills  Solid financial market knowledge  Experience in managing financial market instrument information is a plus  Experience in the Fund Administration business is a plus  Knowledge of Bloomberg is desired  Excellent communications skills  Excellent service-oriented attitude  Proven ability to work in a multi-cultural environment 

Additional Information

  As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes:  

 Flexible working hours  Wide range of internal and external trainings  Free English and Spanish classes depending on the needs  Ticket restaurant  Life Insurance  Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company  Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you  Special banking and insurance conditions  Exclusive Employees discounts 

Primary work location is Barcelona. Please apply with your CV in English by clicking on the button ‚ÄúApply online‚Äù.

Who We Are

Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You‚Äôd give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It‚Äôs a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.

 Diversity & Inclusion 

At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.

So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.

Why Zurich

At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?

We are an equal opportunity employer who knows that each employee is unique - that‚Äôs what makes our team so great!

Join us as we constantly explore new ways to protect our customers and the planet .

 Location(s): ES - Barcelona  Remote working: Hybrid  Schedule: Full Time  Recruiter name: Marta Perez Llonch

title: Senior Data Architect
description:
WONDERING WHAT‚ÄôS WITHIN DANAHER? TAKE A CLOSER LOOK. 
At first glance, you‚Äôll see Danaher‚Äôs scale. With $22.3B revenue, our 69,000 associates work across the globe at more than 25 unique operating companies within four platforms ‚Äî life sciences, diagnostics, water quality, and product identification.
Career development is important to us - you‚Äôll find associates who are as certain about their impact as they are about where they‚Äôre headed next. You‚Äôll find the Danaher Business System, which makes everything possible. You‚Äôll also see a company that investors trust‚Äîour culture of continuous improvement has helped us outperform the S&P 500 by more than 5,000% over the past 25 years.
We hope you‚Äôll see yourself here, too. What you find at Danaher ‚Äî and within yourself ‚Äî might just change the world.
WHO WE ARE: 
ESKO is a global provider of integrated software and hardware solutions that accelerate the go-to-market process of packaged goods. For each stakeholder in the process, Esko solutions enable them to deliver right-first-time packaging and marketing content.
WITHIN YOUR TEAM
You will be working in a dynamic and fast-paced environment and work with cross-functional teams to design, build and roll-out solutions to our wide range of customer segments - CPG Brands, Global Life Science customers & Global Packaging Manufactures and service providers. Successful candidate must have a good understanding of the data lifecycle (ingest, transform, curate, analyse, predict, govern) and the latest in data management, data architectures for SaaS applications and analytic technologies including AI, Graph and NLP technologies.
Come work with our dedicated and innovative team to shape the future of our platform and the industry.
THIS JOB IS A UNIQUE OPPORTUNITY TO: 
As Data Architect, you will define the data strategy, data architecture and oversee the implementation of this data architecture that will be the backbone for Esko‚Äôs software platform and AI capabilities. The Data Architect will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining the Esko Software Platform data architecture. This includes ensuring data is stored, organised, and accessible in a way that meets the needs of the Esko‚Äôs current and future product roadmap and platform aspirations. The Data Architect will work closely with the Product management, R&D, DevOps, and business stakeholders to create and maintain data models and structures that support the organisation's current and future technology landscape and innovation ambitions.
WITHIN YOUR ROLE, YOU WILL:
Work with industry leaders, customers, product management and technical teams to understand data requirements and design appropriate data models and structures for the ESKO software platformStay abreast of the industry trends shaping the ESKO business and associated data architecture requirements and best practices in data architecture, AI and AnalyticsIdentifying data sources, both internal and external, and working out a plan for data management that is aligned with the Esko platform strategyDesign and develop data architectures that support functional and nonfunctional domains covered by the ESKO product portfolioWork with the Data Science team to identify data needs and requirements around ML/AI use cases and incorporate then into the data architecture evolution.Develop strategies for data storage, organization, and access that meet the evolving needs of our software productsProvide guidance and support to development teams in implementing data structures and models in line with platform strategy and SaaS standards and architecture patterns.Document and communicate data architecture design and implementation to stakeholders.
WE ARE LOOKING FOR A PROFESSIONAL WHO HAS:
Ability to implement common data management and reporting technologies, as well as the basics of columnar and NoSQL databases, data visualisation, unstructured data, and predictive analyticsStrong understanding of predictive modeling, Machine learning, NLP and text analysisAbility to implement common data management and reporting technologies, as well as the basics of columnar and NoSQL databases, data visualisation, unstructured data, and predictive analytics.Design and development of AI driven applicationsExperienced with both relational and non-relational databases & familiarity with cloud-based data storage and data management architectures and platformsProblem solver with strong analytical skills
OUR CORE VALUES: 
We believe that real breakthroughs come from teams that think big and respect each other‚Äôs differences ‚Äì different ideas, different perspectives, and different experiences. We encourage all voices to be heard, both internally as we collaborate and externally as we listen to our customers‚Äô most pressing needs. And we would love to have you on this journey with us! Apply today.
Our Shared Purpose ‚Äì Helping Realize Life‚Äôs Potential ‚Äì expresses our reason for being and the impact that every one of us at Danaher strives to have on the world. Our Core Values define the fundamental beliefs that guide our actions. The Core Behaviours* enable our values and Shared Purpose, powered by DBS as our proven system for achieving success at Danaher.
YOUR EDUCATION AND BACKGROUND EXPERIENCE WILL INCLUDE: 
At least 10 years of experience in data architecture, database design, or a related field with hands on experience designing data architectures for SaaS platforms with AI capabilitiesMaster's degree or Equivalent in computer science, information systems, or a related fieldKnowledge of systems development, including system development life cycle, project management approaches and requirements, design, and testing techniquesKnowledge of programming languages Python, C/C++, Java, and Perl
OUR BENEFITS:
We offer you an employee bonus based on business success as well as annual salary review Company pension, accident insurance and preventive healthcare (medical, dental, and visual) on day 1Training and development opportunities401K savings planTuition reimbursement from Day 1Attractive employee referral programmePaid Maternity & paternity payEmployee events, sports, and social clubsDanaher Wellbeing Program, with rewardsEmployee Assistance Program (legal, financial, and counselling resources)
You can find detailed information at https://www.danaherbenefitsinfo.com/. *US ONLY
OUR OFFER: 
You will be part of a dynamic team in which there is a high focus on delivering results and continuous improvement, but also where having fun and teamwork is very important. It's a fast-paced environment, a consultative role, where you will get to partner with people to achieve their strategic business goals. You will work in a leading global company, with a manager who cares about you, your strengths and will help you to develop the best possible version of yourself. At Danaher, your potential is amplified. Our culture of continuous improvement defines who we are, drives our success, and translates to a career without limits for our team of 65,000 intellectually curious associates. Listen to our voices: https://jobs.danaher.com/global/en/our-difference.
UNSOLICITED ASSISTANCE
We do not accept unsolicited assistance from any headhunters or recruitment firms for any of our job openings. All resumes or profiles submitted by search firms to any employee at any of the Product Identification Platform companies, including Videojet Technologies, X-Rite/Pantone, Esko, Alltec-Foba, Laetus and Linx, in any form without a valid, signed search agreement in place for the specific position, will be deemed the sole property of the Operating Company. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Operating Company as a result of the unsolicited referral.
Danaher Corporation and all Danaher Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law. The ‚ÄúEEO is the Law‚Äù poster is available here.
When you join us, you‚Äôll also be joining Danaher‚Äôs global organization, where 80,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you‚Äôll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.
At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.
If you‚Äôve ever wondered what‚Äôs within you, there‚Äôs no better time to find out.

title: Software Engineer w/ Data Engineering Focus - Hybrid
description:
Are you interested in building robust infrastructure to power a modern analytics platform? Have you worked with complex applications and developing data engineering on top of them to channel data to customers? You could be our next software engineer with a data engineering focus.
In this role‚Ä¶You will be working to develop a modern data platform that makes data and data products available to internal and external users. Collaboration across teams to develop understanding of the applications we develop will be crucial. The technologies you will work with are broad, but mainly we work with Google Cloud for our data platform. Your work will power critical parts of the business and creating high quality infrastructure will be absolutely crucial.
Key skills and knowledge are:Being able to not just write code, but develop software with best practices: you are very comfortable writing tests, you know how to package code,.You have written high quality documentation, code reviews and so forth.An ability to read code and develop a strong understanding of itExcellent communication with technical and non-technical stakeholdersDeep familiarity with the analytics landscape ‚Äì from reporting to machine learning and beyondA strong understanding of SQL and databasesYou would need to bring experience with at least one of the cloud platforms like Google Cloud, Amazon Web Services, Azure and Oracle CloudHigh level of proficiency with git and related developer tooling
We have a match if...Technically:You have at least 3 (three) years of experience writing, packaging and deploying software.You have a high level of proficiency in a SQL database technology, whether that‚Äôs BigQuery, PostgreSQL, or some other.You understand git and how to use it to develop software with a team.You are highly proficient in shell scripting.You pursue learning constantly and make it part of your daily work.Non-technical:You speak fluent English.You have built data infrastructure before and you are familiar with the common pitfalls.You have a ‚Äúroll up your sleeves‚Äù attitude and you take responsibility for your work.Building robust infrastructure is exciting to you.A team player and you want to foster the productivity of your colleagues.You make contributions to open source projects.You believe communication is a key differentiator in how you achieve success and you do not struggle to communicate complex ideas in written or verbal form.
Technologies We Use Google Cloud ‚Äì BigQuery, PubSub, Google Kubernetes EngineOracle Cloud ‚Äì Oracle Database, GoldenGateDatabases ‚Äì BigQuery, PostgreSQL, OracleGolang, PythonKubernetesTerraformGit, shell scriptingJira and BitbucketTableau
What can you expect from us?A well-coordinated, professional team whose working style is characterized by personal responsibility and communicative, active cooperationA corporate culture that promotes long-term contractual relationships and in which flexibility in the organization of working hours, agile working methods, freedom for self-organization and dynamic growth are part of everyday life
What do we offer?Permanent contract (based in Spain)Flexible hybrid work model (home / office)A place to learn and develop key skillsSuperb team in an international working environmentA competitive salary with extra-legal benefitsA career path in a leading player in transportation management softwareDynamic business growth with an agile way of working
ABOUT ALPEGA GROUPAlpega Group is a fast-growing leading software company offering modular solutions to manage transportation logistics from end-to-end. We support professionals in achieving greener transportation processes while reducing their carbon footprint, increasing their efficiency levels, and improving collaboration with their ecosystem.
Join us and shape the future of the supply chain and logistics, because we are #BetterTogether. You can find more about our culture and ways of working at www.alpegagroup.com/en/careers

title: ES- Big Data Engineer AWS
description:

Somos m√°s de 8.500 personas distribuidos en 18 pa√≠ses de EMEA y Oriente Medio y de ellos m√°s de 850 compa√±eros estamos en Espa√±a (y en aumento!!). title: Data Architect - Digital Markets
description:
About Gartner Digital Markets:
Gartner Digital Markets is a business unit within Gartner. Our mission is to help small businesses make the right technology choices and find the tools they need to grow, optimize, and become more effective at what they do. The business is comprised of three top brands‚ÄîCapterra, Software Advice, and GetApp. For candidates interested in taking their next career step in the technology space, Gartner Digital Markets offers the fast pace and excitement of working for a startup, the stability and resources of a large, established organization, and the opportunity to be on the front lines of innovation in an industry that is always growing and transforming.
What we‚Äôre looking for: 
As an Enterprise Data Architect, you will be a key technical expert overseeing GDM's data product build & operations and drive a strong vision for how multiple teams can proactively create a positive impact on the business. As a member of the engineering team, you will help lead the development of very large and complex data applications into cloud environments directly impacting the design, architecture, and implementation of GDM's data products around topics like performance management, vendor services, vendor portal, analytics, reporting and data science.
We are looking for a person who has helped separate business units to operate as a single entity, someone who has demonstrated leadership to make significant changes to move towards centralized solutions for common services and keep autonomy where it makes sense to do so.
Why you‚Äôll want to come to work:
Build the enterprise products that meet high performance, high availability, and maintainability standards, using current and emerging big data technologies. Design scalable patterns and architecture to support both batch and real-time data products & platforms using Microservices, Spark, Kafka, Snowflake or other Cloud data warehousing technologies and SageMaker. Work with product managers, stakeholders , technology teams and data engineers within the enterprise data governance process to define and conceptualize data models across enterprise master data, transaction data, and informational data and implement those models into the enterprise data model. Making tactical architecture decisions to support immediate projects but will be a key expert informing long term data architecture strategy:Design, implement and demonstrate solutions that exhibit the highest levels of performance, security, scalability and reliability to the End-Customer. Leading design and architecture of a feature or product, mentoring and guiding the engineering and product team, performing code reviews for critical features, when necessary, not afraid of jumping in to help with specific programming challenges. Experience solving unstructured data related issues, such as, alignment between producers and consumers, data contracts and schema evolution, versioning and introduction of non breaking changes. GDM is moving towards a real-time, enterprise message bus architecture and we want to ensure data producers move into a more active role of owning and taking responsibility for their data quality and data delivery and more importantly into understanding how the data is going to be used downstream by their consumers for reporting and data science use cases. 
What you‚Äôll bring to the team:
7+ years of experience with Data Lake Infrastructure, Data Warehousing, Data Modelling and Data Analytics tools by working with agile methodology. 10+ years of experience developing enterprise data models. 5+ years of cloud experience in at least one major cloud (Azure, AWS, GCP). Experience in at least one data modeling tool (ER/Studio, Erwin / Miro / Lucidchart).. Experience with at least one massively parallel processing database technology such as Snowflake, Redshift or Synapse. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, along with the strong ability to influence senior level management and stakeholders. Proven track record of leading, mentoring, hiring and scaling technology teams. Strong change manager: comfortable with change, especially that which arises through company growth. Ability to understand and translate business requirements into data and technical requirements. High degree of organization and ability to manage multiple, competing projects and priorities simultaneously. Proven experience working on a data driven company, following Data Governance principles and procedures and helping to define them when needed
Check out our video to learn about who we are, and what we do:
youtube.com/watch?v=oSO_h5VZ9a0
What you‚Äôll find:
Limitless growth and learning opportunities. A collaborative and positive culture - join a diverse team of professionals that are as smart and driven as you. A chance to make an impact - your work will contribute directly to our strategy. Frequent social activities such as movie night, laser tag, bowling, escape room, summer beach party, hiking & bbq, and more!Hybrid environment with flexibility, remote work, Friday afternoons free, and more. New offices close to Gl√≤ries and the beach in the fantastic, ‚Äúinnovation and tech‚Äù 22@ district of sunny Barcelona. Fresh fruit, snacks, selection of teas, fair trade organic coffee and a fridge full of beer for our Thursday Beer O‚ÄôClock. 
What you‚Äôll receive:
Competitive compensation packages. 23 days annual holiday, and additional days off for your birthday, 24th & 31st of December. Access to Pluralsight, Udemy and FrontendMasters online tech skills development platformsPrivate Medical and Dental Care. Life and Disability Insurance. Public Transport Subsidy. Ticket Restaurant Card. Childcare Vouchers (Ticket Guarderia). IncentiFit - annual reimbursement for health-and-wellness-related activities. Spanish lessons. Pension Scheme. Tuition Reimbursement. Employee Stock Purchase Plan. Employee Assistance Program. Gartner Gives Charity Match. Relocation Assistance - a specialist to help you with all the appointments and paperwork. 
What are we:
Action Oriented - Deliver fast, get great results. We embrace the vision, roadmap to success and the action it takes to make it happen. Intellectually Curious - Seek to learn, love to teach. We‚Äôre humble and embrace respectful, radical candor with a mindset of ongoing professional and personal development. Collaborative - One team, shared mission. We welcome feedback and understand the value of working together to accomplish more than what is possible individually. 
Web: gartner.com/en/digital-markets
Careers: jobs.gartner.com/teams/digital-markets
PLEASE NOTE:
 Applications must be submitted in English.  A valid EU visa/passport is required for this position. 
#digitalmarkets
Who are we?
Gartner delivers actionable, objective insight to executives and their teams. Our expert guidance and tools enable faster, smarter decisions and stronger performance on an organization‚Äôs mission-critical priorities. We‚Äôve grown exponentially since our founding in 1979 and we're proud to have over 19,500 associates globally that support over 15,000 client enterprises in more than 100 countries.
What makes Gartner a great place to work?
Our teams are composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations. We believe that a diversity of experiences makes us stronger‚Äîas individuals, as communities and as an organization. That‚Äôs why we're recognized worldwide as a great place to work year after year. We've been recognized by Fortune as one of the World‚Äôs Most Admired Companies, named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index and a Best Place to Work for Disability Inclusion by the Disability Equality Index. Looking for a place to turn your big ideas into reality? Join #LifeAtGartner
What we offer:
Our people are our most valuable asset, so we invest in them from Day 1. When you join our team, you‚Äôll have access to a vast array of benefits to help you live your life well. These resources are designed to support your physical, financial and emotional well-being. We encourage continued personal and professional growth through ongoing learning and development opportunities. Our employee resource groups, charity match and volunteer programs keep you connected to your internal Gartner community and causes that matter to you.

title: Mid/Senior Data Engineer
description:
Hi there üëã
As Factorial continues scaling our mission of boosting the next generation of people-first SMB‚Äôs, we‚Äôre hiring Mid and Senior Data Engineers to scale our Engineering team. We just raised a new round to continue to provide organisations around the globe with the best tools, information and knowledge to help their people succeed.
The Team
Factorial‚Äôs mission is to empower business make better decisions, and data is a key component in achieving so.
Our Team is responsible of unlocking communication between the different areas despite the technological stack by offering a self service platform that allows fast data driven products.
We act under the data mesh principle and we‚Äôre not afraid to build whatever is necessary to fulfil our neighbour team‚Äôs needs.
Our data platform is already offering the following services:
Ingestion (SaaS APIs - Airbyte, DDBBs - Debezium, Streams - Kafka Connect)Storage (Data Lake - Delta, Stream Storage- Kafka)Catalogue (Atlan)Modeling (Metabolic)Activation (Hightouch)Exploration & Visualization (Superset)On demand Data Products (TinyBird)
We‚Äôre looking for Data Engineers to enable product and engineering teams use these and future services, and assist them in making data products a first class citizen.
The Role
At Factorial, we have a team of +150 very talented developers. We are looking for engineers who can wear many hats, abstract problems, and find creative solutions. We look for smart people who are curious, proactive and have good soft/communication skills.
We are not looking for a long list of skills and technologies. Our web stack is Ruby on Rails for the backend and React/React-native for the clients, and we interact with Data through SQL on AWS, but it‚Äôs not mandatory to be proficient in those (most of the team came with other areas of expertise which is very enriching). We believe that someone who has good aptitudes and is hungry for learning is what works best.
If you‚Äôre looking for new challenges in a people-first company without depending on where you live, this is what to expect:
 You will evangelise the use of our Data Platform among technical users and empower the creation of Factorial's next Data Products. You will listen, identify and evaluate new requirements from Stakeholders (Engineering, Product, Management, Sales, Customer Experience, Marketing, Growth). You will iterate and improve existing features of our platform as well as develop new ones. You will occasionally assist Data Analysts with their technical challenges. You will occasionally contribute in managing the platform from a DataOps point of view. 
Your profile
 You are a team player: You are comfortable helping your teammates, sharing your knowledge, reviewing their code and asking for reviews of your own. You have a user-centric mindset: You know that the only reason we write code is to help the users of Factorial to perform their tasks. You like relaxed and fun environments: We work hard and we are committed to Factorial users but we do that in a fun and relaxed atmosphere. We don't take ourselves too much seriously. You are a learner: You want to improve your skills not only in the engineering field but across any other areas. You are an owner: You like proposing new hypotheses and be responsible for building, deploying and validating them. You love understanding: Breaking down complex problems into basic and shareable elements and you have evolved concrete implementations to abstractions before. You are a polyglot developer: You have experience in several coding languages, CI/CD tools and cloud technologies. You are a mentor: You love to share your experience and expertise to help others grow. You are comfortable communicating in English. 
Your background
Experience in building a modern Data Platform.Functional programming in Scala (or any other JVM language). Spark development, especially Structured Streaming, or equivalent (Flink, Beam, Samza,...)
Nice-to-haves
Knowledge of the AWS Analytics Stack (Glue, S3, Athena, Redshift, Kinesis, Lake Formation)Advanced Analytical SQL knowledge.Some alternative coding experience, ideally with a background of web development.Some alternative infrastructure experience, ideally in Kubernetes.Some infrastructure as code experience, ideally with Terraform on Cloud.GitOps driven mentality and data CI/CD ideas.
At Factorial we don't evaluate you by the years of experience you have, we evaluate your knowledge and skills. How are we doing it? We have a Career Path with a rubric framework where we define what is expected for each experience level and skill we're evaluating. This framework will allow you to know at which level you're right now and what do you need to continue growing in the company.
As we love transparency (it's one of our hiring values), our Career Path includes the salaries for each level and we share it during the first interview to make sure we're aligned.
We're a remote-friendly company so you can apply from anywhere in the world and English is our official language so this is the only one you need to succeed at Factorial!
To wrap up:
We're looking for a Scala Data Engineers with Spark Streaming and Kafka experience.40.000‚Ç¨-55.000‚Ç¨ Salary (Mid - Senior) + ESOP plan regardless of your location.Remote-first work environment, the team is distributed.1.000‚Ç¨ of annual Learning and Development budget.A safe and diverse environment to grow and make an impact.
And when at the office:
 Syra discounts Breakfast and organic fruit Free caffeine and theine Pet-Friendly work environment
Is this you?! Come rock the world with us! üöÄ We #betonpeople üíú
About Factorial HR ü§ì
Factorial is an all-in-one HR Software fast-growing startup founded 5 years ago. Our mission is to help small and medium companies automate HR workflows, centralize people data and make better business decisions. Currently serves thousands of customers in over 60 countries all over the world and across industries, it has built a super diverse and multicultural team of over +800 people in Barcelona, Brazil, Mexico and EEUU offices.
Do you want to know more about us? We've won awards and received outstanding customer feedback since day one. It has closed over 120M‚Ç¨ in funding with top international venture capital firms (Tiger, CRV, Creandum, Point Nine Capital and K Fund). Take a look and see how we started: The origin üï≥

title: Data Engineer SAP BW/4HANA
description:
***This role is open to remote work from any location within Portugal or Spain***
Joining the Global HR Reporting and People Analytics Team as an Data Engineer you will be responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining data pipelines and architectures that support the HR Function needs. You will be working closely with cross-functional teams, including business analysts, IT professionals, and HR experts, to design and implement data solutions to enable TUI to make informed business decisions.
About The Job
Developing and maintaining the data architecture in SAP BW/4HANA.Managing the pipeline (collection, storage, access), engineering (cleansing, feature creation/selection), and understanding (documentation, exploration) of data. Assembling large, complex data sets that meet functional and technical business requirements. Building and maintaining architectures for optimal ETL from a wide variety of data sources using SAP BW/4HANA, SQL big data technologies, flat files, and APIs. Ensure data quality and accuracy by performing data profiling, cleansing, and validation. Working with IT, data specialists, and other relevant team members to ensure that requested data and related process changes are scalable, secure, and compliant with company policies and regulations. Following and maintaining operational and control procedures as a part of an agile team. Collaborating with the business and HR experts to identify business requirements and translating them into data-driven solutions. Stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies in data engineering, and apply them to our business needs. 
About You
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, highly advantageous. Strong professional experience delivering data solutions. Strong HANA (Cloud Environment) development background with experience in SAP BW/4HANA or or SAP BW/HANA. Strong knowledge of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing. Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases. Experience with Tableau data visualization tool. Experience with SAP SuccessFactors business content. Analytical, conceptual, and implementation skills. Technical skills in ABAP Core Data Services (CDS) modeling is a plus. Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools such as Python or Airflow are a plus. Experience with AWS cloud services is a plus. 
About Our Offer
Competitive salary and benefits as standard. Career progression opportunities in more than 50 countries worldwide. Develop yourself as part of a friendly, richly diverse and virtual international team. An exceptional approach to your learning - access to free learning platforms. 
TUI Group is the world‚Äôs number one integrated tourism business. As we continue to build our Global Purchasing function, we will move from operating as a set of largely independent source markets with common management of procurement towards a more global, integrated function, which will accelerate the delivery of our ambitious growth plans.
If you want to know more about why TUI Group is the world‚Äôs leading tourism group, and our continuing work in the diversity & inclusion space, simply visit www.careers.tuigroup.com
#TUIjobs

title: Data Solutions Delivery Engineer
description:
Our opportunity 
The Data Management team is responsible for defining the data management strategy as well as setting up and expanding the strategic BI & Analytics landscape of Zurich Switzerland as part of numerous projects. We are a young and motivated team and are looking for active support in the further development of the existing data platform.
In this role, as a member of the Platform Team inside Data Management, you will be part of an agile team and provide services to other development/service teams, as well as ensure ongoing services. Specifically, you will support the release process, support the development and application of development standards and support the correct operation of existing processes, among others.
 Your role 
 As a Solution Engineer DWH/BI you are mainly responsible for: 

 Support the release and deployment processes.  Development, validation and documentation of design concepts and target solution architecture.  Support the f urther development of architecture and development standards.  Execution of database queries and analyses in the context of support or ad-hoc inquiries.  Maintenance and support of the developed solutions and documentation (DevOps, 3rd level).  Help diagnosing incidents and contribute to the solution.  Support the general, technical improvement of the platform.  Within a project take direction from more senior architects, e.g., other solution architectures or functional area architects. Perform or execute given assignments under supervision.  Contribute to the development and maintenance of IT enterprise architecture, standards and practices by maintaining understanding of current and future technology developments.  Design, document and implement solutions to automate business processes/activities. 

Additional duties:

 Support the analysis of technical requirements and user acceptance tests, as well as ensuring the clean handover to operations.  Support of test management (planning, design and testing).  Prepare solution design documents, presentations and other materials, using established formats and standard software and templates.  Provide consultation for specific area of technology to project efforts within various IT areas and/or external service providers.  Identify, in collaboration with the functional area architect, existing IT software assets for new opportunities (e.g., re-use) through project and program involvement. 

Your Qualifications And Experience
 As a Solution Engineer DWH/BI, you have the following skills and qualifications: 

 Practical experience as a developer or in a similar function in the field of data warehousing and data integration, ideally in larger DWH/BI projects.  Knowledge of solution architectures for DWH/BI applications and the use of BI & Analytics tools, ideally Microsoft BI stack and Azure pipelines.  Practical experience in database and DWH development, ideally with DWH automation tools such as WhereScape RED.  Experience in agile frameworks such as Scrum or SAFe.  Very good knowledge of English (German would be a plus).  Open, communicative and assertive personality.  Experience in data quality management and knowledge of data modeling (3NF, Star Schema) would be a plus. 

Additional Information
 As well as a competitive salary and a yearly bonus we offer benefits package which includes: 

 Option to work remotely within Spain even up to 100% - you choose  Flexible working hours  Wide range of internal and external trainings  Free English and Spanish classes depending on the needs  Ticket restaurant  Life Insurance  Pension Plan - after 1 year in the company  Referral bonus if you bring other talented people like you  Special banking and insurance conditions  Exclusive Employees discounts 

Primary work location is Barcelona, Poblenou. Option to telework from any location within Spain territory is also feasible.
We are looking forward to receiving your application!
Please apply with your CV in English.
Who We Are
Looking for a challenging and inspiring work environment where you can make a difference? At Zurich millions of individuals and businesses place their trust in our products and services every day. Our 53,000 employees worldwide form the basis of our success, enabling, businesses and communities to face a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You‚Äôd give them confidence and reassurance by protecting what they love most. It‚Äôs a big challenge, but you will be supported by a world-class team who believe in helping you to reach your full potential and deliver on our promises.
So be challenged. Be inspired. Help us make a difference.
At Zurich we are an equal opportunity employer. We attract and retain the best qualified individuals available, without regard to race/ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability.
Why Zurich
At Zurich, we like to think outside the box and challenge the status quo. We take an optimistic approach by focusing on the positives and constantly asking What can go right?
We are an equal opportunity employer who knows that each employee is unique - that‚Äôs what makes our team so great!
Join us as we constantly explore new ways to protect our customers and the planet .

 Location(s): ES - Barcelona  Remote working: Yes  Schedule: Full Time  Recruiter name: Laura Santamar√≠a Rodr√≠guez

title: REVIT PROJECT ENGINEER - PREFAB DATA CENTERS
location: Sant Boi de Llobregat, Catalonia, Spain
description:
THE PROJECT ENGINEER Do you dream of working in a company that is driven by a meaningful purpose? An inclusive company that empowers you to do your best and be innovative?


Position Summary

The Project Engineer is responsible for understanding the technical requirements of the project. He or she shall thoroughly understand the design documents, specifications, references, and project scope. The Project Engineer‚Äôs role includes coordinating and preparing all technical documentation to build a prefab solution according to customer requirements within time schedule and the defined quality. Strict attention to detail, understanding of time constraints, and implications of proper documentation all add up to an effective Project Engineer. As part of the engineering team the Project Engineer will be working closely with Project Managers, Technical Leaders and Production Specialist (Factories), this position is responsible for the technical portion of projects at execution stages.

Roles and Responsibilities
Thoroughly understand the design documents, specifications, references, and project scope.Keep minutes for all regular and technical design meetings.Identify, review, collect, verify and store all project technical documents as they are available during the project.Maintain the general project files. (Autodesk Construction Cloud, Sharepoint etc‚Ä¶)Maintain the Engineering issues Log & Project Engineer Book. (Sharepoint folder)Develop Approval drawings to meet customer scope (Submittal Package)Revise and approve fabrication drawings (Revit and Inventor)Perform change management for design documents and customer submittalsTrack all technical design deviations and notify project/ design team for resolution.Manage all engineering works schedule and assign tasks to designers and SME‚Äôs. (specialists)Develop major BOM (Bill of Material) for the project.Coordinate internal periodic design reviews with designers and SME‚Äôs (Execution phase)Create and distribute submittal requests based on project requirements.Maintain and track submittals and shop drawingsMaintain and track engineering hours budget.Maintain current design documents with all addenda and redlines.Maintain phone/correspondence log.Perform QC during the integration phase to ensure compliance with design documents.Manage handover to Factory Production SpecialistsPrepare all final documentation for the project including (as built drawings, certificates, O&M documents, Spare Part lists)Secure all warranties and guarantees from subcontractors and vendors as defined in the design documents, specifications, and contract.Ensure all changes to the design documents are redlined to manage the final as-built documents.

General duties include:
Working with Technical Leaders or Project Managers to deliver technical information to customer on time.Establishing, maintaining, conducting, and policing detailed procedures for the submittal, review, coordination, approval, and distribution of shop drawings, samples, etc.Establishing and maintaining all Project Engineering files related to subcontract and bid package records, plans, specifications, changes, clarifications, and as-built documents.



The following educational requirements apply to this position:
University Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering Programs (Electrical or Mechanical Engineering are preferred)

The following skills apply to this position:
Coordinate for project documentation from electrical, mechanical, plumbing, architectural, and structural discipline to meet customer requirements and production constraints.Working with other team members, Technical Leaders, contractors/vendors and consultants to resolve technical issues and to ensure the quality and integrity of engineering design executions.Optimizing designs in compliance with relevant regulatory codes, standards and best practices.Proven skills in written and oral communication of technical information.Excellent communication, organization and teamwork skills with the ability to pay a high level of attention to detail.Capacity to work under pressure in order to meet deadlines.Functional knowledge using Microsoft Office suite, Autodesk REVIT, Autodesk Construction Cloud , AutoCAD 2D and Adobe Acrobat Pro.Mandatory experience working in REVIT at least 1 year.Fluent in English
Experience (not mandatory but very valuable)
Data Center critical infrastructure knowledge (Power, Cooling, Monitoring)Building or industrial installations (Cabling, lighting, piping, plumbing)


What we can offer you:You can look forward to growing your career in a dynamic workplace with significant personal responsibility and attractive development opportunitiesFlexible working models to ensure a balance of family and working lifeOptimal support on your career path through regular training opportunitiesA dynamic and personal atmosphere, working with a global energised teamA company culture that encourages performance and cooperationAn attractive compensation package including the comprehensive fringe benefits expected of an international companyWe are proudly participating in the Disability Confident Program offering support to people in the workplace who consider themselves living with a disability.

Let us learn about you! Apply today.

title: Director Business Development (AI Data Solutions)
description:
TransPerfect helps organizations navigate the global marketplace. It remains founder-led ‚Äì and has striven to maintain the ethos and drive that led them to grow organically year-on-year for the past 30 years. Starting in an NYU dorm room in the early 1990s, TransPerfect is recognized as the largest translation and language services company in the world, with thousands of employees located in 90+ offices around the world, surpassing $1 billion in revenue in 2021.
OverviewThe Business Development Director (AI Solutions) will manage tracks of work and act as a strategic customer partner within the AI Solutions group.AI Solutions is a new, rapidly growing division offering high-quality data for Human-Machine Interaction to some of the most prestigious technology companies in the world. Our department focuses on gathering, enriching, and processing training data for Machine Learning in different AI domains.
The ideal candidate will have experience in B2B sales, as well as skills related to strategic analysis and marketing. You will be responsible for developing client relationships, negotiating contracts, and closing deals. We will rely on you to partner with our marketing department to conduct market research and develop business development plans.
A successful Business Development Director (AI Solutions) will have solid sales & client management and problem-solving skills, and the ability to build strong relationships with client and internal teams in multiple geographies.
Required SkillsProven experience defining project logistics, resources, and production processesExcellent planning, organizational, and communication skillsExcellent written and verbal communication skills in EnglishIndependent, self-motivated, results-oriented, and dynamicAbility to work under tight deadlines and with geographically dispersed teamsExcellent interpersonal and negotiation skillsAdvanced knowledge of project management and reporting tools
Required Experience and QualificationsMinimum Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence or related fields,Minimum 5 years of experience in B2B Sales,Experience in building and growing multi-million dollar portfolios,Prior experience in managing complex projects,Leadership experience in managing diverse geographical teams,Prior experience in client consulting, solutions design, and sales methodologies,Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, including Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Access and industry-specific analysis software,Basic understanding of the industry, with the ability to become a subject matter expert on the job,Innovation and problem-solving skills that include the ability to develop and propose expert data solutions for our clients,Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with proven ability to work under pressure and delivery against deadlines
Desired Skills and ExperiencePrior experience in the Artificial Intelligence industryAbility for multitask and organize administrative workDegree in Machine Intelligence, Artificial Intelligence, Project Management, or related disciplineProficiency in a foreign languageA strong consulting background is preferred but not a requirementAdvanced business degree
By applying, I confirm I have read and accept TransPerfect's Privacy Policy: https://www.transperfect.com/about/data-privacy-recruiting

title: Senior Tools and Data Pipeline Engineer - Digital Legends
description:
Job Title
Senior Tools and Data Pipeline Engineer - Digital Legends
Requisition ID
R021006
Job Description
Digital Legends is an Activision independent Studio based in Barcelona, formed by industry veterans and emerging talent who are focused on delivering a AAA gaming experience to mobile devices. Since it was founded in 2001, the studio has been a pioneer in mobile game development. It has a long, established history as a leading mobile development studio with a number of high-quality mobile titles built from the ground-up to its credits, including the award winning The Respawnables‚Ñ¢ series of games. We are creating an all-new, AAA mobile experience that will bring the thrilling, fluid and large-scale action of Call of Duty¬Æ: Warzone‚Ñ¢ to players on the go.
We are looking for a Senior Tools and data pipeline engineer to work on the core technology behind the game, especially the data pipeline to improve the support of mobile platforms.
Your Responsibilities
Support, develop and implement systems/tools to manage game asset and content.Contribute to R&D and finding creative solutions to improve current techniques and workflows.Deliver high quality work accorded to schedule.
Your Skills
Proficient in C++ programming language.Extensive experience with code and data debug and optimization.4+ years‚Äô game programming experience in a similar position.Experience optimizing pipelines and toolsA proactive attitude and open to receiving and implementing feedback.Working level of English.
It Is Always a Plus
C# or Python knowledge.3D math skills (linear algebra, vector math).Experience with software performance analysis, optimizations, and low-level programming.Experience in mobile development.
What We Offer
Competitive salary based on your experience.A wide range of perks such as private health and dental insurance, ticket restaurant, wellbeing voucher, 25 days + xmas period holidays and more.
And a great team of super skilled individuals that can help you grow as a professional.
We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide. Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do. At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.

title: Data Engineering Manager - Customer squad
description:
Back Market is the world‚Äôs leading refurbished electronics marketplace with a team of 700 people, powering operations in 17 countries (and counting!).
Named one of the World's Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company in 2019 and again in 2021, our mission is simple: empowering people to consume tech sustainably by offering folks a high quality, accessible, and more eco-friendly alternative to buying new electronics. Why? Refurbished tech helps lower our collective environmental impact . We have indeed contributed to avoid the production of more than 1,000,000‚ÄØtons of CO2e worldwide since our launch in 2014.
Be part of an exciting and growing international adventure that will change the way the world consumes tech.
Are you a data-driven leader who is passionate about building reliable, high-performing, and secure data infrastructures and tools? Do you want to have a meaningful impact on a fast-growing company like Back Market? Here is an exciting opportunity for you!
As the Engineering Manager of the Customer data team , you will have the unique opportunity to shape and develop the end-to-end scope of the team, which is composed among others of:
 all data linked to the marketing . all the data engineering needs for the top management (COMEX) all the data needs coming from the tribe in charge of customers in the Bureau of Technology You will manage a well-balanced team of five data and analytics engineers, who are distributed across different offices and remote locations.
What you'll be doing :
Managers at Back Market build sustainable and efficient teams, by empowering people and building the proper environment.You are responsible of having a tech vision for your team, aligned with the objectives of the company, and execute itYou build and execute a growth plan, via hiring but more importantly by ensuring the development of people and teams through open communication, feedback, and continuous coachingEnsure the team keeps a frugal and sustainable mindset (people, infra, solution, resources...). spending is fine, wasting is not.You work in an agile "build it and run it" environment where engineering teams build, launch, monitor and support the sections they own, incrementaly.You identify and make improvements in our processes, practices, and product
You are in the right place if : 
You are people-first oriented and know how to build and run a high-performing team You embrace the servant leadership principles as much as you value empathy and cordial debates over a "top-down" management posture ;Production health is a priority for you ;You work well with non-tech partners, explain tech constraints and yet try to solve their problems, even by getting your hands dirty from time to time ;You are able to understand the tech challenges of your team and guide them through decisions. Our stack is AWS (Lambda, dynamodb), GCP (Big Query, Data Catalog), Spark (Delta), Terragrunt, Terraform, Datadog, Python, Scala.You have great communication skills in English
Recruitment process :
 Call with Yann, Tech recruiter Management principles interview with your future manager Data Engineering interview with your future peers Stakeholders interview with your future colleagues Back Market value interview
WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US ?
 A meaningful job: you will help avoid thousands of tons of electronic waste and fight against planned obsolescence. It counts! A meaningful company: we became a mission-driven company in January 2022. Be part of a worldwide growing company based in Europe, the USA and Asia to face great challenges : you will have the freedom to innovate and adopt new ideas! Work alongside passionate experts: who will share their knowledge and help you develop and grow in your career. Grow your career: with a flexible career path and a dedicated Learning & Development team. Back Market will help you evolve with personalized internal trainings and external handpicked providers from day 1! Leadership Academy by Back Market:‚Äúbe a coach not a dictator‚Äù is at the core of this program ! We train and enable all our leaders to support their team towards achieving goals. Be a manager at Back Market is an unique experience we take by heart. An attractive salary, equity and a host of benefits including : Lunch voucher, health insurance, relocation package, paid time off for activism in your community, parental benefits, flexible hours, etc‚Ä¶ One Loving Tribe: you will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced, open-minded and friendly environment. Be part of one of our Employee Resource Groups createdaround shared identities, common backgrounds and/or special interests crafted to be a safe space and an expressive outlet. Several internal events: The Monday Brief (weekly)/ The Somehands (monthly)/ The All Hands (annual). We‚Äôre here to SABOTAGE: It‚Äôs our mantra. It keeps us focused on what we aspire to be: a little bit sneaky, always smart, kinda frugal and constantly conspiring to create maximum impact.
Back Market is an Equal Opportunity Employer which means we pledge to not discriminate against employees based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetic information.. If reasonable accommodations are needed for the interview process, please do not hesitate to discuss this with the Talent Acquisition Team.
Back Market is helping to address one of the biggest challenges of our time: climate change. We take this so seriously that we were awarded status as a ‚ÄúSoci√©t√© √† Mission‚Äù, or company with a social mission, by the French government. We know we can‚Äôt tackle a global problem without a globally representative team so we are committed to embedding diversity, equity and inclusion principles in every aspect of our organization. But more importantly, being One Loving & Free Spirited Tribe is in our DNA as it is one of the five foundational values of our company since we got started way back in 2014. We are committed to hiring and supporting diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We know our lofty goals cannot be reached unless everyone has a seat at the table along with the resources and opportunity to grow.

title: Data Science Associate Director, Oncology R&D
description:
AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world‚Äôs most serious disease. But we‚Äôre more than one of the world‚Äôs leading pharmaceutical companies.
At AstraZeneca we‚Äôre dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There‚Äôs no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration. Always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development.
Innovate and push the boundaries of science in Oncology R&D
Join a dedicated Oncology team that‚Äôs growing fast and building a strong track record of success. Our pioneering approach is identifying and treating patients earlier, focusing on early stage cancer trials and listening and evolving based on their needs. As a team we are deeply committed to transforming the lives of patients living with cancer ‚Äì with the ultimate aim of eliminating cancer as a cause of death. There‚Äôs no better place to make an impact ‚Äì here we are uniquely placed with the funding, the ambition and the bravery to make it happen.
About the role:
As an Data Science Associate Director you will play a key role on the front line in this expert team working to extract insight from high-dimensional biomedical data and to drive best practise in the statistical analysis of bioinformatic data. You will develop your leadership skills and apply and develop your expertise in rigorous quantitative data science to provide solutions to a variety of data science and statistical challenges, researching, recommending and delivering novel methodologies to solve the problems that matter to the oncology pipeline. You will work to enable robust decision making from high-dimensional data throughout the oncology pipeline, developing pragmatic solutions to complex mathematical and statistical problems, clearly communicating risk, uncertainty, and impact on decision making.
Your day to day work will include:
Developing statistical and machine learning models to accelerate decision making, both internally and externally.Consultancy to drive best practise in the statistical analysis of bioinformatic data across the early drug portfolio.Working with a range of stakeholders across the oncology drug pipeline to ensure that models are fit for purpose, and that the insights derived from the models are clearly communicated.
Developing best practice for predictive modelling, and working to educate stakeholders in both the benefits and the limitations of this approach.
Essential For The Role
Relevant PhD (or equivalent graduate plus applied experience) demonstrating technical expertise in applied mathematics or applied biostatistics, or similar.Experience in Bayesian or other advanced statistical learning techniques, and the drive to continue to learn and develop these skills.R / Python programming expertise in Unix high performance computing environment.Demonstrated experience applying a range of statistical learning techniques in practice.Demonstrated experience working with business customers to help formulate business problems as rigorous quantitative questions, and translating analysis results to business recommendations.
Desirable
Experience within the pharmaceutical industryIn-depth experience of working in a global organization with complex/geographical context
Why AstraZeneca?
At AstraZeneca when we see an opportunity for change, we seize it and make it happen, because any opportunity no matter how small, can be the start of something big. Delivering life-changing medicines is about being entrepreneurial - finding those moments and recognising their potential. Join us on our journey of building a new kind of organisation to reset expectations of what a bio-pharmaceutical company can be. This means we‚Äôre opening new ways to work, pioneering cutting edge methods and bringing unexpected teams together. Interested? Come and join our journey. 
Alternatives can also be found on the Employer Brand Toolkit, try to use other examples in order to make it different if candidates ‚Äì https://az.app.box.com/file/98215432521
So, what‚Äôs next! 
Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can‚Äôt wait to hear from you. If you‚Äôre curious to know more then please reach out to (contact person)
Where can I find out more?
Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/
Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/
Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en
If you have site, country or departmental social media then feel free to switch any of the above links.

title: Senior Tools and Data Pipeline Engineer
description:
Digital Legends is an Activision independent Studio based in Barcelona, formed by industry veterans and emerging talent who are focused on delivering a AAA gaming experience to mobile devices. Since it was founded in 2001, the studio has been a pioneer in mobile game development. It has a long, established history as a leading mobile development studio with a number of high-quality mobile titles built from the ground-up to its credits, including the award winning The Respawnables‚Ñ¢ series of games. We are creating an all-new, AAA mobile experience that will bring the thrilling, fluid and large-scale action of Call of Duty¬Æ: Warzone‚Ñ¢ to players on the go.
We are looking for a Senior Tools and data pipeline engineer to work on the core technology behind the game, especially the data pipeline to improve the support of mobile platforms.
Your responsibilities:
Support, develop and implement systems/tools to manage game asset and content.Contribute to R&D and finding creative solutions to improve current techniques and workflows.Deliver high quality work accorded to schedule.

C# or Python knowledge.3D math skills (linear algebra, vector math).Experience with software performance analysis, optimizations, and low-level programming.Experience in mobile development.
 What we offer:

At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.

title: Associate Director DD&IT IM Data Solution Delivery
description:

It is home to associates who work to deliver on the Novartis purpose of reimagining medicine to improve and extend people‚Äôs lives. As part of our continued evolution, we are looking for an Associate Director, Data Solution Delivery to join our team in Spain!

 Develop a strategic capability to build product/services roadmaps from concept to development to launch, encompassing technology adoption, product engineering, service design, security and compliance, and business process change. Minimum Requirements

Collaborate with business in gathering requirements, grooming product backlogs, driving delivery, and ongoing data product enhancements. Why consider Novartis?

title: SAP Data Migration
description:
Transform, Grow, Collaborate! - SAP Data Migration Center of Excellence

From the Data Migration CoEx of Accenture Spain, we are looking for TALENT to help us digitally transform the largest national and international companies.

TALENT to be part of large teams with deep technological and industrial knowledge.

TALENT capable of carrying out major business transformations based on processes and technology, implementing SAP in innovative solutions.

If SAP is your passion and you want to transform, grow and collaborate, you are probably part of our project.

About Accenture

Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services at scale in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all off these services.

We combine unmatched experience and specialized capabilities across more than 40 industries ‚Äì powered by the world‚Äôs largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers.

With 513,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture brings continuous innovation to help clients improve their performance and create lasting value across their enterprises.

About The Role

Working closely with clients our Technology professionals provide application services, intelligent platform services, software engineering, and cloud, infrastructure and security services. It also leads our R&D activities (Labs), our investments in emerging technologies (Ventures), and our ecosystem relationships.

We are currently looking for SAP Data Migration in Spain with at least 5-7 years experience, fluent English level and availability to travel.

Responsible for the design of data cleaning solutions and extraction, transformation and loading processes in transition projects to S/4HANA. Analysis of the data problems identified in the migration tests. Support to the business in data migration validation. More than 5 years of experience in the implementation of SAP projects. Experience in the role of functional data migration manager. Experience in the use of tools such as SAP ADM, LTMC (Data MIgration Cockpit) or SAP Data Services. Data analysis capacity. Good level of communication. Good level of English at conversational level
